name: Stunde Null
description:
Stunde Null is the German language equivalent of "zero hour", a term taken from military planning that indicates the beginning of some operation or event. In Germany, Stunde Null has a particular reference: midnight on May 8, 1945, when the capitulation of the Nazi forces' high command came into effect, marking the end of World War II in Europe. The period immediately thereafter became known as the Nachkriegszeit ("time after the war").

In this game, the players asume the role of the reconstruction of Germany after the World War II, managing action cards, construction cards and event cards, that come into play using dices. At the end of the game, the player who has built more prestigious buildings will be the winner.



SPANISH:

Stunde Null es el equivalente en alemán de "la hora cero", un término prestado de la planificación militar que indica el comienzo de una operación o evento. En Alemania, Stunde Null tiene una referencia particular: medianoche del 8 de mayo de 1945, cuando capitularon las fuerzas nazis, dando fin así a la Segunda Guerra Mundial en Europa. El período inmediatamente posterior se conoce como Nachkriegszeit ("tiempo después de la guerra").

En este juego, los jugadores asumen el papel de reconstruir Alemania después de la Segunda Guerra Mundial, mediante la gestión de cartas de acción, construcción y sucesos, que se ponen en juego mediante el uso de dados. Al final de la partida, aquel que haya construido más edificios de prestigio será el vencedor.
categories: Card Game, Dice, World War II

name: Expedition Planning
description:
Expedition Planning is a hand management and blind-bidding game for 2 to 4 players.

You are the Captain of a prestigious explorers' guild. As their leader, you will send your explorers on various expeditions in order to retrieve the earth's most valuable treasures. All of this in order to increase your guild's prestige. You will have to do this while avoiding or fighting off as many dangers as possible because losing against those ferocious creatures would tarnish your reputation!

Each of the items you are after is part of these ancient collections. If your explorers are able to retrieve all treasures in order to form a complete collection, they become even more valuable!

Ready your explorers, but make the right choice on who you send as other explorers are after the same Treasures! Whoever has the most prestigious guild in the end wins at this game!

Goal of the Game

Over the course of 4 rounds, you will play Explorer cards from your hand in order to win Treasure cards that are worth Victory Points (VPs), while avoiding Danger cards that are worth negative VPs. At the end of the 4 rounds, the player with the most Victory Points is declared the winner.

name: Life is Card
description:
Life is Card is a deceptively simple social card game where everyone playing decides on a scenario and goal and then proceeds to attempt to complete it using six fundamental actions. A game can last from five minutes to an hour and is appropriate for most ages.

The game can be played cooperatively using one person as the antagonist or, more commonly, competitively.

Gameplay: The players collectively decide on a scenario that includes a goal and a limitation or two (the rule book describes several scenarios). They then draw six cards and pick one to play all at the same time, action order resolves by the numbers printed on the cards from highest to lowest with each player describing their action. The next turn all players pass their cards to the player on the left and draw back up to six. A winner is determined when the scenario is either completed or impossible to finish.

Cards: The six action cards are Grab, Use, Position, Plan, Rest, and Delay
Grab: You pick something up, pull something down, restrain something, etc. Anything having to do with grabbing.
Position: Anything related to movement: yourself, a shopping cart, your laser pistol. You can only position something you already have in your possession or grabbed earlier in the game.
Use: Activating something, whether or not it is the item's primary intention. Turning on a stove, throwing a grenade, pushing that shiny red button.
Plan: Just like a wild card, you can use a Plan to pull any card out of the draw pile and immediately use it. The card you drew keeps the number from the “Plan” card for action order.
Rest: This card does not have numbers. Leave this card in front of you, sit back, and relax this turn while the others blunder away. On any later turn, you may discard this card to play two from your hand (be sure to draw back up to six cards). These two additional cards still adhere to the action order based on their numbers.
Delay: These cards also do not have numbers. If you play one, you can pick someone to delay their action until they are last in the action order after they have stated their action. You may also play another action card. You cannot Delay a Rest and you cannot play another Delay card as your additional action card.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Card Game, Party Game

name: Da Scramble Pidign Crossword Game
description:
Da Scramble Pidgin Crossword Game is a tile-laying word game using the Pidgin language, particularly as spoken in Hawaii. A pile of letter tiles is placed face-down on the table. Each player in turn rolls two six-sided dice, takes that many letters from the pile, and tries to make a Pidgin word or phrase from them. All drawn tiles are kept face-up. If unable to place a word, the player passes his or her turn to the next player who rolls, collects letters and tries to lay down a word. Once a word is laid down, all words must connect in crossword fashion similar to Scrabble. Although tiles may not be moved once played, players may steal tiles from other players to complete words or phrases (but be careful! This can help them). The game ends when all letters have been drawn and either one player plays his or her last letter or no more words can be made by any player. The player with the fewest tiles left wins. The game comes with a small pamphlet-size Pidgin dictionary, but players are encourage to use their knowledge of the language to settle disputes.

The game comes packaged in a cardboard tube.

name: Punctuation Bingo
description:
From the box:'
"Play your way to punctuation know-how with BINGO! Beginners and experts alike have an equal chance for BINGO, and everyone wins punctuation pointers every round."

Punctuation Bingo is an educational twist on traditional Bingo. Each player has a bingo card with two rows of four spaces each. On each space, a sentence with a missing punctuation mark is printed. The caller chooses and reads a card showing a punctuation mark and describing its use. Players must then search their bingo cards for a sentence missing that punctuation mark and mark it. When one player has completed the chosen pattern, he or she says "bingo," the marked sentences are checked, and if correct, that player wins.

name: Forgotten Kingdom
description:
Once upon a time.....

Their was a great King that ruled over all the kingdom. This was the land of the fairy tales of long ago. The land where all the stories told at your bedtime came to life, where all your favourite childhood heroes and all those fearful villains coexisted in harmony. But with His Majesty’s sudden disappearance, this once tranquil kingdom was thrown into chaos.

Forgotten Kingdom provides players with a unique and fully customizable gameplay, with a rule set that allows for shorter and longer games. Certain character combinations YOU choose compliment each other by enhancing their abilities. This provides a different and challenging gameplay experiance each time.

Before you begin, ensure that each player recieves an equal set of identical cards. Each player takes their deck of characters and shuffles them, drawing eight cards. During each turn of the game, players will assign a character from their hand, placing it face down on the table.

Players will simultaneously reveal their character. Each player resolves the forgotten ability (Discard) first, followed by their character ability in play. The player with the total power after the forgotten and character abilities are resolved, wins the round and adds ONE to the total points earned on the score tracker. Both players discard their character to the forgotten and play begins again.

The first player to get the desired victory points decided on before the game begins wins!

name: Bounty Hunter: 1881
description:
The American southwest: 1881. The “iron horses” are operating in these parts regularly now, and the turn of the century is near. The rise of cities out here is clearly on the event horizon, as ever-increasing numbers of “civilized” easterners move in. Yep, the old ways are about to end. Still, law and order largely remain in their formative years. Wanted posters circulate throughout the region, and bounty hunters are plentiful….

In Bounty Hunter: 1881, you are one of these rough-and-tumble men. You’ll obtain wanted posters and travel by train, stagecoach and on horseback to get to outlaws’ hideouts. Once located, you’ll try to apprehend your quarry, by fair means or foul. Be aware, however, that bounty hunters start out with a bad reputation. If you bushwhack too many wrongdoers you’ll be considered just as bad — or even worse. You’ll also have to be careful when apprehending your prey, since most of them are quite capable of getting the draw on you! So saddle up, pard’ner and let’s make some money — bounty hunter style!

Game Play (simplified): After a quick setup, a player will choose one of several possible actions, usually selecting one of the three Travel cards on display at the bottom of the board, along with its associated bonus. These bonuses are, left to right: draw an Outlaw card, draw an On The Trail card, take a silver dollar from the display. Each type of card has a hand limit, and players may need to pay dollars in order to discard unwanted cards. Players travel to the location where an outlaw was last seen via Train cards, then play an On The Trail card along with the Travel shown cards on it to try to apprehend an Outlaw card in his hand, which is accomplished via rolls of the dice, and may be attempted by fair means or foul. If successful via the latter method, one or more Black Marks are taken, but there is a limit. Players can be wounded by their quarry and lose turns. The game ends when the Travel deck has been exhausted three times– so shuffle the discards after it runs out the first and second times. The rewards for the outlaws captured/ bushwhacked are totaled and $300 deducted from the player with more Black Marks. The player with the higher total wins.
categories: American West, Card Game, Print & Play

name: Pirates Dominoes
description:
From the Publisher:

This is a 2 in 1 game. The youngest members of the household may begin playing dominoes with these cool pirate drawings, but can also play the puzzle on the other side. They have to join all the chips together until they end up with a super pirate illustration. And after they are finished playing, they can save it all in its lined cardboard box until the next game.
mechanics: Pattern Building, Pattern Recognition, Tile Placement

name: Het Spreekwoorden spel: Deel 2
description:
This is a cardgame where the cards have a drawing on one side, that depicts a Dutch proverb. On the other side the proverb is listed, along with an explanation, example phrases, and a point value. Each turn a player takes one card (with picture visible) and tries to guess the proverb. If possible the explanation can be given. If a player is right, they get the card/points. Whoever has the most points wins.

In 2006 part one appeared.

name: Knetivity: Der kreative Partyspaß
description:
Party game for 2 to 6 Players.

The players get task cards which give them tasks which they have to solve with knead.
There are different kind of cards.

creating special objects
building in duel with another player (first wins)
all build the same in a sandglass time
building a little game, e.g. a bowling game and every player can try to hit all pins (with 3 ball throws).


The player who gets first 20 points wins the game.

name: Deutschlands Häfen u. Küsten: Ein Reisespiel
description:
The players start at space 1 (Borkum) and have to reach space 50 (after Königsberg). Movement is determined by one die. On some spaces the players are hindered or benefited by certain events. The first player to reach space 50 wins the game.

The game is played with nice pewter ships and was most likely published before WWI.
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Johnsonville: Cutthroat Capitalism
description:
Referred to by the publishers as a "role-playing party game", Johnsonville: Cutthroat Capitalism is a dice-rolling thematic game set in a small 1950s town.

Players start with a small pool of money that may be depleted every turn, and the object of the game is to have completed the most "citizenly tasks" (objectives drawn at the start of the game) by the time all other players have lost money. Player interference to deplete the money of other players is encouraged.

Actions in the game can be completed in two ways- through rolling against the Game Master, or "Johnson", or by drawing "Kit Cards", fictional cure-all products. Players interact by describing actions and rolling or drawing to attempt to complete them. The positive(or negative) effects of these attempts are described by the Johnson in a humorous fashion based on the numbers rolled or card drawn.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Player Elimination, Role Playing, Storytelling, Take That, Variable Player Powers

name: Norfin Trolls: Magic Mountain Adventure Game
description: Game is played on a large plastic floor mat. Comes with large plastic dice and four small troll dolls for playing pieces. Game board and play is similar to Candyland with bridges that can be used for shortcuts. Winner is the first to reach the castle.

name: Passage
description:
A fascinating two handed strategy game. To win, be the first person to build a winding line connecting your two designated sides and block your opponent from doing so.
A handicap system is also provided so that two players with uneven skills can still enjoy the game

Comes with another game - Blockade.

name: Dropout
description:
Welcome to your last semester of college!
Dropout is a humorous take-that card game for up to four players who try to raise their G.P.A in order to graduate.

Unfortunately, there are so many distractions to your studies: parties to attend, movies to watch and beer to drink. Each one of these distractions will lower your G.P.A. However, if you study, do your homework and avoid temptation, you might be able to raise and your G.P.A and graduate!

Each turn players will place activity cards to increase their G.P.A and distraction cards on the other players to lower theirs. After four rounds of triumphs and defeats, one semester has passed.

Earn the highest G.P.A in four semesters and become the one who doesn't Dropout
mechanics: Hand Management, Take That, Variable Phase Order

name: All My Friends Are Psycho
description:
You always suspected that they were psycho, now it is time to prove it.

In All my Friends are Psycho you become the psychologist and use original designed Rorschach cards to find out just how demented and gross your friends really are.

The Rorschach card deck is set in the middle face down. Flip the same number of cards that you have players, face up.

Without touching the cards, each player chooses an image to analyze keeping their interpretation a secret.

The psychologist picks up the cards and one by one asks each player what they saw. The psychologist has to match the player's interpretation with the correct card.

If the psychologist guesses correctly, both the player and psychologist gets 1 sanity point. If not, they score 1 psycho point.

Each player takes turns being the psychologist. After this the sanity and psycho points are added up. The player that has the closest number of sanity and psycho points (balances out) wins.

The game comes with 27 Rorschach cards and requires a genuine, original (neither genuine nor original) pad and pen.
categories: Card Game, Humor, Party Game, Print & Play, Real-time

name: Medieval Might
description:
In Medieval Might, two generals are pitted against each other in a battle. Each leads their army against each other to become the supreme commander.

Players take turns placing their units, represented by cards, on the battlefield. Each card builds up the strength of their forces, and use tactics to weaken their opponent's forces.

Use your knights and banner-men to greatly increase your strength, while deploying your scouts to gain an advantage over your opponent. If they start to take the lead, use your marksman to eliminate high value targets or ambush their forces to reduce their effectiveness.

The army with the higher value at the end of that round is the victor of that round. The game ends when one player loses two rounds, and the winner is crowned the supreme commander

name: Mad House
description:
There's a house filled with hungry zombies and your team is in the middle of it!!!

Around each corner there are different terrors. Super fast zombies, giant zombies and viscous stalkers are the least of your worries.

Mad House is a nail biting card strategy game for up to 5 players. It features a unique Noise Tracking mechanic; if you're team makes too much noise they will be attacked by horde of zombies!

The only way to survive is to keep everyone alive. Kill the required number of zombies to escape this Nightmare ...

Can you escape the Mad House?!
categories: Card Game, Fighting, Horror, Print & Play, Zombies
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Trading, Turn Order: Time Track, Variable Player Powers

name: Wormhole!
description: Wormhole! is a space themed board game for up to 8 players that turns the traditional rules of game play inside out. Everyone starts out at the edge of the board on a spiral track. Every turn you roll the dice, move closer to doom and draw a card. That card may be good, it may be bad, but it will certainly be unpleasant for someone. Red event cards go into effect immediately and may move you forward or back, swap you with the nearest ship or even make you take another turn. Blue mass cards are...mass cards. Mass is also the most common card type in the deck and comes in 25, 50, 75, and 100 unit variants. Mass is bad, because for every 100 mass you accumulate you have to roll another die on your turn. So if you’ve got 300 mass sitting in front of you, you’re rolling 4 dice every turn (that's your original die plus 3 more). And that’s just not going to end well. Green action cards are like the red event cards, but you can hold onto them and use them at your discretion. Use one to send your highest mass card to the person behind you...or if you happen to be that person behind you can use a different one to dodge that mass and let it keep on heading back. There’s even an action card that will let you skip your own turn! When a player inevitably reaches the center of the wormhole, they are out. Flung into the deepest recesses of time and space most likely. When that happens, they mix up their remaining action cards with their mass cards and each remaining player takes one at random (going in order along the track). Play continues until only one player is left on the board, allowing them to safely escape the wormhole and making them the winner.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Point to Point Movement

name: Leppisleikki
description: Leppisleikki ("Ladybird") is a fun and active game for the entire family that develops motor skills as well as balance and control. In the Ladybird game, players carry out various active tasks together with ladybird. Players are rewarded for successful tasks with the ladybird advancing upwards towards the flower on the stem and winning.

name: Name Game Jr.
description:
From the creator of the original "Name Game" comes this new edition that will leave the family guessing!

Designed for younger and older players. Draw a card and give creative descriptions and clues... Try to get your team to guess as many names as possible before the timer runs out.

name: The Struggle for Portugal: Peninsular War III, 1810-11
description:
From the publisher:

The Struggle for Portugal - Peninsular War III contains four battles in Portugal and Spain during 1811: Barrosa, Fuentes de Oñoro, and Albuera.

The Struggle for Portugal - Peninsular War III is one of the games from OSG's The Library of Napoleonic Battles series. Details on the series are below, as all the games share a common rules set and game system.

BATTLES SIMULATED

Barrosa, 5 March 1811
A reduction in the besieging forces gave the garrison of Cadiz an opportunity to break out. Loading on to naval transports, they debarked at Tarifa and moved to engage the siege lines from the rear. The French, under the command of Marshal Victor, placed one division on the road to Cadiz, while his two remaining divisions fell on the single Anglo-Portuguese division under Sir Thomas Graham. Following a fierce battle, the British succeeded in routing the French but could not prevent their reoccupying their siege lines.

Fuentes de Onoro, 3 - 5 May 1811
Wellington first secured Portugal and then set about re-taking the fortified frontier cities of Almeida, Badajoz, and Ciudad Rodrigo. Whilst Wellington besieged Almeida, Massena reformed his battered army and marched to relieve the French garrison in the city. Wellington chose to check the relief attempt at the small village of Fuentes de Oñoro.

La Albuera 16 May 1811
Wellesley sent Sir William Beresford to retake the border town of Badajoz. Soult rapidly gathered a new army from Andalusia and, joining with the troops retreating before Beresford, he marched to relieve the siege. With the Spanish army under General Joaquin Blake approaching, he planned to turn Beresford's flank and interpose his army between his position and the Spaniards. However, the Spaniards had already linked up with the Anglo-Portuguese corps, and his 24,000 troops now faced a combined Allied army 35,000 strong. The opposing armies met at the village of Albuera. Both sides suffered heavily in the ensuing struggle and the French eventually withdrew on 18 May.

DESCRIPTION

The Library of Napoleonic Battles - formerly known as the Napoleon's Last Battles (NLB) Series:


480 meters per hex,
1 hour per turn,
400-800 men per strength point.


Each Approach to Battle game lasts about 22 turns. The Full campaign links the individual battles.

name: Pikku Kakkosen posti
description:
You are a mail deliverer.

You goal is to deliver mails faster than other players.

name: Rap Wars
description:
The game is essentially a modified deck of traditional playing cards, but featuring cartoon parodies of popular rap artists.

Each player is dealt a hand of 12 cards from the deck, and a game lasts 12 rounds. The player to the left of the dealer goes first.

Each round the top card of the deck is revealed, and the color of that card becomes the "trump" color. Each player plays a card from their hand of the trump color if they can. If the player does not have a card in the trump color he may play any card. The round ends when each player has played a card. If trump colored cards have been played, then the highest trump colored card played that round wins. If no trump colored cards were played, then the highest card of any color wins.

The winner of the round scores 10 points. The first player to score 187 points or higher is the winner of the game.

(It should be noted that, since a game only lasts 12 rounds and players only score 10 points for a round, it is impossible to score the required number of points in a game to win)

name: The Temple of Heryshaf
description:
In this game, the player adventures through the Temple of Heryshaf, the Ancient Egyptian god of Primordial Waters. The goal is to reach the apex of the temple - Heryshaf’s Inner Sanctum! But beware! For the temple is filled with traps, and the passageways are winding!

At the start of the game, choose one of the five cards at the base of the pyramid to start the path. Each turn take the token representing your character and move it onto a card. The token may only move to a new card if the room you are in has a path which leads to that card and the card you are moving to has a corresponding path. When you attempt to move to a new card, flip the card over and sees what effects are activated. There are both traps and helper cards you may find inside the temple. You may choose to backtrack, but if you do, one card on the board is discarded, and a new unknown card takes its place - which may help or hinder you later.

The player wins if they make it through the temple, avoiding the traps or disarming the traps, to arrive safely at Heryshaf's Inner Sanctum.

This game tied for first place in the 24 hour contest for September 2014.
categories: Ancient, Card Game, Exploration, Maze, Mythology
mechanics: Modular Board, Network and Route Building

name: Scrap
description:
You are the captain of a crew of workers, abandoned by your superiors on the planet Rhodon V, which you once mined for resources. Now, a cargo ship has crash landed nearby and its crew has offered a ride off of the planet to anyone able to repair their ship – but you aren't the only one to respond to the distress beacon. Will you be the first player to collect all of the Repair Parts to fix the cargo ship and escape the planet?

The goal of Scrap is to be the first player to collect three different Repair Parts and deliver them back to the Start Area. Repair Parts can be collected by passing over specific spaces on the board or by looting them from your opponents after defeating them in battle.

Each player operates a unique vehicle, monstrous tank-like machines that have been constructed from salvaged mining and military equipment. Each vehicle starts with a special ability, different stats, and a set amount of upgrade slots. As players traverse the board, they will collect Resource Cards through different means, which are used to build upgrades, collect Unique Upgrades, trigger Events, and more.
mechanics: Pick-up and Deliver, Variable Player Powers

name: The Looney Tunes Show Run Tweety Run Game
description: Basic spin and move game with Sylvester chasing Tweety around the board. Each player gets a Sylvester mover and tries to land on the Tweety mover. If the spinner lands on Run Tweety Run, Tweety moves from one birdcage to another. The first Sylvester to land on Tweety three times wins.
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Shop with Barbie
description:
Aim of the game: to help Barbie fill her wardrobe with new fashion accessories. Contents: Game board, 36 illustrated discs
4 Barbie playing pieces, 4 plastic bases, 2 handbag cards, 1 die & Game rules.

This is a combination Memory game & board game. Players start on the Barbie that matches their playing piece on the corner of the playing board. The discs of accessories are placed upside down in the middle of the board. Players roll & move around the board, turning over a disc to try to match the accessory they land on. If it matches, they keep it. If not, play passes to next player. If they land on a handbag square, they get one of the two handbags. If they land on a player square, they get to take a handbag from one of the other players. In order to win, they must get each accessory, get a handbag and return to their Barbie square.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Cicero's Apple Bite Contest
description: This game was published in Bugs Bunny's Trick 'n' Treat Halloween Fun #3 in 1955 by Dell. Cicero is Porky Pig's nephew. This is basically a board game version of the traditional party game where players try to bite an apple hanging from a string. The players race to be the first to finish "eating" their apples. Each player gets an illustration of an apple which is cut into 11 pieces. They then take turns drawing chits from a box; when the chit shows an apple, the player can remove a piece of their apple. If the chit shows a jack o'lantern, they've missed the apple and the game-play goes back to the other player.
categories: Animals, Children's Game, Comic Book / Strip

name: Supermouse's Christmas Game
description: Published by Standard Comics in "Santa's Christmas Comics" in December, 1952. Simple race game where you use chits instead of dice to determine moves. Goal is to be the first to reach the end. Board shows several of Standard's funny animal characters in Christmas scenes, the most well-known being Supermouse, Spotty the Pup, and Buster Bunny, as they each had their own titles.
categories: Animals, Children's Game, Comic Book / Strip

name: Going Places in Europe
description:
Discover the European continent!

Travel across the European continent and visit the different countries and their cities. Plan your trip and return to your home city to win the game!

Each player receives one Destination card to determine his or her starting position, or "hometown". Another 12 Destination cards are then dealt to each player. The goal is to plan a round trip from your "hometown" via the 12 destinations.

To aid the traveler, train stations, airports and harbors are available as a quick travel option if a player has a corresponding Compass card. The Compass cards can help or stall your trip in a number of ways, including changing the outcome of the game. A player is never safe until he or she has returned home!

Designed for 2-4 players and takes you on a different path around the continent each round!

name: 3 Stooges Racing Rampage
description:
This board game appeared in Dell's Four Color comics #1078 in Feb-Apr 1960; it was an issue that featured the Three Stooges. A simple spin-and-move Goose type game where players race through through town to reach the finish line first.
The game was later reprinted in Western Publishing's Three Stooges #39 June 1968.
categories: Children's Game, Comic Book / Strip, Humor, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Space Run
description:
A space theme game from Greece, made for a chocolate firm called ION probably was as a gift with chocolates. A very rare game !
Your goal is to travel in to our solar system and be the first who will visit all the planets.
You move with the spin on a well track that came with the game.
There are three faces.
At the first face to try to take off from earths gravitation force and travel to the moon.
You spin the well twice, first to to determine the track (lets say you roll 5) so your hight is five.
The second spin determine the speed of the rocket (must be more than 1 to win the gravitation ).That will allow you to move the rocket clock wise ( lets say that you roll 3, so at hight of five you move three spaces clock wise on the track around the Earth's orbit.......
The second face is the moonlanding
This face starts when the first rocket reach the hight of 7, then you place the moon token at the blue spot betwen the hight 7 and 8. And the game continues.
The moon always moves at speed of 1 clockwise at the and of every players turn.
To land on the moon you must be on a parallay with the moon at hight 7, when you reach thisand is your turn you put your space craft at the moon and you spin the well right away to reach the third face of the game....
At the third and last face you must visit the planets in the exact order Afrodite, Hermes, Aris,Zeus, Kronos, Houranos, Posidon, Plouton. You follow the same rule as the first face and some more rules.....

name: Who Gets the Bird?
description: Published in the comic book, Treasure Chest of Fun and Fact volume 2, #7, November 26, 1946 on a "Thanksgiving Fun" page. A simple spin and move race game wherein two players race to be the first to get the turkey while avoiding spaces with Indians, bears, and arrowheads which force players to go back. A teetotum is used to determine number of spaces moved.
categories: Animals, Children's Game, Comic Book / Strip

name: Shaft
description: The game of the 70's movie. The 'private eye' detective is trying to locate a kidnapped daughter of a gang boss. Players secretly indicate the location they are moving to by marking it on a 'location indicator' disc. The game involves deduction (working out which location a player has chosen to move to). The game uses a vinyl game 'board' and was sold in a round plastic box made to look like a film canister. The game is marked 'X certificate', but that appears to relate to the adult-only classification of the source movie rather than game itself.

name: Battles of the Thirty Years War 1618 - 1648
description:
Battles of the Thirty Years War (1618-1648) Series was originally published by TCS Games as several Desktop Published games. In the LCD tradition, they are perfect for those wanting a game that is fast to learn and quick to play. These games will include all new graphics, corrected errata, and consolidated rules.


The Battle of White Mountain (November 8 1620) was an early battle in the Thirty Years' War in which an army of 30,000 Bohemians and mercenaries were defeated by 27,000 men of the combined armies of Spain, the Holy Roman Empire, and the German Catholic League.



The Battle of Fleurus (August 29, 1622) was fought between a Spanish army of 8,000 men, and the Protestant Powers of the Holy Roman Empire with an army of 14,000 men. The bloody struggle left the Protestants mangled and the Spanish masters of the field.



The Battle of Lutter (27 August 1626) took place between nearly equal the forces (20,000 each) of the Lower Saxon Circle, combining mostly Protestant states, and led by its Circle Colonel Christian IV of Denmark, and the forces of the Catholic League. The battle resulted in a heavy defeat of Christian IV's troops by those of Emperor Ferdinand II, led by the Catholic League general Johan Tzerclaes, Count of Tilly.

name: Get Home Safe
description: Once you have completed the puzzle, take turns to spin the arrow and move your character accordingly. The aim of the game is to get home safely, learning about the possible hazards to avoid along the way. The player who reaches home first is the winner.

name: My House
description:
First create the scene, then find the correct items to match. Does the bed go in the kitchen, bathroom, bedroom? Where would you put the toothbrush? Television? Saucepan?
Take turns matching the different items from the home to the correct categories.
Who has placed the most tiles to the correct categories is the winner.

name: Puzzlage
description: Puzzlage is a jigsaw-puzzle, word search game in which 2-4 players take turns building a word search puzzle and pointing out words to advance. Players are eliminated when they become "puzzled" and can't come up with a word on their turn. The spinner piece in the center tells players which letters to use.
mechanics: Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Tile Placement

name: Rubble Rousers
description:
In Rubble Rousers, you take the role of the owner of one of several competing construction and demolition companies in an ever-changing city of constant building and rebuilding.

Rubble Rousers features a hybrid of Euro-style gameplay elements with a light dexterity factor. You will roll out with your trucks (6-sided dice) by flicking them onto the board, knocking over any buildings (stacks of wooden discs) in their path. Once your truck comes to rest on the city board, you spend action points to drive around the board, collecting rubble from destroyed buildings for materials you will subsequently use to construct your own buildings.

Gameplay and strategy in Rubble Rousers is driven by hands of contract cards which can be played as either demolition contracts or construction contracts. If your card is played as a demolition contract, you earn Victory Points by toppling a building in the city that contains the materials listed on the card. If your card is played as a construction contract, you earn VP by building a structure that contains the materials listed on the card. Be careful, however, because if you are unable to complete your contracts within two rounds of play, you will lose VP instead!

Special bonus action cards can be activated to allow you to re-roll unsatisfactory rolls, perform rule-bending actions, dump unwanted contracts and more. However, once they are used, you must spend action points in later turns in order to maintain them and restore them to active status, ensuring you gain the end of game VP bonuses listed on the cards.

A crowd-drawing game of exciting shots and near-misses as well as careful planning and strategy, Rubble Rousers bridges the gaps between players of all sorts of games.
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Pick-up and Deliver

name: Percy Jackson: Sea of Monsters Coin Game
description:
Originally released as a Carl's Jr./Hardee's Cool Kids toy, this coin game is based on the Percy Jackson: Sea of Monsters movie. Essentially a take on Rock Paper Scissors, the game is played by each player concealing three coins in their hand. On the count of three, both players reveal one coin and a winner is determined by the faces revealed. If 2 of the same coin is revealed, that round doesn't count.

Percy (Rock)
Annabeth (Paper)
Grover (Scissors)

Alternatively, you can place all the coins face down on the table and mix them up. Both players count to three out loud. On three, each player turns over one coin. If you show the same coin, that round doesn't count. Return the coins face down and try again. The object of the game is to win 2 out of 3 games.

name: Wer hebt den Schatz?: Die Geheimnisse des Meeres
description:
The players start at the ship, then dive to the wreck on the ocean floor and come up again to the ship. The first player to achieve this, wins the game. Movement is determined by two dice. If one of the diece Shows a 6, the shark (black meeple) is placed on the black space on the diving track and blocks any movement of the diver. It stays there untill another player rolls a 6 on one die. When a diver on his way down is past the black space, a 6 has no special meaning until he starts to go up again. If a diver gets on a black space, he gets eaten by a shark and is eliminated from the game.

This game was published between 1939 and 1945.
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move, Track Movement

name: Smart  Money Maker
description:
Smart Money Maker is a card game to illustrate the rules of the collaborative consumption. It is based on a simple concept: everyone plays against the problems left behind by the old economy! The objective is to pay for all debts, taxes, loans and make investments to remain in the market.

Players have to collaborate: they receive a portfolio of cards that represent the New Economy models as, for example, car or house sharing, recycling, and using free services online. The cards can be traded in for cash when they are used to pay off debts. After the whole deck has been used up, if all of the debts have been paid off by the players, the player who has the most cash wins the game.

Despite the many opportunities to collaborate, it's possible that players won’t manage to pay off all debts. In that case, the game is the winner!

name: Drunk Uncles
description:
As idiot uncles attending a family gathering in Drunk Uncles, a press-your-luck card game, you must get as many of your terrible opinions off of your chest as possible before you wear out the welcome of your fair-minded family. Players draft dice to determine their tolerance level and carefully play from their hand hoping to duck under the judgement of their family.

In game terms, players each start with a hand of seven cards and a d4, d6 and d10 is placed in a shared pool (The Bar) for each player; cards range from 1-10 in four suits with three ?!?!? cards in each suit.

In a round, each player completes one turn. On a turn, a player takes up to three dice from The Bar, rolls them to determine the current Tolerance value, then plays as many cards as desired from their hand as long as each card is less than the Tolerance value. If a player has no such cards, they can draw the top card and play it; if it's equal to or higher than Tolerance, they bust and lose all their cards. If they play a card equal to 8 or higher, opponents can play as many ?!?!? cards as they want of the same suit.

After all cards have been played, the player scores points equal to the number of cards played multiplied by the number of dice rolled, then subtracts ten points for each ?!?!? card played. Finally, the active player refills their hand to seven cards.

After each player has had a turn, return all dice to The Bar, then start a new round. When the last card has been drawn from the deck, finish the round. Whoever has the most points wins.

name: The Show Must Go On!
description:
The Show Must Go On! features two teams of player actors who attempt to perform their roles in the included play Covet Thy Neighbors' Asses! so convincingly that their teammates can guess the occupation, motivation or affectation that they are attempting to exhibit during their performance (with these three characteristics being determined by cards drawn by the players at the start of play). If the teammates guess correctly, the actor wins a coin and keeps the appropriate card; if not, the actor may return a previously collected coin to discard one of their cards.

After completing three portions of dialogue in the play or having no cards in hand, an actor moves to the bottom of the line-up and refills their hand, then one of their teammates takes the stage. The two teams perform in turn as separate characters in the play, so two actors are always "on stage" performing during the game.

When the play ends, each team scores one point for each piece of gold it has and the indicated points on the cards it has pocketed. Which team has performed better wins!

name: Spud Head: The Card Game
description:
Winner of the October 2015 24-Hour Game Design Challenge! Printed copies will eventually be made available, in the mean time enjoy this PnP version.

The object of the game is to create potato heads, earning points. A complete head consists of one eye card (top of head), one mouth/nose card (bottom card) and two ear cards. You can get bonus points if you are able to complete your head with a hat, feet and/or a item (see final scoring).

Setup:
Shuffle all the cards. Deal out seven cards to each player. Place remaining cards in the middle of the table as a draw deck, leaving space for a discard pile. Determine the first player, and play will continue clockwise.

Game Play:
On a turn, players draw one card, either from the draw deck or the top card of the discard pile. If they have collected enough head parts to complete a head (with or without the bonus cards), they may place the assembled head face-up in front of them.

Once a head it is played on the table, no cards can be added to it or any of its cards changed. At the end of a players turn; if they have more than seven cards, they must discard down to seven cards.

The numbers in the upper corner of the ear cards help determine if the ears are matching and if the are right side up - as it is possible to use a left ear upside down to finish a head.

Play continues until all the cards from the draw deck and discard deck are empty; or until no player can complete any additional potato heads. Then using the scoring table below, add up all the points for each player and determine a winner.

In case of a tie, the player who has used the most bonus cards is the winner. And if still a tie, the player who was able to use the most item cards wins. After that it is a shared victory of Spud Heads!

Final Scoring:

+ 10 Points Each complete Spud Head

+5 Points With matching ears

+ 15 Points With hat, feet and matching item for hat

+5 Points With hat and feet

+ 2 Points With hat or feet

-2 Points For each ear placed upside down
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Print & Play

name: The Game of Full Barn
description:
The game comes with 12 different cards, four of each kind. Players attempt to collect a "full barn" of items, animals and characters getting one of each card. Player's pick cards, trade cards, and ask others for cards to add to their collection. The "Ol' Rat" card lets a player steal a card from a another player's barn.

The game comes in a small drawstring bag with no year information. Designed and illustrated Josiah Hurst, age 15.

name: Topsy Turvy Card Game
description:
The Suite Life of Zach & Cody themed game.

From the description on the back:
It's a card game that's as topsy turvy as Zack and Cody themselves. Each player has his own deck of suite life cards. When the game mat is on the "High" side, you're trying to have a higher number card than your opponent.
But throughout the game things get topsy turvy and sometimes you're trying to have the lower number. The game always ends unexpectedly when the special suite life cards show up. When that happens, the player with the most cards wins.
categories: Card Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Chocolat
description:
User summary:
In the game of Chocolat, chocolatiers compete in producing confectionery.

Twelve hours before a confectionery shop's reopening, the shop owner suddenly fell in love and left the shop. The remaining chocolatiers have to make up for his absence and produce enough confectionary for the reopening. Who will be the best chocolatier?

Chocolat is a gamers' game with a blend of worker placement, resource management, and tile placement.

This game currently comes with Japanese rules. English rules are scheduled to be available in Spring 2016.

Publisher's summary:
『Chocolat』は、町一番のチョコレート職人たちが腕を競い合うゲームです。

新装開店の１２時間前、店のオーナーが情熱的な恋をして店を出て行ってしまいました。
残された職人たちは、狭い店の中で大慌て。
さて、誰が一番の職人なのでしょうか？

ワーカープレイスメント、リソース管理、タイル配置の要素を組み合わせたゲーマーズゲームです。
言語依存があり、ルールは日本語のみです。
（来年の春には英語版を予定しています）。
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Set Collection, Tile Placement, Worker Placement

name: Shin Hannin wa Kono Naka ni Iru!
description:
User summary:
真犯人はこの中にいる! (Shin Hannin Ha Kono Naka Ni Iru!) in English means "The real culprit is right here with us!".

This game is actually an expansion to Hannin wa Kono Naka ni Iru!. With this expansion, character cards are hidden information and you have an advantage if you know who your opponents are.

New cards are added to gain clues of opponents' characters.
mechanics: Hand Management, Role Playing, Take That

name: Battle Plan
description:
Rules for a play by mail board game, the object of which is to control the world. Includes rules for combat, treaties and negotiation, espionage and occupation of minors.

Includes a 16 page rulebook and a 22 x 35" map of the earth.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Secret Unit Deployment

name: Nimemäng
description:
"Name game" in English is card game of popular family names.
There are 200 common names from 40 countries in this game.

The player who name first the country where the name is common gets the card as a point. Who has the most cards at the end of the game is the winner.

name: Vikerkaar minu kõhus
description:
Vikerkaar minu kõhus ("Rainbow in my stomah") is a board game about healthy diet for children.

There are different vegetables, fruits and berries, proteins juice and grain cards in different colors on the cards.
Player try to get points by collecting 3 cards with different colors + protein, juice and grain cards.
Additionally player may be awarded with bonus points by cooking, helping clean the kitchen etc.

The player who has the most points when the deck is exhausted wins the game.

name: Party Boss
description:
In Party Boss, take on the role of the backroom political operative guiding the strategy of one of America's great political parties. Nominate your cronies to challenge incumbents and manage their campaigns. You decide where your party's vast resources will be concentrated. Will your efforts to influence the electorate succeed?

Once your politicians have taken office, plot your legislative strategy for the term: select the bills to bring to the floor and how you will go about passing them. Will you use the brute force of your majority, or the crafty tactics of backroom deals and parliamentary maneuvers?

At the end of 5 cycles, the boss with the most impact on American governance wins, while the other must retire in obscurity.

name: Pisswhistle
description:
Combination card-dice game created to use items in the Ashens Game fan merchandise pack, but playable with regular pieces.

Played in two phases. In the first two phases, players play cards against each other with the highest card being added to the player's War Chest, giving a points score which is carried over to the final "battle" phase in which players reduce each others scores via the roll of a die until one player's score is exhausted.

The game's name is Norfolk slang for male genitalia.
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Dice Rolling, Trick-taking

name: Winit
description:
From the box box:

Using the dice, roll numbers which give you a choice of letters from the spiral to build 3, 4, and 5 letter words. Each player has his own playing board, trying to get highest score, based on word and letter values. A competitive, educational crossword game.

name: Catch Submarines
description:
Dexterity game for kids (fine motor skill and perspective skill).

30 Submarines in 6 colors, A grid built from 9 limiting snakes, 2 tweezers, and the game box itself as the board.

Each turn, the player roll the die to see which submarine s/he need to pull this turn (with the tweezers), however, the task isn't simple, as a grid of snakes block the way and the player most pull the submarine without moving the snakes (if the player accidentally moves any of the snakes, the turn is over).

The player with the most submarines at the end of the game wins.

name: Alien Crash Site
description:
Alien Crash Site is a family friendly, 2 - 4 player co-op game for ages 12+. Play lasts about 60 minutes.

A UFO has crashed in the middle of the board and Aliens are pouring out! On the outskirts of town stand your Nuke plant, Water reservoir, Hospital, and Communications tower. If the Aliens destroy some of these key locations, it's 'game over'!

In order to prevent this from happening you will need to work together to unveil ultra high tech defenses, devise master strategies, build and command forces, and - hopefully - gain access to the ultimate weapon!

Unlike other co-op games, each player controls only 1 section of the board. There will be times of calm and times of sheer panic during play.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Trading, Variable Player Powers

name: Ninja Rivals
description:
In the card game Ninja Rivals, you are ninja masters of rival clans battling to finish missions and attain victory. Collect gold by completing objectives, play tricks on your opponents, surprise them with smoke bombs. Keep an eye on the resources in your hand otherwise, you might find the next mission is out of your reach.

At the start of the game, a mission is revealed and aloud for all to hear, including objectives and any secondary objectives if available. Then each player draws 2 cards from the NINJA DECK in order. Now the mission phase begins.

Starting with the first player, each player must choose to place a card from their hand face down into play directly in front of them or pass and draw a card from the NINJA DECK.

After a player has performed one of these two actions their turn is over, if they have over 10 cards in their hand they must discard down to 10 cards. They may also immediately play surprise cards to get their hand size down.

Play continues around the table until either, one player has 5 cards in front of them when the FIRST PLAYER is about to START their NEXT turn or All players have passed in succession.

Players reveal their cards and compare scores against the mission requirements, the winner claims the mission and the gold for their clan.

name: Das Bodensee-Spiel
description:
The players have to travel from Lindau around the Bodensee to Bregenz, where they continue the trip by boat. Movement is determined bay a die. The first player to reach one of the 6 golden harbors with the exact roll of the die wins the game.
The game was published in the 1930s or 1940s.
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Undertome
description: Undertome is a horror themed strategy card game comprised of 100 unique cards which players draw from a single deck (The Tome). Each card has a different effect which players must carefully choose to play during their turn because once a spell has been cast, the page is burned in the ashes never to be used again (or is it?). Players have a limited amount of Courage which they must guard as once you lose it, you are filled with overwhelming dread taking you out of the game.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Player Elimination

name: Los Refuerzos de Extremadura
description: Published in Alea magazine 23, adds a variant and new units for playing Los Arapiles Scenario IV.

name: Martial Arts: The Card Game – Series 2
description:
Introducing Series 2 of Martial Arts: The Card Game, a 2-4 player deckbuilding game that focuses on real martial arts rather than flying off walls and throwing fireballs. Using our Velocity Engine, you can pick up a deck and play as a different martial art style using strategy, speed, and quick thinking without having to micromanage your decks. Because this is also a deck building game, you can mix and match any of the cards from Series 2 or 1 and create your own fighting style, much like a honed practitioner would.

Play as "Anything Goes" where weapons and illegal moves are ok or try our different modes, like playing solo or Army of One where you can have up to 10 players!

Series 2 includes these pre-constructed deck styles:


Sumo
Drunken Fist
Tae Kwon Do
Shaolin Kung Fu
Brazilian Jujitsu
Capoeira
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Player Elimination

name: NHL Brainpucks
description:
From the back of the box:

Brainpucks is a game of strategy that combines the simplicity of tic-tac-toe, the game of chess and the thrill of hockey.

Be the first player to align 4 pucks in a horizontal, vertical, or diagonal fashion. Personalize your game board with your favourite team logos!

name: Black Company
description:
User summary:
In Japan, a "black kigyou" (literally means "black company") is like a sweatshop company. When a company exploits its employees in illegal ways, it is called a black kigyou. Karoshi (death from overwork) is one of the most tragic results caused by such a company.

This game is a roll-and-move game with a theme of labor survival.

Players are new employees of a "black company". When employed, they are willing to work for that company with full motivation, but their motivation will diminish soon. Each turn, the current player rolls a die and advances their pawn that number of squares around the board. Then, depending on the square that player landed on, a trouble or a disaster may happen, reducing that player's motivation (and sometimes other player's too). A player wins the game if all the other players' motivations are reduced to zero.

Players' way to advance is actually a loop because there's no way out of the company. This game is a party game which is full of black humour.

Publisher's summary:
このゲームにおける""BLACK COMPANY""とは、過酷な労働環境で従業員を苦しめる「ブラック企業」を意味しています。「過労死」に代表される日本の黒い文化です。
このゲームは「労働サバイバルすごろく」です。
プレイヤーはブラック企業に入社してしまった従業員となり、ボードに描かれた家から会社、また会社から家へというサイクルを繰り返しながら、心と体の充実度「いきいきポイント」が少しずつ減少していきます。
最後まで「いきいきポイント」が0にならず生き残ったプレイヤーの勝利です。
ブラックユーモアを交えたパーティーゲームです。
mechanics: Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Wabbits
description:
The object of Wabbits is to win four carrots by forming words fast. You form four-letter words by pairing up word bit cards or tiles from your hand and/or from the supply pool in the middle of the table. Word bits are fixed two-letter combinations that can form words when combined correctly.

Examples:

WO + RD = WORD

PL + AY = PLAY

It takes two word bits to form a word, and you must use all of your cards/tiles. At any time and as often as you want, you can discard any unwanted word bit by putting the card/tile face up in the pool and picking up a new or discarded one. Go fast; up to a dozen others are forming words at the same time as you!

It doesn’t matter if you are a BUNNY, RABBIT, HARE, or JACKRABBIT! When skill levels differ greatly, level the playing field by using the skill cards which are numbered from 1 (beginner) to 8 (expert). The number in one’s card is the number of words one has to form. Less experienced players can win because they need to form fewer words. Whoever finishes first gets the carrot!

And the more you win, the harder it gets to keep winning! After winning a carrot, your target number of words goes up by one for the next round.

Players leading during a game have to work harder for the next carrot, and so the others always have a good chance of catching up. The game is never over until the last carrot has been won.

name: Imperial Regalia of Japan
description:
User summary:
カムダカラ (Kamu-Dakara) are "the Imperial Regalia of Japan". Consisting of the sword Kusunagi, the mirror Yata no Kagami and the jewel Yasakani no Magatama, these are sacred treasures of Japan and are supposedly stored in three locations in Japan.

In this game, which takes place in ancient Japan, the turn player offers three cards, each with a different bonus specified on it, to another player who chooses to receive one of them. The turn player can keep the remaining two cards. By repeating this, the players compete to achieve the highest score.

Publisher's summary:
3つの異なるボーナスが描かれたカードを
2つのボーナスを隠した状態で任意の参加者に差し出し、
差し出された相手は３つのうちどのボーナスひとつを受け取るかを選び、
残りふたつをターンプレイヤーが受け取る、
ということを繰り返し、最大点数を目指す
古代日本を舞台といたゲーム。

name: Monsutā Fesutibaru ~ dai shuryō-sai kyōsan: Arisumetika renkin shōkai ~
description:
User summary:
モンスター・フェスティバル ～大狩猟祭 協賛:アリスメティク錬金商会～ (Monsutā Fesutibaru ~ dai shuryō-sai kyōsan: Arisumetika renkin shōkai ~) means "Monster Festival - Big Hunting Festival, Supported by Arithmetic Alchemy Co. -" in English.

Try to achieve the number on the Monster cards placed in a row on the table by combining the number on Monster cards in your hand with Tool cards (basic mathematical symbols). As soon as you finish calculating, take the Order card immediately.

Publisher's summary:
場に並べられたモンスター（数字）になるように手札のモンスター（数字）と道具（数式記号）を使って素早く計算します。計算が決まったら即座に順番カードを取得します。
categories: Action / Dexterity, Card Game, Fantasy, Math, Real-time

name: Mountain Tour
description:
The mountain is calling! The path is steep, the gorges treacherous. With concentration and skill to the peak of happiness.

This game is similar to Labyrinth except that it has been stood up on its end. The player must move a small metal ball around the path on the board using a system of simple pulleys. Should the ball fall through a hole, you have to start over.

name: Vom Neckar zum Rhein
description: Objective: be the first to travel to arrival point, learn more about folks and country. It is a simple 'Roll and Move' game, moving by turn.

name: The Neymar Board Game!
description: The Neymar Board Game! appears inside the back cover of the book Neymar by Illugi Jökulsson. It follows the life and career of Brazilian soccer star Neymar. It is a simple roll-and-move game where players roll a die to progress along a track. Spaces along the way refer to setbacks and successes in Neymar's life and career, corresponding to moving forward or back on the track or gaining or losing turns. The first player to reach the end of the track by an exact roll wins.

name: Levy Men
description:
Levy Men (or "Caballeros & Campesinos" in the spanish version) is a set of rules designed to abstractedly simulate combats that represent from skirmishes with dozens of miniatures to big battles with hundreds of miniatures per side.

For 2 players, it was conceived to be played in a fast and dinamic game mode that will allow the players learn and implement the simple rules rapidly.

The objective of the ruleset is to serve as a “starter game” for those not familiar with wargames and, for the experience players as a “filler game” or just a way to play as much fast and masive battles in one gaming day!
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Player Elimination, Simulation, Variable Phase Order

name: Chronos Record
description:
User summary:
クロノスレコード (Chronos Record) is a card game using layers to show epochs in history. The game is for three players only.

"Brighten the history of our kingdom!" A whim of a king caused a history manipulation war that involved the whole continent. Send your armies, such as knights, mages, and dragons into the past, and gain supremacy of the continent in every epoch.

Chronos Record is a three-dimensional area influence card game. This game uses four sheets of 9-pocket TCG protector. Bind these four sheets to form a four-layer playing-field. Each layer represents a certain epoch. The top layer is the present and the bottom layer is the oldest. Each pocket represents a territory. Because each layer is transparent, if you send your army to the oldest epoch, that army is visible (therefore active) until the present, unless another card covers the territory of more recent layer.

Each round, players play one card each in any vacant pocket, then score victory points from one randomly chosen epoch, according to the card locations visible from that layer.

After the seventh round, for each layer, if a player has the most cards visible from that layer, that player scores victory points.

There are 10 types of armies that have various abilities. You need to consider the abilities and synergies when planning your strategy.

Publisher's summary:
＜モチーフ＞『我が国の歴史を最も輝かしいものに！』ある国王の出来心から大陸全土を巻き込む歴史改竄戦争が勃発した。騎士、白魔術師、ドラゴンなど個性豊かなキャラクターを過去に送り込み、各時代の覇権を獲得しよう。

＜ゲームシステム＞TCG保存用カードバインダーを使った立体陣取り。『綴じられた4枚の9ポケットシートは透明なので、上にカードが置かれない限り、下のカードが見えたまま』という特徴を利用している。『毎ラウンド選ばれるページから見える配置が高い勝利点を生み出す事』、『ゲーム終了時に各ページから見える枚数でのエリアマジョリティーを獲得する事』を考えていく。10種類あるキャラクターカードの特徴を理解して戦略やコンボを考える必要もある。
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Simultaneous Action Selection
publishers: ビブリオゲームズ (Biblio Games)

name: Thrones and Bones
description: Thrones and Bones is a board game published in the book Frostborn by Lou Anders. It is based on the classic Viking board game Hnefatafl. Thrones and Bones is played on a 9×9 board, and shares the layout of the King's Table version of Hnefatafl. In general, movement and captures are handled as they are in Hnefatafl. However, this game adds a few new elements. The attackers, known as the Draug, have a special "leader" piece known as The Black Draug, who has special movement powers. Also, the starting squares of the attackers, known as the barrow mounds, are impassible to the Jarl and his defenders and also impassible to the Draug minions once they leave the barrow mounds. Only the Black Draug can move to any space on the board with no restrictions. However, the Black Draug is also vulnerable. If he is captured, all his minions are released and Jarl and his defenders win. The Jarl may also win by reaching any edge square other than those in the barrow mounds. As in Hnefatafl, the Draug win by capturing the Jarl by surrounding him on all four sides with Draug pieces or barrow mound squares.

name: Ordnungswissenschaft
description:
Ordnungswissenschaft is a physical game in which four players are moving stacked boxes according to rigid instructions. The players have to execute these instructions in the given order and can only determine when to execute, not what to execute.

5 cubes are stacked in the corners of the space, and the four players stand on the sides of the square playing area, each player between 2 stacks of boxes.

Each player receives 3 sheets of instructions and a green cover sheet. They take each page in turn, following the instructions on the page.

Players win if they have one box on their left at the end of the round.

Free download here:
https://ordnungswissenschaft.wordpress.com/download/
mechanics: Moving Multiple Units, Pattern Recognition, Real-Time, Sudden Death Ending

name: Godrem
description:
Godrem is an abstract strategy game created by David A. Madrigal. The game is for 2 or 4 players, and it is set in a fantasy world.

The objective of the game is to conquer the 4 red tiles of the map and take control of the Crystal. The players have 6 army units and 1 Oracle to make it. Every Oracle has different abilities that change the development of the battles and they are the only ones with the power to control the knowledge of the crystal... but not without lose something before.

The first player to take control of the 4 red tiles and the Crystal wins the game.

name: War Fleet
description: War Fleet is a block game designed for massive fleets of starships to battle and still be resolved in a reasonable amount of time. The design focuses on admiral level decisions, such as fleet position, command, and starship configuration. It also allows for variable levels of complexity and could easily be expanded to fit a number of settings. The map covers a vast amount of space which can be everything from a large section of deep space to a lone star system. It is designed to work independently or within a Victory by Any Means campaign game

name: Genimo
description:
Genimo is a game of skill that gives you and your opponent the chance to show off your vocabulary. Designed for two players, children or adults, Genimo tests your ability to locate and identify your opponent's word on a special numbered game sheet before he discovers yours.

The game consists of instructions as well as two pads of pages on which to write your word, and according to the instructions, it comes with two "lead pencils." In the first stage of the game, the player must determine where their opponent has put the word, like a simplified Battleship game. The second stage plays like Hangman, with the player guessing letters so they can figure out their opponent's word.
—user summary

name: Scrumpit
description:
Scrumpit is an ‘Old English’ word which means to steal your neighbours’ fruit – The game is for 2, 3 or 4 players, involving tactics, strategy and wordplay with the option of scoring for yourself and/or frustrating other players by stealing their letters.

About the game:

Object of the game. Each player aims to get their own colour letters into their ‘Home’ Scrump zone of the same colour. Using typical crossword play techniques, each player endeavours to build words in their own homeward direction.

The moment a player (say yellow) has entered their own Yellow (“Home”) Scrump zone, two actions come into play:

Firstly, the player entering their “Home” Scrump zone begins to score points immediately, by multiplying the point value of each letter tile placed in the “Home” Scrump zone by the value shown on the side of their “Home” Scrump zone grid (1 to 7).
Secondly, this player is now permitted to “Scrump” up to any two letters from anywhere in the central 15 x 15 board (you can even ‘Scrump’ your own letters). Any ‘Scrumped’ letters must be used in that turn. It does not matter if words are broken up as a result of the ‘Scrump’. However, it is part of the fiendish plan to frustrate you opponent(s) by scrumping their letters to stop them getting to their “Home” Scrump zone. By doing this, they cannot score, and they cannot Scrump your letters until they are “Home”.
Any player reaching the “Apex Star” 7, finishes the game. All the other players must then deduct from their score, the value of the letter tiles remaining in their racks. The winner of the game will be the player who has the highest score – not necessarily the player who finishes the game. To player a full match each player must have one turn at starting a game. A match consists of one game (turn to start) for each of the 2, 3 or 4 players.

name: A Dog's World
description:
In the board game A Dog’s World, you are a dog, and your goal is to out-score your opponents by leading the best dog life possible. Pick your breed, learn tricks, perform heroic deeds, and mark your territory as you travel from the suburbs - to the city - to the outskirts of town. But watch out for the Dog Catcher or you may end up in the pound. Obtain the most points by the end of the game to win!

A Dog’s World is a strategy game. Its part board game, part card game, and players will need to find the best way to achieve the most points before they’re breed’s lifeline reaches its end. In the board game portion, players must travel to specific territories to play cards. Marking territory (and marking over opponents’ territories) is also key. In the card game portion, players must build upon card combinations to advance their dog’s score. Players must learn Tricks, before they can perform Deeds or Heroic Deeds (earning points). Players will also need to figure out how to best utilize their breed’s special ability to gain an edge over their opponents.

A Dog’s World is all about dogs, and while it will appeal to dog owners and board game junkies, it is accessible to casual and die-hard board gamers alike.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Animals, Card Game, Territory Building

name: GUESS! Wörterraten für Schnelldenker
description: The active player gets a strip, where he writes down one of the pre-given words or alternately presenting an own word. Then he pushes the strip into the plate and covers it. The other players open one after the other a slider, which hide each a character. Who thinks he knows the word calls it. It is controlled. If guessed correctly, the player gets one point for each slide still closed. If he guessed wrong, the number of enclosed slides his Points are reduced. After an agreed number of rounds the player with the most points wins.

name: コバンいただき (Koban Itadaki)
description: A trick-taking card game played over 9 rounds. Players play a card from their hand and offer a bribe to other players to play the same color. The leader of the largest color group pays out their bribe and collects the points being played for that round. The points to be won change every time, and only 2 players ever know the value.
publishers: 篠原遊戯重工 (Shinohara Yugi Juko)

name: Redneck Invasion
description:
We’ve all thought about it. What would we build if we could create our perfect city? The only problem is the hipsters, preppies, soccer parents, and rednecks all want in. In Redneck Invasion, you control one of these factions and compete for cultural influence over the town. Build businesses and cultural institutions, secure city council seats, and watch your pile of cash and cultural influence grow over time. Strike deals with other players to launch joint projects one moment, like a Trucker Hat Store for the Hipsters and Rednecks or Swimming Pool for the Preppies and the Soccer Parents. In the next moment, use event cards to send lawsuits and campaign attack ads to undermine your opponents’ best laid plans. After all, only one group of invaders will end up with the city of their dreams.

The game board has four sectors: Downtown, Midtown, Suburbs, and Boondocks. Buildings Downtown deliver greater returns, but they also cost more to build. Players build both Businesses and Cultural Institutions. You can choose to build alone or in conjunction with other players.

Businesses generate Cash, and Cultural Institutions generate Mojo. You'll need both to acquire City Council seats, which are how you get building permits.

Along the way, you'll also acquire Event Cards that will help you build or upgrade your Businesses and Cultural Institutions, impair those of your opponents, or influence the City Council and Building Permits.

Once the city's population reaches 1,000,000, the player with the most Mojo wins.

name: Hamaritagari
description:
User summary:
はまりたがり (Hamaritagari) is a real-time action game in which players compete in speed and accuracy for pattern recognition and card play. In English, 'Hamaritagari' means something like 'Those who like a perfect fit'.

You have several cats with various coat patterns, who are looking for places to be comfortable. Meet their request before everyone else by finding something into which they can comfortably fit.

A round proceeds as follows:

1) A player draws a target card from the pile and put it on the table face-up. A cat is illustrated in the card.

2) Each player races to play a card that illustrates the same cat as the target card.

3-A) The last player has no chance to score. Proceed to step 1 of the next round immediately.

3-B) The first player scores one point. Place the target card in front of you, and proceed to step 2 of the next round immediately.

3-C) The non-last players may race to steal the top card in front of the last player. Steal one point if successful. Proceed to step 2 of the next round immediately.

Steps 3-A), 3-B) and 3-C) happen simultaneously, so the next round is already in progress while resolving the current round. Players have no time to rest until the end of round ten. The highest scorer at the end of round ten wins the game.

Your pattern recognition skill and reflexes are tested during the game.

Publisher summary:
あなたの飼っている様々な模様の猫は新しいくつろぐ場所を探しています。
相手の猫よりも早くはまれる物を手に入れ猫たちの望みを叶えてあげましょう。

「はまりたがり」は、他のプレイヤーとスピードを競い合うリアルタイム系アクションゲームです。
「めくる・のせる・うばう」３つのアクションを使いこなし、勝利ポイントであるカードの獲得を目指します。
正確なカードを瞬時に探し出す能力と反射神経が試されます。
categories: Action / Dexterity, Animals, Card Game, Party Game, Real-time

name: Chase 10
description:
This board game without a board consists of excitement, challenges, and strategy.

This game, which is easy to play but not so easy to win, is very different than any other card game and different every time it is played.

You may have the best card at the table to win, but at the draw of the command cards, your card is gone from your hand. Who has it now? Maybe you know, maybe you don't, maybe another player knows, or maybe you can get it back in time to win!

It all depends on how the cards fall. Try it, you'll love it.

name: Popeye's Spinach Hunt Game
description:
The Object of Popeye's Spinach Hunt Game is to be the first player to collect all six different colored spinach treasure cards and return to his/her start space.

In this 2 to 4 player game, players start in the corner space of their chosen color. Spin the Popeye spinner and move your boat token the exact number shown. On the way around the board, collect different colored treasure chests filled with spinach. If you land on a Brutus space, you must put back one of your spinach treasure chests and collect it again. To collect treasure chests, you must land (by exact count) on the treasure chest spaces (marked with an X) on the board.

The first player to collect treasure chests of all six different colors and then lands (by exact count) on his/her starting space, wins the game.
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme
publishers: King Features Syndicate, Western Publishing Company, Whitman

name: Loonacy: Game Trade Magazine Expansion
description: An expansion for Loonacy containing five new cards featuring the GTM logo paired with images from the game. This expansion was included in issue #168 of Game Trade Magazine
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Real-time

name: Scavenge: Guide to the Galaxy
description:
The future is an unforgiving place, but you've got a ship, there's plenty of debris to salvage, and that's worth something.

Scavenge is a resource-gathering, space-exploring, alien-fighting, randomly-generated board game. Take on the role of a simple scavenger, scrapping derelict ships and taking any job, just trying to get by in a less than ideal future where humanity has spread throughout the stars.

In Scavenge, players cooperatively explore wrecked ships and abandoned or overrun planet-side facilities. Each character has a specific number of Action Points per turn that all them to Attack, Explore, Scavenge, Trade or Heal.

As a group, the Scavengers visit the 'Job Board' and select a mission type:

Scavenge - search a ship or facility for scrap
Recovery - find a piece of equipment from an abandoned ship or facility
Rescue - locate a captive and safely return them to your ship
Eradicate - clear a ship or facility of all enemies


Each mission type will have a number of varied quests that will have unique mission set-up's as well as mission successes and mission fail's that will impact your Scavenger through the Campaign.
mechanics: Action Points, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Modular Board, Tile Placement, Variable Player Powers

name: Tiny Castles
description:
Tiny Castles is a plateau building game featuring castles, dragons, princesses and knights. Oh, and horses.

It is intended for children the age of four, but I have included lots of rules variants and an expansion to make the game more complex for older children (or even adults?).

The game promotes:
- counting
- visual insight
- logic

This game was originaly entered in the 2015 Children's print and play design contest under the name Castle Builders.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Medieval, Print & Play

name: Princess Adventure
description:
Max the Mischievous has cast a spell that imprisoned Clarissa the Dragon in a magic cage high up in Rose Castle. The Princesses Blossom, Willow, Luna and Grace ask Max to let Clarissa go, but Max hid the key to the cage in the top tower of the castle instead. The Princesses race Max to the top of Rose Castle to get the key to set Clarissa free.

The board is a 48 piece floor sized jigsaw puzzle. After assembling the board the 3D castle is placed in the middle. Each player spins the spinner and advances the character the arrow lands on one space. The Princesses may also all move forward a space, or backwards a space. If any Princess gets to the top first, the players win. If Max gets to the top first, he wins.

name: Wer geht mit mir?
description: Each player has to get 6 playing pieces from the 6 outher spaces straight to the center space whith pictures a die. The number die determines which piece may move 1 space, according to the line it moves in. If the color die shows the players color, the player may move 2 spaces. If it shows the color of another player, the other player may move 1 space too. If the die shows a "?" the player moves his piece and choses anoter player who may move his piece too. On a "+" the player may put his piece to it's center space. The first player to get all 6 pieces to their center spaces wins the game.
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Sociopolio
description:
A veritable relic from the cold war (1974). Sociopolio is played part like Parcheesi and part as Monopoly, and the setting is an imaginary socialist/communist Puerto Rico. The object of the game is to become the "National Work Hero" by reaching the center point of the board.

The board is color printed and styled as Parcheesi, except for each advancing tile which has text similar to the Monopoly board. The gaming pieces are flat coin-like tokens in transparent acrylic. The currency is black ink over white paper, printed on one side.
