The currency has pictures of different famous Puertorrican pro-independence figures like Albizu Campos and Lola Rodriguez de Tio and display prominently the phrase "Banco Nacional de Puerto Rico".
The "community chest" (with a red star on the back of the card) and "chance" (with the Puerto Rican flag) cards have such bonuses as "Merit; you have fulfilled the work assigned to you by the Revolutionary Committee" or "Voluntary Work at the Hostos School". If you are lucky you may even get a "Double ration of fish, pay two pesos", or a "New pair of shoes". Instead of advancing to the next railway, you advance to the next "red star" or "flag".
Along the way, in each space on the board may have hazards, such as "You didn't perform the work assigned, pay a 10 pesos fee" and rewards such as "You helped fixed the neighbors house, earn ten pesos".

Owning this game back in the day would have certainly landed your name in a government black list.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Bugs Bunny's Christmas Game
description: Dell printed different versions of this game in the first two issues of Bugs Bunny's Christmas Funnies in 1951 and 1952. Each game follows the plot of that issue's Bugs Bunny story, along with obstacles that match plot complications in each story. Both games are for two players; in the 1951 version, players can choose to be either Bugs or Elmer Fudd. In the 1952 version, they can be Bugs or Santa Claus. In both versions, players pull chits to determine the number of spaces moved and the winner is the one who reaches the end first.
categories: Animals, Humor, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Space Hero Memoir 40K
description:
A mashup board game lifting components and rules from the three games Memoir '44, Space Crusade, and Heroscape. The result is a 40K themed light 3d combat game.

Using the basic section cards of Memoir '44 to control troops, players move their figures across the landscape looking for the "artefact" glyph, after which they need to get it back across their own base line to win.

The game uses the board from Memoir 44, the terrain from Heroscape and the figures from Space Crusade. Line of sight is a physical vision, just like in Heroscape. Each player controls two teams of 5 figures.

name: Flipped
description:
Flipped is a quick playing dexterity game. It contains a single hexagonal tile that is used to select which challenge a player must perform and is used to perform that challenge.

Players flip the tile onto the table and must perform whichever of the six challenges is pointing at them. Some challenges are solo and others require help from another player.

Use your speed and finesse to earn points by completing challenges. Whoever has the most points at the end is the winner.

name: CaRdPG
description:
Start
Each player starts with 4 (Max.) face cards (Champions) and 5 (Max.) number cards (Combos / Abilities). Separate the rest of the face cards into a Monster deck, and the rest of the number cards into a Combos / Abilities deck. Player’s take turns assigning and using abilities, playing combinations, and dueling. The game ends when a player’s Champions are all tapped or destroyed, and another player successfully duels that player.

Turn
1. Untap
2. Draw
3. Assign Ability
4. Use Champion Abilities (Tap)
5. Play Combinations
6. Duel Opponent or Monster (Tap)
7. Discard

Champions
J – 2 Abilities | Q – 3 Abilities | K – 4 Abilities | A – 5 Abilities

Dueling
Declare a duel by tapping a Champion. Opponent can accept the duel by declaring a blocker with an untapped Champion. If opponent declines, force opponent to duel by rolling dice and matching an ability. If successful, players duel by rolling dice and matching Champion abilities. Duel ends when one player matches an ability, and one player fails to match an ability. Losing player removes all abilities from champion. If there are no attached abilities, the losing player’s Champion is destroyed. Duel a Monster by summoning a Monster from the Monster pile, and assign max. number of abilities. If Monster wins, discard a random ability from Champion. If Champion wins, upgrade Champion, and gain random ability.

Abilities
A Champion ability can be used when a Champion is tapped and the controlling player rolls a number equal to one of the Champion’s assigned abilities. Once a Champion is tapped, its abilities cannot be reused until next turn.

Heart: Draw
Spade: Discard
Diamond: Assign Ability (Discard Pile)
Club: Remove Ability
Red Joker: All Abilities + 1 / Wild Red
Black Joker: All Abilities - 1 / Wild Black

Combinations
Combinations are ranked in ascending order from left to right (Roll# - 5SF). Higher ranked combos counter lower ranked combos. The two top rows of combos can only be played following a dice roll, and at least one card number must match. The two bottom rows of combos can be played at any time.

Roll #: Re-Roll | Pair: Counter Roll | 3 Kind: Remove all abilities | 4 Kind: Destroy Champion / Monster |
2 Straight: + / - 1 | 3 Straight: + / - 2 | 4 Straight: + / - 3 | 5 Straight: + / - 4 | 2 Flush: 1 Ability | 3 Flush: 2 Abilities | 4 Flush: 3 Abilities | 5 Flush: 4 Abilities |
2 SF: Card Search | 3 SF: Summon Monster | 4 SF: Upgrade Champion | 5 SF: Protection: Combos / Abilities

—description from the designer
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Open Drafting, Take That

name: The Tower
description:
Each player grabs eight cubes with variously colored faces and sets them on the table before them, ”silly-face” sides facing up.

One player grabs the tower, flips it upside down, gives it a shake, and then places it back on the table. Eight colored balls immediately fall down into the tube in a random order. As soon as the eighth ball lands on the top, the game begins and the race is on. Players start flipping and stacking their cubes to perfectly match the order of colors in the tower.

Players must be careful, however, as each cube holds a different combination of colors. The color needed once a player gets to the top might be lost in the cubes down below—the player will then have to take it all down, rearrange their cubes, and stack it all over again.

The first player to stack his or her cubes and perfectly match the tower wins the round. The first player to win three rounds wins the game.
mechanics: Pattern Building, Pattern Recognition, Speed Matching

name: Bug Wars
description: Bug Wars is a crazy battle where you blast your opponent's bugs. Strategically set up your five bugs on your Battlefield. Load your pump gun with soft darts and knock the heads off of your opponent's bugs as fast as you can.

name: Prospector's Game
description: A dice-based game where you try to advance your pawn to the winning space by rolling 10's, 11's, and 12's. It seems to be a thinly-disguised gambling game.

name: Imperium Chronicles: In Harm's Way Tactics – Streets of Regalis
description:
Streets of Regalis is a campaign setting for In Harm's Way Tactics, the turn-based tactical combat game. In a massive expansion of the original game, Streets of Regalis introduces players to the capital city of the Imperium, including three separate districts with distinct missions and factions. With this new campaign, characters can enjoy hours of gameplay in the Imperium Chronicles universe.

(Disclaimer: Not affiliated with the In Harm's Way line of RPGs published by Flying Mice Games.)
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Paper-and-Pencil

name: Snipstern
description:
Each player has a set of pawns that start in his or her corner of the board. The goal is to move the pawns around the board to the "home" spaces. Movement is determined by a die. All players move around the board on their own track in the shape of a triangle. All 4 triangles together form a star, so the players may capture each other's pawns at the intersections. Captured pawns are returned to their player's corner and must start their journey over. The winner is the first player to move all pawns "home".

The game was published between 1923 and 1937.
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Do My Bidding
description:
Put down your weapons! You fought your battles, now hire heroes for the hard work. Players bid to complete quests and earn rewards.

Each player begins with gold that they use to secretly bid for Heroes to complete their quests. The player with the highest bid wins the Hero's service. Their quest and hero is set aside until the required number of days (turns) pass. The Hero then returns with gold. Journey tokens add twists that may help or hurt players. Play continues around the table with new quests and new heroes. After 10 turns any heroes still out questing come home and all players count their gold to see who is richest!
categories: Ancient, Bluffing, Card Game, Medieval, Mythology

name: Orator
description:
The object of Orator is to deliver the best orations on a variety of topics without making any blunders within a two minute time limit. Players attempt to avoid blunders commonly made in spoken English today, such as, 'umm', 'aah', 'err' etc.

Players may resort to bluffing to complete their talk however successful detection of bluffing and making of blunders incurs penalties. The player who is given the highest score by the other players (the audience) wins the round. The winner of Orator is the player with the best overall score for the game.

name: Sirasutopia
description:
User summary:
シラストピア (Sirasutopia) is a competition to be the most charming girl in the class between two girls: Sirasu, an ordinary Primary School girl, and Pia, an avatar of Rabbit Tribe who is pretending to be a school girl. Players plan their days by choosing three out of five action cards.

Each card has various effects, such as raising their statistics (intelligence or dressing), attracting a boy they like, and interfering opponent's actions.
After the third round, they gain victory points if they meet the conditions for a charming girl.

Publisher's summary:
平凡な小学生しらすちゃんと、ウサギ族の化身ぴあたんが
クラスのイケてる存在を目指すゲームです。
プレーヤーはしらすちゃんかぴあたんを演じ
5枚のアクションカードのうち3枚をセットし日々の予定を立てます。
すると、学力やオシャレ度が向上したり男の子の気を引いたり
相手の行動の邪魔もします。
それらを3ラウンド行い、最終的にイケてる存在の条件を達成し勝利点を得ます。

name: Just Four Kicks
description:
From the publisher's website:
Have you ever found yourself...

Not knowing what you're doing at the gym
Being too drunk at a wedding
Farting in yoga class

Just Four Kicks is a hilarious party game where anything can happen through creativity, quick thinking, and general debauchery. Watch your friends try to act out “being too drunk at a wedding” or use someone else’s body to depict “farting in yoga class.” Bring it to your next game night and it'll be guaranteed to bring your friends together through countless laughs and just a touch of embarrassment.

from the back of the box:
Do you like fun? Do you enjoy laughing? Are you interested in having an all around good time? If you answered yes to any of these questions (hopefully all) grab a copy of Just Four Kicks and prepare to have the time of your life. Inside jokes included in the box.

Now I'm sure you're thinking, wow, this game sounds amazing, how is it played? Start by finding at least three friends (or strangers) and splitting into two equal teams. Just Four Kicks has four rounds of play that will get progressively more intense and hilarious, so choose your teammates wisely. Each player has 30 seconds to get their team to guess as many cards as possible by describing the topic, doing charades, or using someone else's body as a puppet. The team that guesses the most cards wins!

name: Hänsel und Gretel
description:
Simple roll and move game. The first player to reach space 60 on exact count wins the game. The red numbered spaces represent events from the fairy tale that hinder or benefit the players.

The game was most likely produced between 1918 and 1922, since it doesn't show the "ABC Verlag" imprint.

It was also part of at least one game compilation.
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Red Fall
description:
A fully cooperative survival miniatures board game. Mission-based with a highly modular game board.

Every player takes the roll of a survivor to fight against bad hunters and mutants, causes through the outbreak 5 years ago.

Red Fall offers a great combat system where positioning is the key to survive. You have to find Items, weapons, crafting upgrades with components to manage your character. You can learn skills to improve your chances to survive.

Beside the combat system one of the great and innovative game features is the enemy AI. Every enemy acts by itself. They have movement paths and smart combat mechanics.
categories: Comic Book / Strip, Exploration, Horror, Miniatures
mechanics: Action Points, Cooperative Game, Modular Board

name: Dead By Night
description:
In the survival game turned on its undead head Dead By Night, you are part of the legions that now hunt and stalk the remnants of humanity that survive in this shattered and ruined city. Each day still weakens you, and some mortals even attempt to hunt you down as you race against rival beings who are seeking the power to rule the night itself.

Hand management and consistent player interaction make this a fun and casual, yet deceptively strategic risk vs reward-style game.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Modular Board, Push Your Luck, Take That

name: Rip Van Winkle
description: Typical spin and move game. The first player, who cross all the route, wins the game.

name: De vogelvrijverklaarden van Tombstone
description:
This cardgame plays a lot like "Werewolves of Miller's Hollow", but with a twist.

The settings is the wild west, in a town called Tombstone. Two outlaws and a wannabe outlaw are hidden amongst the cowboys, and each night they kill an innocent cowboy. Their goal is to bring down the number of cowboys untill they outnumber them. But each morning the cowboys gather and hang someone, hoping to eliminate the outlaws.

Each player is secretly assigned a role : you may be the sheriff, the barber, the doctor, the priest or the hero. You can hide this identity, but if you want to use your special ability (like healing a shot person if you are the doctor, of taking the confession of another player if you are the priest) then you need to reveal your card. Of course, this is a risk if the outlaws consider you dangerous.

Unlike the werewolves, the outlaws can have a special character too. The priest, or even the hero, can be an outlaw. This makes the paranoia even bigger: when the cowboys decide to hang a person, why does the judge decide to let him free? Why doesn't the doctor heal the priest after being shot? This make the game much more intriguing. No more "hey i'm a special character i'm innocent"...

Another difference is that you can play the game with lesser persons. There are rules to play the game with up to 25 players, but slightly different rules to make it playable with 13-24 players, 4-12 players, and even 2-3 players. In the case of 4-12 players each player has more than one character, which means you are not eliminated out of the game as soon as one character dies.
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Deduction, Party Game
mechanics: Role Playing, Team-Based Game, Variable Player Powers

name: Primordial Dungeon
description:
Abstract game where players will build the dungeon rooms with cards from their hands until reaching the exit of the dungeon. Players will earn victory points matching cards played with position of their pawns.

The goal is to arrive to the exit but be sure to have enough points to win.
mechanics: Area Movement, Modular Board, Open Drafting, Pattern Building, Pattern Recognition, Rock-Paper-Scissors

name: Radar Command
description:
Radar Command is a 90-120 minute strategy board game. Start by building your own fleet, choosing from ships, islands, a radar base, air fields and etc... Once your fleet has been picked place your pieces on your map.

Once your pieces are in play it's time to search and destroy your opponent. May the best admiral win!

By using special interrupter cards you can add reinforcements, repair damage or retreat from a particularly intense battle.

With Radar Command's unique playing boards you can write directly on the playing board and easily erase for the next game. Have fun each game by choosing different ships and bases and by varying your game board set-up.

name: Dice Mutants: Evolution Battle
description:
Players are sentient dice that are evolving and battling at the same time.

Dice Mutants: Evolution Battle is a dice drafting game. At the beginning of a round, all the dice in the game are rolled and then players take turns claiming one of the available dice. The dice players draft are then assigned to improve their attack, defense, guile, mutation, and speed.

Every round, each Dice Mutant attacks every other Dice Mutant. Once a player has lost all their life points, they are out of the game. Last player left alive is the winner.

name: Boinnnggg
description:
In Boinnnggg, each player is rolling dice to move their four plastic discs around the board onto either frog or flower spaces. When a flower space is reached, a player attempts to flick the disc onto a central flower-themed tower. Landing a piece on the top level or middle level will earn points, while landing directly under the flower will earn no points.

Play continues until the first player has landed all four of their discs onto or under the tower, with the winner being the player who scored the highest number of points.

From the back of the box:
"Frogs hop around this quiet pond, until one all of a sudden attempts to jump to the big central flower. Try to get all your frogs onto the flower in the middle but watch out, the first to get there does not necessarily win the game!"

name: That Was The Year That Was
description:
Take a trip down memory lane in this game of fads and fashions.

Players alternate taking turns answering questions spanning the 50s thru the 80s covering fads/fashion, people, music, and television/movies.

A player is asked a question from one of the categories. If they are correct they will advance one space and be asked a question from the category depicted on that space. A player may answer up to 4 questions correctly and then their turns ends. If they answer a question incorrectly, their turn is over immediately.

The first player (or team) to reach 'finish' wins!

name: NASCARD Racing Simulator
description:
NASCARD Racing Simulator is a motorsport racing card game for 1-9 players.

The game is intented to be played with 1/64 diecast cars but you can play with the cards only.

The game system is simple but sophisticated, cars follow each other in line (1 car by space, on 1 to 3 lines dependings race and tracks),
simultaneously all the players reveal 1 Speed card, and Action cards.
From the last player’s car, we are going to look by comparing speeds and position on the track if a car can overtake or decrease the gap with the car which precedes it, and so on, up to the lead car.

Every player possesses potentially the same Speed cards as his opponents, but does not know what are going to make for every turn, cars forward and behind him.
Cars not allocated to a player are managed by the system.
The races are governed by the same rules as those applied in reality.

Qualifying, launched start, restart, 4 tires pitstop, 2 tires pitstop, splash, tires wear inside and outside, save fuel, incidents, accidents, penalties, yellow flag, safety car, lapped cars, lucky dog, out of gas, green-white-checker finish, competition caution, all the tracks from the championship with their own properties, special superspeedway rules, everything is simulated with simple rules easy to implement.

This is a free game, you just have to pay the printing of the cards by a US printing company who send them directly at your home.

I realize this game because,
1/ I am a great NASCAR fan, I have seen all the races since 1998.
2/ I played many years in some leagues to NASCAR RACING 2003 but this is different.
3/ I possess more than 200 1/64 diecast cars and no game give me opportunity to use and play with them.
For the first time they go out their boxes for a complete season scheduled.

So if you are a NASCAR fan, this game is for you.

Package Contents
608 cards:
64 cards Chrono / PitStop
22 cards Car-Hazard
22 cards Car
52 cards Track (permit to design the 23 tracks).
24 cards Incident on risk-taking
1 card pace car

For each of the 9 colours:
16 cards: Speed
1 card: Risk-taking / Save fuel
1 card: PitStop
1 card: Short run / Long run adjustment
28 cards: Tires / Fuel

name: Wasty & Furious
description:
Drive fast, grab the garbage and bring it to the landfill!

Wasty & Furious is a quick-to-learn card game for 2 or 3 players. Your goal is to collect as much garbage as you can and bring it to the landfill.
But pay attention! Your opponents want to grab the prize too and will do anything they can to stop you from reaching your intent.

The Gameplay
During set-up each player selects a vehicle data sheet and gets a number of Waste Collect cards depending on its stats (this cards will be visible to all players).

Each player is then given a number of cards depending on the vehicle own Capacity.

During a game turn, a player can take some actions:


play a number of Garbage or Event cards, up to his vehicle Speed
as soon as he plays an Event card, his turn ends and the cards rules are applied to the following opponent
instead of playing an Event, he may choose to use a Waste Collect card, that will allow him to collect the garbage on play and refresh his own hand


When a player picks up the last card from the deck, the game is going to end. Every player will play a single turn and then all hands will be discarded.

Everyone will then sum up victory points collected during play to see who's the Garbage Man of The Week.

name: Trap Shot
description:
A "Snappy" action game, where in the goal is to be the first player to score 300 points (or unless a time limit is set and reached) by launching the shooting rod from the rubber bands, attempting to get past the player "manning the trap" trying to prevent you from scoring. Any number of players can participate.

Released by Schaper Manufacturing Co, 1973 but also says The Cootie Company on the box as well.

name: Greebles: Mashup Monster Combat
description:
Dueling tile game that's a cross between dominoes, consequences and certain pocket monster type franchises.

Build monsters from your hand of tiles and send them to destroy your opponent, crushing anything that is in the way. The first set contains three decks - bugs, bots and beasts that can normally only combine with themselves unless a "combine" card is used to cross the gene pools. Original Artwork from Tang Mu though templates are provided to go make your own sets and fight! Files are available for Print 'n' Play or laser cutting your own set.

With a starting hand of 7 tiles, players have 3 actions per turn, picking up, playing or attacking (can repeat the same action more than once to get to three) A monster can only be started with a head section and can only attack when it is completed with a tail. As many body tiles can be played in between these two providing that the symbols on the sides match (combine tiles come into play here). Each tile adds different features to the monster - a red dot/explosion means another d6 is added to the attack pool and a shield with a number in it is a hit point that can only be destroyed by an attack die with a number equal or higher than it. If all the hit points on a tile are destroyed then that tile is taken off the monster and put back into the bag. Players also have three hit points of their own health and are removed from the game when they are destroyed (they can choose which monster defends the attack or can take the damage themselves to keep their precious creations safe)

For extra silliness, when attacking the player has to shout the entire name of their monster (each tile has a portion on the side of it) leading to absurd and often hilarious monsters weighing into battle.

Greebles is published with a Creative Commons Attribution Non-commercial share alike licence as the creator is a great fan of collaboration. It was partly inspired by the drawing game consequences (or exquisite corpses if you went to art school :p) where a piece of paper is folded multiple times with a segment on a body drawn on each and then folded before passing to the next person so the final monster is only revealed when the paper is unfurled. There are blank templates available for the creation of your own sets and the author is planning on releasing official expansion packs as a way of showcasing other illustrators and ideas. A card game variant is also in the works.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Player Elimination, Tile Placement

name: Shallows: A Whailz Battle Game
description:
Shallows is a 2-6 player card battle game using 42 custom Whailz with unique abilities in a free for all competitive fray that can be played again and again.

Shallows uses a unique 6 suite Attack/defense system that is very easy to learn but allows each player to be unique in both his strategy and combat style. Players can opt for a fully aggressive tactic or even defensive approach.

The game mechanics is a combination of War and Mag Blast, but with the decision making on the player's side, not the cards.

On top of that, this game is packed with parodies. From SNES games to 90's cartoons, animes to internet jokes.

name: Front Page Splash
description: To create a news story by drawing random words and fitting them together to make sense until the block is filled up, then a headline is chosen. The winner is the one who has added the most words.

name: Unnützes Quizzen: Tiere
description:
Unnützes Quizzen: Tiere ("Unuseful Knowledge: Animals") is a German Trivia Game with obscure facts about animals.

From the Publisher (translated):
"Test your unuseful knowledge! Can fish die from sunburn? How many naps does a bunny have per day? And do herrings really communicate by farting? The big questions of the animal kingdom - in this quiz from the popular section of the NEON magazine, they will all be answered"

From the publisher (German):
Teste dein unnützes Wissen! Können Fische an Sonnenbrand sterben? Wie viele Nickerchen macht ein Kaninchen pro Tag? Und kommunizieren Heringe wirklich durch Furzen? Die großen Fragen der Tierwelt – in diesem Quiz zur beliebten Rubrik aus dem NEON-Magazin werden sie alle beantwortet! Für zu Hause, für unterwegs, für zwischendurch: 99 Quiz-Fragen zum Immerdabeihaben.

name: Pentathlon
description:
To win the game, the players have to get each of their 5 meeples in one of the 5 game circles on the board. First the gamemaster rolls a die to determine the aktive circle, which is marked with the white meeple. If a player rolls the same number as the game master, he may place a meeple on any free space of the active circle. On a roll of a 6 the player may place a meele in any circle. The spaces 1 to 4 are safe. Only meeples on a 6-space may be replaced by an opponent meeple. The replaced meeples go to the training center at the bottom of the game board and the players have to perform an athletic task. The training center can only be left on the roll of a 6.

The game Ends, when all players have a meeple in each circle. The player with the highest point count wins the game.

Also included are a soccer game (Fußballspiel) and an athletics game (Leichtathletik).

name: Low Budget Colonists
description:
A space program game but with a veeery low budget. You are entrusted with a task to explore space and expand a world of beerlings!You'll hire a team of "extremly talanted" beerlings build a spaceship from scra... from different parts and go in space and even found a colony and maybe if you are really luck... skillful discover alien life.

A game of space exploration and colony management for 2-4 players. At the beginning of the game players deside turn order by rolling dice, then build a space ship from different junk by buying ship tiles of different tiers from stack (cards) with their starting budget which is veeery limited, after this players generate their "heroic" crew by blind drawing trait tokens. After this every player decide the destination by choosing a planet, gas giant or asteroid on a map and try to fly their ship to the chosen destination to found a colony or space station and then manage it. During flight a lot of different events will happen (card drawing) and players will try to deal with them by moving astranaut tokens to the ship tile-event location and roll dice. The time of the program is limited by the total number of turns. And the goal of the game is to survive and make their space program successful by getting the highest amount of points at the end of the game (for every astronaut alive, every module standing and every token of resources) while every turn everything goes wron....to hell.
categories: Adventure, Fantasy, Humor, Space Exploration, Transportation, Travel
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Open Drafting, Tile Placement, Worker Placement

name: Battles Above: WWII Air War Scenarios
description: This is a third-party expansion with additional scenarios for the Check Your 6! air combat miniatures game. The book contains over 140 historical scenarios covering a variety of theaters, including air action over the Western Front, Eastern Front, Malta, and the Pacific. In addition, there are some supplementary and house rules included in the book.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Simulation, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Monsters in the Middle
description:
In a land where Heroes have battled monsters from time immemorial, a fragile peace has been forged. The fighting spirit, however, still remains. In a final effort to avoid rekindling the ages-old combat, a proposal was made: A tournament of Heroes and Monsters battling as days of old. The fame and glory of the fight without the risk of continued war. This tournament became an annual tradition, one which is now called Monsters in the Middle.

Monsters in the Middle is a light-weight modular card game. It features a base set of cards as well as modular cards, which are added to the game to change game play and interactions.

The game is suitable for family play, even those with younger children.

Players can choose to either play a single match from the given games or a tournament consisting of several games.

The games of Monster in the Middle are:

The Champions’ Duel - in this game, players take turns competing to complete sets of cards played on the monsters to earn points. The player with the highest point total when any player plays their final card is the winner.

The Grand Melee - in this game, players work at the same time, trying to be the first to play all their cards.

The Royal Chase - in this game, players work to match the cards in their hands to the cards needed to complete a given set, capturing the Monsters and scoring points along the way.

The Castle Paths - in this game, players draw a hand of cards and select which order they are to play them. All players reveal each card simultaneously, comparing the value with their opponents. The player with the highest total card value wins the cards. Play to capture your opponents' treasures and rid yourself of the monsters in your deck.

The Triumphant March - in this game, players compete to have the highest ranked hand of their opponents, wagering cards along the way to increase their chances of drawing the cards they need.

The various games of Monsters in the Middle include:
Set Collection
Take That
Hand Management
Simultaneous actions
Simultaneous play
Bluffing
Variable player powers
Grid movement
Card shedding
Note: Some games include player elimination, but in all cases where player elimination is possible, it is also an end-game condition.

name: QuickFight: A Legacy Game
description:
QuickFight is the world's first Legacy Deckbuilder.

In QuickFight, you'll not only be writing on cards to upgrade them, but you'll also be physically tearing cards apart. As you fight to create the strongest army, you'll make changes in game 1 that will affect all future games. And by the end of the campaign, you'll have a version of QuickFight that's unlike any other in existence and infinitely replayable. You can even take the deck you built in your game and play it against your friends!

The best part? You can learn and play a game in about 30 minutes. Perfect to pull out during a lunch-break.
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Open Drafting, Simultaneous Action Selection, Take That

name: Corporate Raiders
description:
It's time to make money. Lots of money.

As CEO of a rapidly growing company, it's your job to aggressively grow your company by any means necessary. Perhaps those failing companies around the block might have some extra employees and business opportunities that they don't know what to do with.

Oh, and make sure to lay everyone off by the end of Q4. We need to save money where we can, you know.

Based on the QuickFight: A Legacy Game engine, Corporate Raiders is a lunchbreak deckbuilder that can be learned and played in just 30 minutes, and features simultaneous play so and your fellow CEOs can get a game in quickly, before your real boss catches you!
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Open Drafting, Simultaneous Action Selection, Take That

name: Habt acht! Verkehrsspiel
description:
The first player to reach the space "Ziel" wins the game. Movement is determined by playing (very tiny) cards. Some spaces hinder or benefit the players.

The players start with 3 cards. To move the player must match his cards to the number on the space ahead of his playing piece. If he does this with one card (the number on the space and the card are the same), he moves one space. If he uses more cards (adding and/or subtracting) he moves according to the number of cards he uses. After each move the player draws a new card and moves again if possible. If he can't match the number, he can't move and the next player draws a card and continues the game. On the first turn the players may only draw a fouth card, if the can't match the "1" on the first space with their three cards.

The playing pieces are little plastic disks with a hole in the center and are moved with wooden sticks.

name: Manege frei für Felix
description: Manege frei für Felix is a cooperative children's game in which the players, as circus artists, look for the rabbit Felix and try to get it back to the circus tent before Director Barelli lets the show start without him. The game design uses a simple dice-rolling mechanisms as well as seven face-down cards that might be reshuffled during the game.

name: Fur vs Scale
description:
Fur vs Scale is a fast-paced tabletop card game for 2-4 players, pitting anthropomorphic animal heroes of rival kingdoms against each other in strategic combat. The game captures the ebb and flow of an arcade fighter, challenging players to construct winning combinations of attacks, blocks, counters, super moves, and special abilities over four rounds of combat to reach 60 points and be crowned victor.

Players begin by selecting a hero, each with unique special abilities and a pool of Move List cards. At the start of each round, both players construct their Move List of six cards from their hero's limited pool. Play then alternates as each player adds one of their cards to the table, creating a Fight Map of varying point values. Special abilities, combinations, and power ups may also be used to alter the Fight Map or achieve bonus points.

Once all Move List cards have been played, scores are tallied for the round. If a player has accumulated 60 or more points, they are are declared the winner. Otherwise, players construct a new Move List and begin another round. If neither player has accumulated 60 points after four rounds, the game ends in a draw.
categories: Card Game, Fantasy, Fighting, Video Game Theme

name: Unnützes Wissen: Männer und Frauen
description:
Unnützes Quizzen: Männer und Frauen ("Unuseful Knowledge: Men and Women") is a German Trivia Game with obscure facts about the genders.

From the Publisher (translated):
"Test your unuseful knowledge! Do men really dream about sex more often than women? Where do the most easy women of europe live? And how many british men have sexual phantasies about David Beckham? The big questions about the genders - in this quiz from the popular section of the NEON magazine, they will all be answered. For at home, on the go, for in between: 99 quizzes to always have."

From the publisher (German):
Teste dein unnützes Wissen! Träumen Männer wirklich öfter von Sex als Frauen? Wo leben die leichtesten Frauen Europas? Und wie viele britische Männer haben sexuelle Phantasien, in denen David Beckham vorkommt? Die großen Fragen der Menschheit – in diesem Quiz zur beliebten Rubrik aus dem NEON-Magazin werden sie alle beantwortet! Für zu Hause, für unterwegs, für zwischendurch: 99 Quiz-Fragen zum Immerdabeihaben.

name: Unnützes Wissen: Fußball
description:
Unnützes Quizzen: Fußball ("Unuseful Knowledge: Football") is a German Trivia Game with obscure facts about football.

From the publisher (translated):
"Test your unuseful knowledge! Who shot the most own goals in Bundesliga history? How many penalty kicks did Gerd Müller screw up? And how long does the winter break in the Ukrainian Premier League take? The big questions of football - in this quiz from the popular section of the NEON magazine, they will all be answered"

From the publisher (German):
Teste dein unnützes Fußball-Wissen! Wer schoss die meisten Eigentore der Bundesligageschichte? Wie viele Elfmeter versemmelte Gerd Müller? Und wie lange dauert eigentlich die Winterpause in der ukrainischen Liga? Die großen Fragen des Fußballs – in diesem Quiz zur beliebten Rubrik aus dem NEON-Magazin werden sie alle beantwortet! Für zu Hause, für unterwegs, für zwischendurch: 99 Quiz-Fragen zum Immerdabeihaben. Ein unerlässliches Fakten-Sammelsurium zur Vorbereitung auf die Fußball-WM!

name: Unnützes Quizzen: Ideen und Erfindungen
description:
Unnützes Quizzen: Ideen und Erfindungen("Unuseful Knowledge: Ideas and Inventions") is a German Trivia Game with obscure facts about ideas and inventions.

From the Publisher (translated):
"Test your unuseful knowledge! Why was the clone sheep Dolly named after the busty US country singer Dolly Parton? What was the content of the very first SMS? And which invention made the unemployed heating engineer Charles Brace Darrow a millionaire?"

From the publisher (German):
Teste dein unnützes Wissen!
Warum wurde Klonschaf Dolly nach der vollbusigen US-Countrysängerin Dolly Parton benannt? Was stand in der allerersten SMS? Und mit welcher Erfindung wurde der arbeitslose Heizungsbauer Charles Brace Darrow zum Millionär?

name: Unnützes Quizzen: Film and Music
description:
Unnützes Quizzen: Film und Musik("Unuseful Knowledge: Film and Music") is a German Trivia Game with obscure facts about film and music.

From the Publisher (translated):
"Test your useless knowledge! What present did Elton John receive from Eminem as a wedding present? How old did Woody Allen's father get? And was Quentin Tarantino really an usher in a porn cinema? The great questions of the film and music history - in this quiz to popular section of the NEON magazine they will all be answered! For at home, on the go, for in between: 99 quizzes to always have."

From the publisher (German):
Teste dein unnützes Wissen! Was bekam Elton John von Eminem zur Hochzeit geschenkt? Wie alt wurde Woody Allens Vater? Und war Quentin Tarantino wirklich mal Platzanweiser in einem Pornokino? Die großen Fragen der Film- und Musikgeschichte – in diesem Quiz zur beliebten Rubrik aus dem NEON-Magazin werden sie alle beantwortet! Für zu Hause, für unterwegs, für zwischendurch: 99 Quiz-Fragen zum Immerdabeihaben.

name: Unnützes Quizzen: Natur & Umwelt
description:
Unnützes Quizzen: Natur und Umwelt ("Unuseful Knowledge: Nature and Enviroment") is a German Trivia Game with obscure facts about nature.

From the Publisher (translated):
"Test your useless knowledge! How many tons of pigeon excrement are raining down on Berlin per? Can tomatoes really warn each other from insect attacks? And can fish actually get seasick? The great questions of nature - in this quiz to popular section of the NEON magazine they will all be answered! For at home, on the go, for in between: 99 quizzes to always have."

From the publisher (German):
Teste dein unnützes Wissen! Wie viele Tonnen Taubenexkremente regnet es täglich in Berlin? Warnen Tomaten sich wirklich gegenseitig vor Insektenangriffen? Und können Fische eigentlich seekrank werden?Die großen Fragen der Natur – in diesem Quiz zur beliebten Rubrik aus dem NEON-Magazin werden sie alle beantwortet! Für zu Hause, für unterwegs, für zwischendurch: 99 Quiz-Fragen zum Immerdabeihaben.

name: Unnützes Quizzen: Sport & Rekorde
description:
Unnützes Quizzen: Sport & Rekorde ("Unuseful Knowledge: Sports and Records") is a German Trivia Game with obscure facts about sports and records.

From the Publisher (translated):
"In how many meters is the record in the mobile phone throwing? What is the name of a Norwegian winter sport: Supi, Geilo or Krassa? And who actually won the first major car race in the history of Turkmenistan? The big questions of sport - in this quiz to popular section of the NEON magazine they will all be answered! For home, on the go, for in between: 99 quizzes to take-along-have."

From the publisher (German):
Bei wie viel Metern liegt der Rekord im Handyweitwurf? Heißt dieser norwegische Wintersportort Supi, Geilo oder Krassa? Und wer gewann eigentlich das erste größere Autorennen in der Geschichte von Turkmenistan? Die großen Fragen des Sports – in diesem Quiz zur beliebten Rubrik aus dem NEON-Magazin werden sie alle beantwortet! Für zuhause, für unterwegs, für zwischendurch: 99 Quiz-Fragen zum Immer-dabei-haben.

name: Capital Combat
description:
Capital Combat is a game that inspires a world of battle simulation, resource management, critical thinking, and decision-making. It brings the play-action to your kitchen table. The gameplay is fast-paced, fun, and easy to learn. Capital Combat provides an exciting playing experience for the whole family that develops decisive, tactical, and strategic thinking for both kids and adults alike. Player’s wits are matched against one another, alliances are created, and each play experience provides unique challenges using a distinctive blend of cards, dice, and toy componentry.

Take a break from the screen, sit down together, and enjoy a truly unique play experience.

Capital Combat comes with a standard set of playing dice. However, if players bring their own dice set, d4-d20, this can significantly enhance gameplay.

http://www.capitalcombatgame.com
https://www.thegamecrafter.com/games/capital-combat
categories: Abstract Strategy, Aviation / Flight, Card Game, Dice, Economic, Math, Modern Warfare, Nautical, Transportation, Wargame
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Open Drafting, Pattern Building, Pattern Recognition, Player Elimination, Set Collection, Simulation, Team-Based Game

name: GOLFun with the Animals
description:
This game is intended to teach children and adults a few things about the game of golf. Players learn how to keep score, learn golf terms, and learn golf rules.

Players roll a variety of colored dice to advance a "golf ball" tiddlywink along a festive golf course board. Characters include "Hump" the camel and "Andy" the alligator. A spinner is used for putting when a player reaches the green. Score is kept according to golf rules and two options are available... nine holes or eighteen holes.

Designed to be enjoyed by 1 to 4 players ages 6 and older.

Includes a two-sided board, dice, tiddlywinks, putting wheel, score pad, rules, and a pencil.

name: Marienkäfer, flieg
description:
Marienkäfer, flieg: The players start on the orange spaces on the outher ring. The first player to reach the center space wins the game. Movement is determined by a die. Direction of movement from each space follows the direction of the antlers of the pictured lady bug. If the antlers point to another ring, the player changes rings and moves in the direction of the first space on that ring.

The game board has another game on the backside: Kinderglücksspiel. To win this game the players have to move from one of the outher starting spaces to the center space. Movement is determined by two dice of which the player may chose one to make his move. The players move their meeples one space in the direction that matches their chosen die.
If a meeple gets on a space that is already occupied by another meeple, the later one must start anew.

The game was published in the 1980s.
mechanics: Grid Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Slash: PAXspansion 2015
description:
Slash is a card-based party game in which players compete to create the best romantic fan fiction pairing. Everybody gets a hand of their favorite characters from pop culture, history, and literature. The matchmaker selects one from her hand and places it face up on the table. For a bit more storytelling, the matchmaker can request that each player narrate some portion of the relationship they are attempting to create. Maybe it's the first date, or their wedding day, or the moment when they realized they belonged together.

Each player in turn selects a possible 'ship for that character using a card from their hand, narrating as necessary and hoping that the matchmaker chooses theirs — but if she doesn't, you can always narrate the tale of this destined connection to win the favor of the table and overrule the matchmaker. Play continues until one player has accumulated 20 points worth of characters.

Slash: PAXspansion 2015, which works as both a standalone game and an expansion for Slash: Romance without boundaries, has forty new characters and five blank cards, including Terrible Teenage Poets, Gary Gygax, and a $20,000 gaming table.
mechanics: Acting, Betting and Bluffing, Role Playing, Storytelling, Voting

name: Slash: Nerdlesque GGC 2015
description:
Slash is a card-based party game in which players compete to create the best romantic fan fiction pairing. Everybody gets a hand of their favorite characters from pop culture, history, and literature. The matchmaker selects one from her hand and places it face up on the table. For a bit more storytelling, the matchmaker can request that each player narrate some portion of the relationship they are attempting to create. Maybe it's the first date, or their wedding day, or the moment when they realized they belonged together.

Each player in turn selects a possible 'ship for that character using a card from their hand, narrating as necessary and hoping that the matchmaker chooses theirs — but if she doesn't, you can always narrate the tale of this destined connection to win the favor of the table and overrule the matchmaker. Play continues until one player has accumulated 20 points worth of characters.

Slash: Nerdlesque GGC 2015, which works as both a standalone game and an expansion for Slash: Romance without boundaries, has forty new characters and five blank cards, including Xenomorphs, Dr. Watson, and the classic android Maria.
mechanics: Acting, Betting and Bluffing, Role Playing, Storytelling, Voting

name: Slash: Nerdlesque 2015
description:
Slash is a card-based party game in which players compete to create the best romantic fan fiction pairing. Everybody gets a hand of their favorite characters from pop culture, history, and literature. The matchmaker selects one from her hand and places it face up on the table. For a bit more storytelling, the matchmaker can request that each player narrate some portion of the relationship they are attempting to create. Maybe it's the first date, or their wedding day, or the moment when they realized they belonged together.

Each player in turn selects a possible 'ship for that character using a card from their hand, narrating as necessary and hoping that the matchmaker chooses theirs — but if she doesn't, you can always narrate the tale of this destined connection to win the favor of the table and overrule the matchmaker. Play continues until one player has accumulated 20 points worth of characters.

Slash: Nerdlesque 2015, which works as both a standalone game and an expansion for Slash: Romance without boundaries, has forty new characters and five blank cards, including Martian rockstars, Canadian clones, and wrestling legends.
mechanics: Acting, Betting and Bluffing, Role Playing, Storytelling, Voting

name: Slash: Shipwreck October 2014
description:
Slash is a card-based party game in which players compete to create the best romantic fan fiction pairing. Everybody gets a hand of their favorite characters from pop culture, history, and literature. The matchmaker selects one from her hand and places it face up on the table. For a bit more storytelling, the matchmaker can request that each player narrate some portion of the relationship they are attempting to create. Maybe it's the first date, or their wedding day, or the moment when they realized they belonged together.

Each player in turn selects a possible 'ship for that character using a card from their hand, narrating as necessary and hoping that the matchmaker chooses theirs — but if she doesn't, you can always narrate the tale of this destined connection to win the favor of the table and overrule the matchmaker. Play continues until one player has accumulated 20 points worth of characters.

Slash: Shipwreck October 2014, which works as both a standalone game and an expansion for Slash: Romance without boundaries, has forty literary characters and five blank cards, including Faceless Old Woman, Giant Space Octopi, and Clint Eastwood. Can you find them a love connection?
mechanics: Acting, Betting and Bluffing, Role Playing, Storytelling, Voting

name: Treasure Dive
description:
Copied from Rules of Play insert:

The Treasure Dive Game was invented by Ronald C. Ketchum, an internationally certified Scuba Instructor. He created the game as a fun means of review of scuba safety skills for his diving students in Australia. The game has since been revised to include a basic level for children and an advanced level for scuba divers, so that both may play the game at their own level.
INTRODUCTION... Imagine you and your friends each discovering eight pieces of 8 coins on a beach. You know a treasure ship must lay offshore, with a treasure chest containing fabulous wealth. The race is on to be the first one to reach the treasure and claim exclusive salvage rights.
OBJECT...The object of the game is to become the first diver to reach the sunken treasure and return to the surface, thereby staking claim as the Legal Salvor. Descent to the treasure is made by earning various levels of scuba certification. Hazards about, and a knowledge of first aid and diving safety will help you reach the treasure safely.

name: Nerf Rebelle Disc Target Game
description:
The Nerf Rebelle Disc Target Game was released as a toy included in McDonald's Happy Meals. It is part of the Nerf Rebelle line, designed to appeal primarily to girls.

This game has a two-sided board and can be played in two ways. One side of the board is a combination of a dexterity game and tic-tac-toe. The board is laid out on the floor or a table and players take turns throwing plastic discs, trying to land them in one of the spaces on the 3x3 grid. Players may of course knock other players' discs off the board. Like tic-tac-toe, the first player to get three discs in a row wins.

The other side of the board is a target game. Players take turns throwing their discs at the board, trying to land them in scoring circles. Smaller circles have higher point values. After each player has thrown all his or her discs, the highest total score wins.

Because the rules are minimal (and conveyed only with pictures), player will have to create house rules to answer lots of questions, such as whether players may pick up and rethrow discs if no one get three in a row in the tic-tac-toe version and how much of a disc must be inside a scoring circle to score points in the target game.

name: Soldier Emperor: Dreams of Empire
description:
Description from the publisher:

Napoleon's 1803 coronation as Emperor of the French touched off a worldwide series of wars, that lasted until his second and final exile in 1815. Soldier Emperor lets you play out the campaigns in Europe, while Indian Empires covers those in, you guessed it, India.

Soldier Emperor: Dreams of Empire is a 64-page book that brings those two games together, with a linking map covering the Persian Empire and the Central Asian khanates of Khiva, Kokand and Bokhara, plus some pieces of Afghanistan and other regions and new pieces to represent the armies and leaders of these distant lands.

The book also includes additional scenarios for each game. For Soldier Emperor, it's the war that would have broken out in 1815 had Napoleon not returned from Elba to re-unite his quarreling enemies. For Indian Empires, there's the 1760 Afghan-Maratha War, which resulted in the massive Battle of Panipat, and the Seven Years' War in India featuring the conquests of Robert Clive.

And there are more new variants for both Soldier Emperor and Indian Empires, like National Aspirations to give each power their own special victory conditions and special abilities for each major power. These make every country different to play, and not just because of their geographical position. There are new Imperial Power rules, and a whole assortment of additional special rules just because they make the games even more fun to play.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Napoleonic, Territory Building, Wargame
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: Pengin Jujiryou
description:
User summary:
ペンギン十字稜 (Pengin Jujiryou) means "Penguin Pyramidion" in English.

One day, a Penguin suddenly claimed that he is the "Emperor" of all the Penguins. The entire Penguin nation, which once lived peacefully, became strained and is currently in the midst of struggle. Each species has to flourish by increasing their population and producing offspring. Weak species will become extinct naturally, but even strong species may be made extinct by misfortune. Only one species may survive in the end!

Players roll total of 55 dice, and build a five-tier pyramid. You have to name a species which will be the summit of the pyramid. Which species will win the generations-long survival game?

The artwork for this game uses copyright free images.

Publisher's summary:
ある日突然、一匹のペンギンが『帝王』であると名乗りを上げました。
平和な群れに緊張が走ります。いままさにペンギン達は、競争の真っただ中です。兄弟を増やして繁栄し、後の世代に子孫を残さねばなりません。 弱い遺伝子は淘汰され、強い遺伝子も運が悪ければ絶えてしまいます。
最終的に生き残るのはたった一種類のみです！
プレイヤーは55個のダイスを積み上げてピラミッドを作ります。そのてっぺんに座ることになるペンギンを推理せねばなりません。
世代を超えて繰り広げられる、サバイバルゲームに勝利するのはどの種族でしょうか？
publishers: Chicken Dice Games (チキンダイスゲームズ)

name: Barbie: Wer packt zuerst seine Koffer?
description:
What a nice surprise! Barbie's girlfriends have invited her on a short holiday, and they're already on the way to her house to pick her up — but her dresses are all mixed up and the two suitcases that she needs for the holiday are still empty.

In Barbie: Wer packt zuerst seine Koffer?, you need to put together the perfect holiday outfit for Barbie before her girlfriends show up at the door. Can you do it?

name: Rund um die Welt: Eine interessante Rekordfahrt
description: The player wo rolls highest begins and choses a continent to travel (green track). Every player has to chose another continent. Movement is determinated by a die. After completing their continental journey the players go to Berlin to start their race around the world (red track). The first player to return to Berlin wins the game. At some cities certain events hinder or benefit the players.
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Survival: Frogs of South Eastern Australia
description:
Survival: Frogs of South Eastern Australia tells the struggle of five endangered Australian frog species: The Southern Corroboree Frog, Spotted Tree Frog, Baw Baw Frog, Stuttering Frog, and the Growling Grass Frog. In this cooperative game, the players try to return and establish stable populations of each species to the wild.

All player's hands are seen only by them, but they cannot play cards from their own hand. Instead they must use the action cards to find out information about the cards held by other players, all while trying to avoid threats to the frogs and their habitats.

The game was developed and designed by 5D (in 2014), 6A (in 2015) and their teacher at Berwick Fields Primary School. Wanting to do something to help endangered frog species, the class launched a two-year learning journey and this game is the product of that. Along the way, the class was awarded the Zoos Victoria Love Your Locals 2014 winner for its work on the game and was inducted into the Zoos Victoria Hall of Fame for Young Wildlife Advocates of the year in 2015.

name: Squadron Dice
description:
Take to the sky commanding a squadron of bi-planes in this exciting head-to-head dice game! Sharpen your aim as your competitors dodge your attack. Call up your flying Aces to take down your opponent’s planes and claim your victory!

Squadron Dice is a game of elimination. First, players roll a set of dice to gain position over other players. Next, the highest and lowest positioned players roll dice again, forcing the lowest positioned player to remove one of their Squadron dice from the game.

A player is eliminated from the game when a player cannot replace a Rookie die with an Aces die after a loss on an Evade roll during a Resolve Phase. When all other players have been eliminated from the game, you win.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Dice, World War I
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Player Elimination, Push Your Luck, Simulation, Take That

name: American Dynasty
description:
In American Dynasty you will play as one of the grand American political families: the Roosevelts, the Kennedys, the Bushes, or the Clintons. To assert your family’s supremacy you will employ the time­-honored tools of civic discourse, such as manipulation of the media, tactical legislation, calling in favors, back­stabbing, stabbing, and the accumulation and distribution of money. You must build your political engine, sabotage your opponents, and bully and barter your way into the hearts and minds of the American electorate, ignorant of the closed door meetings, and deliberately impassioned by carefully orchestrated media events. By getting your candidates elected to congress, passing bills, and hopefully becoming president, you will crusade against your rival dynasties, sacrificing resources and morality in equal share. Anything, for the good of the family.

GAMEPLAY: The game is played over the course of 5 Terms, and the goal of the game is to collect the most Electorals by the end of Term 5. Each term, players take turns taking 2 actions each (playing Core Action cards or Media Event cards, introducing Bills for voting, and other special) until an Election is triggered. In an Election, players with competing candidates roll dice and add on bonuses they prepared before the Election to determine winners of each vote. Winning candidates then take office and can vote on Bills and other issues. Electorals can be gained in multiple ways, including winning elections and passing bills. Negotiation, trades, bartering, bribes and table-talk are strongly encouraged.

name: Jan & Henry: Das Memo-Spiel
description: With Jan & Henry: Das Memo-Spiel, youngsters can immerse themselves in the stories of Jan and Henry while trying to find where Henry tucked away the birthday cake or where the bed went to. In the end, whoever finds the most pairs of tiles wins!

name: Termite Queen
description: A promo added by the publisher to every copy of the base game until it's out of stock, designed by Mateusz Żbikowski. A set of 4 tiles - one for each player, depicting a termite queen in their colour. The queen lies in player's supply from the beginning of the game. During their turn, in the reproduction phase, a player can - once during the entire game - place their queen on any hex (except for water or stone) instead of a normal termite. When on the board, the queen cannot be attacked, moved, does not attack or support attacks. A player may move through/over the hex with their queen. The quuen can be replaced by any available termite tile belonging to the same player as the queen.

name: Fun to Go: Fragen über Fragen
description:
Description from the publisher:

Based on the familiar traveling game of "I spy with my little eye", Fun to Go: Fragen über Fragen challenges most of the players to guess what the active player is seeing on their card by asking only questions that can be answered either "yes" or "no".

name: Jan & Henry: Das Geräuschespiel
description:
Description from the publisher:

Jan and Henry have once again been hearing strange noises! In Jan & Henry: Das Geräuschespiel, players assume the role of one of the meerkats and describe to the other players the sounds they hear or they imitate the noises themselves. Who can guess the most noises?

name: Shopping Queen: Das kleine Quiz
description:
Description from the publisher:

What regulates the drawstring? What was the lowest amount a candidate on Shopping Queen ever spent on her outfit? How often did Guido Maria Kretschmer give zero points? You'll find these and other questions in Shopping Queen: Das kleine Quiz. Learn the detailed answers and exciting knowledge about one of the most beautiful themes of world.

name: JadeJack
description: Hi-Jack is an abstract strategy game, played in a 6x6 or 8x8 square board. It is a territory game. Players take turns placing pieces in the board; those pieces exert influence (i.e. claims) over adjacent spaces. Players score at the end of the game for the territory rhey influence more than their opponents. Highest score wins.

name: Fairy Tale Chess
description:
Fairy Tale Chess is for people who want to add an air of uncertainty to their chess games.

Unlike normal chess, Fairy Tale Chess uses a deck of Chance Cards that are drawn at the start of every player's turn, with results ranging from the helpful to the disastrous.

Follow the basic rules of Chess except where stated.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Print & Play
mechanics: Grid Movement, Open Drafting, Variable Player Powers

name: Peace. A Wargame.
description:
Politics is the art of the possible.
War is politics by other means.
Peace and war. War and peace.

Take the role of the leaders of European major power in the times of Napoleonic Wars. Try to negotiate the most favourable peace, but remember sometimes war might be the only way, leading to it.

Players form partnerships or alliances, which then compete for assets: political influence. Those could be gain through diplomacy, (spending diplomatic actions) or war (spending military actions). Players move their playing pieces to vie for influence on the board representing 19th Century Europe. Influence can also be gained by completing diplomatic or military missions, shown on cards.

The alliances are not very stable, so each turn may see other set of players cooperating.

The winner is the player, who can fulfill set of ambitions of the Empire he or she is representing.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Team-Based Game

name: Ph. D. The Game: Dr. Dinosaur
description:
Included as a Limited Edition Card for KS backers of Dino Dude Ranch and KS Backers of the original Ph. D. game, it is a Dinosaur Dude Rancher as the image but in the style of Ph. D. The Game.

It adds a new Lab member card to the original game
mechanics: Hand Management, Set Collection, Take That

name: Gozaru Gozaru Ninja de Gozaru
description:
User summary:
ござるござる忍者でござる (Gozaru Gozaru Ninja de Gozaru) means "We are NINJA!" in English.

Ninjas are trying to steal your secret documents. Even high fences and heavy security cannot prevent them from infiltrating. Once you let even one of them sneak in, the entire territory will be overflowing with them and all the documents will be stolen. Counter-intelligence is the only way to protect your documents. You must mislead the Ninjas away from your documents.

The game is played with 2-4 players. Each player has four secret documents hidden in a 5x5 square grid gameboard. Your goal is to place Ninja tiles on squares where opponents' documents are hidden, while protecting your documents. During the game, players take turns placing a Ninja tile following placement rules. At the end of game, you score victory points if your document square is not occupied by a Ninja tile.

Are you smart enough to protect your secret documents?

The artwork for this game came from copyright free images.

Publisher's summary:
ボード上に忍者タイルを配置して、自分の密書のマスを守り抜きましょう。
しかし、どんどん増えてゆく忍者を前にしては、簡単な事ではありません！
あなたは大事な密書を守れるでしょうか？　

「密書」が狙われている。
どんなに高い塀も、どんなに厳重な警備も、忍者の進入を阻む事は出来ない。侵入を許せば、不思議な術で部屋はたちまち忍者で溢れかえり、根こそぎ奪われてしまう事だろう。
忍者から密書をまもる為には、情報戦しかない。忍者をミスリードしてあなたの密書から遠ざけるのだ！
publishers: Chicken Dice Games (チキンダイスゲームズ)

name: Ironsides Preston 1648 Worcester 1651
description:
Ironsides is a moderate complexity game on the decisive battles of Oliver Cromwell and the “Ironsides” of the New Model Army at Preston in 1648 and Worcester in 1651 which won the Civil Wars and established the English Commonwealth. Philip Jelley uses the same area movement design as Lilliburlero: The Battle of the Boyne, July 1690 (ATO 40), with units representing the regiments and batteries that fought the battles. Each turn represents one or two hours of time, with weather and nightfall affecting command and control and unit activations. Scenarios are included for both battles with historical deployments, free-set-up, and for Preston a short introductory scenario and a three-day campaign game. There are optional rules for units that might have fought at the battles, and a random events table. Ironsides contains 216 counters, two maps (11” x 34” for Preston and 17” x 22” for Worcester) and a nine-page rulebook.

PRESTON 1648 King Charles I was defeated by Parliament in the First Civil War, but secretly made an Engagement with the Scottish Duke of Hamilton to restore him to the throne. John Lambert’s 4,000 Parliamentarians could only slow Hamilton’s 20,000 invading army as it joined 3,500 Royalists under Sir Marmaduke Langdale and marched through Lancashire. When Langdale encountered Lambert near Preston on 17 August 1648 it was dismissed as another delaying tactic, and Hamilton continued south across the River Ribble. What they did not know was that Oliver Cromwell had forced-marched 4,500 “Ironsides” of the New Model Army 300 miles to join Lambert. Langdale desperately tried to hold off the assault, but was overwhelmed, and Hamilton’s divided and disorganised army was destroyed in a three-day running battle. With the Royalists defeated the Army purged Parliament so they could bring “Charles Stuart, that man of blood, to an account for that blood he had shed”. His trial was a forgone conclusion and the King and Hamilton were beheaded.

WORCESTER 1651 In 1650 the Scots invited King Charles II to succeed his father, so Cromwell invaded Scotland, destroying their army at Dunbar and taking Edinburgh. Charles II raised a new army, but with little chance of victory in Scotland he slipped past Cromwell and marched south to Worcester, hoping to rally English Royalists to his cause. Cromwell followed, joining the county militias raised by Fleetwood and Harrison, marching on the 16,000 Royalists with 31,000 men, intent on a battle of annihilation that would end the Civil Wars for once and for all. On 3 September 1651 Cromwell crossed the River Severn with a bridge of boats, dividing his army in order to encircle the Royalist army. Charles seized his chance and attacked the militia east of the river, but was repulsed, and the Ironsides chased his army through the bloody streets of Worcester, killing 3,000 and taking 13,000 prisoners. Charles fled to France, famously hiding in an oak tree to escape capture, while Cromwell would overthrow Parliament and make himself Lord Protector.

• Two Mapsheets (11″x34″ and 17”x22”)
• One Countersheet (216 9/16″ counters)
• One Rules Booklet
• Two Players Aid Charts (one for each player)
• Two Generals Display Charts (one for each side)
Two six-sided dice are required to play the game, but are not included.
categories: Civil War, Pike and Shot, Wargame

name: States Game
description:
States Game is an educational dice game that teaches math skills and U.S. States. It is played with four six-sided dice, with the number one replaced by an outline of the United States.

States are numbered 1 to 50 based on their date of entry into the union. Each player picks a state, and then each player picks one state for each other player. In turn, players roll four dice, declaring which of their assigned states they're aiming for before they roll. Any United States pictures rolled are wild, and may be used as any number from 1 to 6. The player who rolled must then use any combination of addition, subtraction, multiplication and division to achieve the target state's number. If the player is successful, he or she earns a point.

The number or rounds is equal to the number of players, and players may not try for a state they've already scored. After each player has taken all his or her turns, the player with the most points wins.

If the game is tied, all non-tied players choose a state. Each tied player has one roll to get the state's number. This continues until one player wins.

name: Remainders Game
description: Remainders Game is a math game, designed to help students learn division. The game is played with a six-sided die marked with the numbers 3 through 8. Each player has a board with 24 squares, each with a three-digit number. In turn, players choose a number, place a marked on it, and roll the die. The player then divides the chosen number by the rolled number. Any remainder is added to the player's score. After all number on each player's card have been marked, the player with the highest total score wins.

name: Squeak, Squawk, Grunt, Whistle: the Animal Soundtrack Bingo Game
description:
Squeak, Squawk, Grunt, Whistle is a bingo derivative that teaches about wild animals and their sounds. Each player gets a 3x3 board with pictures of various wild animals. A cassette tape is played. When players hear the sound of an animal on their card, they cover it with a marker. The first player to cover all of his or her animals wins. In order to make the game replayable, players may fast forward the tape to at random place to change the sequence of animal sounds. A list of the order of sounds is included so winners can be checked.

The other side of the tape identifies all the sounds so that players may learn to identify them before playing.

name: Number Play
description: Number Play is a card game designed to teach numbers, counting and basic math to young children. There are direction for several activities and games included. In addition to versions of Memory, Snap and Go Fish, there is a game called Collect 10, which is a simple set collection game in which players must choose cards from faceup or facedown piles in order to try to collect a full run of numbers from 1 to 10.

name: Get up and Go with the Power of Oats
description:
This game was printed on the back of a Honey Nut Cheerios box. It is a "flip and move" game where players flip a coin to move along a track, collecting oats along the way. Heads moves the player one space, tails two spaces. Some spaces grant the characters a number of oats, from one to fifteen. Some spaces move the player forward or cause loss of a turn. The player who finishes with the most oats wins.

The rules do not specify if the game ends when one player reaches the end, or when all do, but it would make sense to end the game when the first player finishes, otherwise losing a turn would have no negative effects.

name: Lazy Jack Visual Aids Game
description:
Lazy Jack Visual Aids Game is a series of picture and question cards that can be used to play a variety of simple educational games. Here's what's included:

1 to 24 Number Game for Beginners: Players match "story cards" with scenes from a story to number cards to try to make the most matches
Speedy Alphabet Game: Players take turns searching their cards for the letters of the alphabet in sequence, passing when then fail to find the next letter. The player who finds Z wins.
Family Word Games: Each player chooses and reads a card, then asks the next player to spell one word on the card. The player to spell the word correctly keeps the card. The player with the most cards wins.
Family Picture Games: In turn, players read the text on one card. The next player must name one character depicted on the card. Another player may challenge by calling out "Lazy Jack" and naming a different character. The correct player wins the card. Most cards wins.
Family Questions and Answer Game: Each player has a stack of picture cards. Players in turn ask a question from a question card. The player who is able to find the answer on a picture card answers and takes the card. Most cards wins.
Party Game No. 1 and Party Game With Props: Players choose "party game" cards and perform a challenge. Other players vote on best performances.
A.E.I.O.U Game: Each player draws a card and must find all five vowels to win the card. Most cards wins.
Name a Person, Place or Thing Game: Player chooses a card and names a color that appears on the card. Other players in turn try to guess which item of the color the player referred to. Correct guesser keeps the card. Most cards wins.
Picture Matching Game: Shuffle 24 each of black and white and color picture cards together. Players take turns drawing a card, trying to match b/w and color cards. Player with the most matches wins.
Family Reading Game: Color story card are dealt to players. Corresponding black/white cards are turned up one at a time. Player with the matching card reads the card's caption. If read correctly, the player claims the card. Other players may challenge and then read the card. Whoever reads the card correctly claims it. Most cards wins.


- Family Change a Word Game: Black/white picture cards are dealt to players. Color cards in turn are turned face-up. The player with the matching card reads the caption, but changes a word to change the meaning of the card. There is no competition involved, so this last "game" is the only one that is not really a game.

name: Balancing Frog
description:
1 frog
6 yellow and 12 green cylinders
1 dice with symbols

The object of the game is to place the cylinders on the frog without the animal tipping over or one of the cylinders falling off.

Rolling the dice determines the symbol on the end of the cylinder which is to be placed on the frog. A player that causes a cylinder to fall during their turn is out of the match. The winner is the player who put the last, and hence the most difficult, cylinder on the frog without knocking it over.

name: Japanese: The Game – Animals Expansion
description: A lot of people don't know how awesome and complete the Japanese list of animal sounds is. Rabbits, dragonflies, and foxes actually say something in Japanese, and their sounds will be on the cards!
categories: Animals, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game

name: Japanese: The Game – Calligraphy Expansion
description: This deck will help players learn Japanese kanji and gain points by building words made up of several characters. The kanji's meaning and dictionary-style examples of each character will be in the rules document, as will many word-building options and the bar codes to scan for pronunciation. So the cards will have full functionality, and will definitely still be usable by less advanced learners with some effort, but the card faces will be minimalist, focused on the beautiful art of written Japanese.

name: Japanese: The Game – Children Expansion
description: Speaking to children requires a kind of Japanese that is both loving and authoritative. The Children Expansion will teach you words you don't use when talking to adults... unless they're acting like children (which happens). It will also help you tell them to sit still, play nice, take turns, and brush their teeth.

name: Japanese: The Game – Household Items Expansion
description: People love learning vocabulary that's easy to remember, which is why one of the most requested decks is a Household Items Expansion. You'll learn the words for things you see every day so you can repeat them in your head. You could even place the Fridge card on the fridge with a magnet. But don't put the waste basket card in the waste basket.

name: Japanese: The Game – Martial Arts: White Belt Expansion
description: Words valuable in martial arts will be included for study and hilarity. Mixing and matching it with other expansions can result in glorious sentences like "If Godzilla attacks, our honorable grandfather will roundhouse kick him into an office building."

name: Japanese: The Game – Respect Expansion
description: Japanese culture has a strong social structure that is reflected in their language. You use different pronouns and verbs when referring to people of a higher or lower social level. The Intermediate Expansion: Respect will include names, titles, and verbs with varying degrees of respect to help you speak appropriately in different situations.

name: Japanese: The Game – Anatomy Expansion
description: Contains nouns like Arm, Shoulder, Leg, Neck, and verbs like Turn, Reach, and Point. This is very useful vocabulary and the explanations and example sentences will help you make sure you're using them properly.

name: Japanese: The Game – Counting Expansion
description: Counting is a little different in Japanese and this expansion deck will help you learn your numbers and how to count people, cards, bikes, books, and other every-day objects!

name: Universe
description:
In the dexterity game Universe, up to four players use marbles, dice and disks as ships and flick, roll, or spin their way into the Universe. It's shuffleboard, pinball, marbles, crokinole, craps, bocci ball, and even a bit of golf — but with the fingers — synchronized into one.

You can go for points, planet ownership, or the black hole, and whoever has the most points at the end of a set number of rounds wins.

Universe includes two additional mini games, giving you three games in one.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Action / Dexterity, Math, Maze, Space Exploration
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move, Take That, Team-Based Game

name: A Murder Most Fowl
description:
A Murder Most Fowl is a peculiar card game about crypto communication and people reading.

In A Murder Most Fowl, 2 or 3 teams of 2-players each (which means the game is played by either 4 or 6 players) compete against each other to solve the murder of Colonel Robin Poor, who is a bird of international importance.
