3 investigation agencies will be racing each other to solve the murder, or to steal the solution from other agencies. Play either as Charlotte Holmes and Vet Watson from Dogland Yard, Agent Murder and Agent Scurry from Federal Beavers of Investigation (FBI, for short) or Inspector Purrouseau and Queen Cat'O from Brigade Félinationale de la Sécurité.

Before a game session, the teams meet in secret and devise strategies for crypto communication. The teams can use body language, singing, humming, tell obscure stories, remind each other of past memories, speak unintelligibly, in numbers or form sentences that make no sense at all to the other teams –but hopefully passes information amongst themselves.

To call a murder, the teams will need crypto-communication, since callling a murder involves combining a murder scenario with a suspect, a location and a weapon as a team. However the other team(s) must be unaware of your selections since the solution could very well be stolen from you.

The game is loosely inspired by the English nursery rhyme "Who Killed Cock Robin" – especially Henry Louis Stephens’ 1865 book version which is named; "Death and Burial of Poor Cock Robin".
categories: Card Game, Deduction, Negotiation, Party Game, Print & Play
mechanics: Acting, Memory, Singing, Storytelling, Team-Based Game

name: Goblin Glory
description:
Two players try to destroy each other's Core in a highly strategic battle by employing creatures, spells and dungeon upgrades.

Creatures can have up to three of eighteen special properties, such as Coward (roll a d20 to determine the success of an attack), but also Mug (steal Gold on attack). Spell Cards add one-time actions to potentially turn the game. Dungeon Upgrades not only provide utility (such as sacrificing cards to gain resources), but also let the player shuffle new cards through his deck.

Key novelty: build your deck while playing the game. This allows for a dynamic and strategic gameplay.

name: Frantic Flip
description:
Frantic Flip
12 Double-sided animal tiles and 1 board game! Which side of the tile to use to fill out the board? Sounds simple! you will be surprised! A challenging and fun game for the fast of sight and mind.

1. Each player receives 12 double sided animal tiles.
2. The game board is flipped and then each player tries to place all of his tiles on the designated spot on the board, filling it out.
3. Pay attention! the tiles are double sided so you might havet to switch sides to fill out the board! Be fast so you don’t waste time! whoever places all of his tiles first wins the game.

name: A day at the track
description:
A day at the track is a Grid Movement/Dice rolling 9 card game about horse racing. The game is made up of 9 double-sided cards that consist of different sections of the race track. As you move around the track you will move these card section around to produce a full race track. Each player has his own d6 and two tokens; one to represent his/her horse on the track and the other to represent the Jockey Boost token.

Components:
[9 cards] - on [1] A4 letter size Double sided PDF sheet
[1] - A4 Letter size Double sided PDF sheet - Rules
[4] - d6 dice [1 Green, 1 Blue, 1 Yellow and 1 Red]
[8] - Wood cubes - [2 Green, 2 Blue, 2 Yellow and 2 Red]

GAME PLAY:
It's racing day is played in turns with each player rolling his/her d6 and moving his horse token the same number of spaces, as rolled on the d6, around the track. The player with the lowest die roll moves his/her horse token first, which also means that player could roll the lowest die and still cross the finish line before a player with a higher dice roll!

On each turn a player can decide to use one of his two Jockey Boost actions, which would allow the player to reroll his/her d6. If a player decides to take this action the move their Jockey Boost token on the 1st token space and rerolls their d6 die. The player MUST use this new roll, even if it is less than the previous roll, to move his/her horse token around the track. Each player is only allowed a maximum of two Jockey boosts per game.

CROSSING THE FINISH LINE:
As the players get closer to the finish line each die roll becomes critical. Since the player with the lowest die results moves first, this player could cross the finish line before a player who is closer but rolls a higher number!

If two or more players roll the same number they move there pieces at the same time. If those two or more players can all cross the finish line with their die results, the player that is closest to the finish line will cross first followed by the next closest player and so on.

The BLUE player is one space away from winning. The RED player is two spaces away from winning and the GREEN and YELLOW players are both three spaces away from winning. The following dice results are rolled: BLUE=5, GREEN=3, RED =3, and YELLOW=1. Since the YELLOW player rolled the lowest die roll he/she moves first but still doesn't cross the finish line. Since the BLUE player rolled the highest die roll he moves last. Now we come to the RED and GREEN players who both rolled 3, which means they move their horse tokens at the same time. Since the RED player is one space closer to the finish line, he/she ends up crossing the finish line one length ahead of the GREEN player. The results so far are RED player comes in 1st, the GREEN player comes in 2nd, and the BLUE and YELLOW players still need to take another turn to finish the race.

ADVANCED GAME PLAY:
It's racing day can also be played with an ADVANCED race track layout by using the Hedge cards. Hedge cards add an hazardous obstacle to the game. Whenever a player tries to jump over a HEDGE space and they roll a 5 or 6, their speed is too fast, causing their horse to stumble and slow down. The player must immediately stop their horse token directly beyond the hedge space and lose their next turn. A player could avoid this roll by using their Jockey Boost action but if the second roll is low enough to prevent them from reaching the hedge, they would still have to roll again on the next turn to try and clear the hedge.

WINNING THE GAME:
To win the game a player's horse token must be the first to pass the finish line before any other player! As each player passed the finish line they will place their horse token in the corresponding winners box. Each player continues to roll his d6 until he passes the finish line and his/her horse token is placed in one of the four winners boxes.
categories: Card Game, Dice, Print & Play, Racing

name: Football Managers
description:
Board football team management game. Matches, players trading, random and non-random events determine the ultimate champion.
The players starts witn an amount of 40 million euros and obtain players with a range of 5-9 ability. As more the ability as much the money needed for buying. After that the players (if want) expand the capacity of their soccer field so they can sell more tickets on the home matches they play. The match is played by one dice and the winner gets 3 points instead of 1 for tie and 0 for lose. The winner is the player who gets winning points with the follow system .
10 winning points for the champion
5 winning points for the second place in the championship
6 winning points forr the Cup winner
2 winning points for the Cup finalist.
0,5 points for every 1.000.000 remain in the final treasury of the team.
In the middle of the season the players can change and axchange players.

Also there are random facts with cards that can change the rank of the players.

Επιτραπέζιο παιχνίδι διαχείρισης ποδοσφαιρικής ομάδας. Αγώνες, αγοραπωλησίες παικτών, τυχαία και μη γεγονότα καθορίζουν τον τελικό πρωταθλητή.

Giocco dal tavolo gestione della squadra. Giochi, negoziazione giocatore, casuali e non casuali eventi determinano il campione finale.

name: Dinner's Ready!
description:
Dinner's Ready! is a family culinary card game promoting healthy eating by challenging players to collect recipes and their necessary ingredients.

Players are dealt 5 recipe cards. The objective is to collect a "balanced meal:" an appetizer, an entree, and a dessert that together contain one ingredient from each of the food groups (fruits, vegetables, grains, meat, dairy). Players choose their "best" three and discard the others.

The objective is to collect the ingredients to make your appetizer, then the entree, then the dessert. You must go in order!

Each player is dealt four ingredient cards. On their turn, players may ask for a particular ingredient from another player ("Go Shopping"), pick up the top ingredient card on the "Compost Pile," or draw a replacement Recipe card.

The first player to successfully prepare their "balanced meal" wins, exclaiming "dinner's ready!"

The goal of the game is to educate players on the versatility of healthy ingredients, the basic concepts of cooking, and fun facts about food. If children are exposed to food at an early age, they are more likely to eat healthier as adults.

Who says you can't play with your food?

name: Lex Arena
description:
Lead Rome's best gladiators to glory in Lex Arena – a historic tabletop strategy game with great design, crafted from wood and linen.

Lex Arena is a tabletop elimination game for 2 to 4 players. You take the role of a Lanista – an owner and trainer of gladiators. Following a simple set of rules, it is your duty to lead your fighters to glory.

The goal of the game is to have at least one gladiator as a sole survivor in the arena.

Each turn a player draws an event card that can affect the gameplay and lasts for one turn. Even cards can be beneficial or harmful.

Lex Arena provides balanced gameplay so knowing yourself and your opponents is crucial for victory.

name: Vier gegen Einen
description:
One player has to defend the citadel with 16 black pawns against four allied enemy armies of seven red, blue, yellow and green pawns each. The pawns may move one space or capture (in any direction) an enemy pawn by jumping over it. The defender may not move into the citadel, unless it is under threat by an attacker. The attackers move only forward or sideways, never backward. Movement is one space on the red lines or sideways on the black lines and one or more spaces forward or backward (only the defender)on the black lines.

The defender wins the game if he can occupy oll 4 spaces of the citadel in the center of the game board.

The allied attackers win, if they can occupy the four spaces of the citadel.

The game was published in the 1930s or 1940s.

name: Super Galactic Battle Mounties
description:
The Earth is under attack by the fearsome Eclipse and his 14 Zodiac Colossi. Their mission is to take over the world, and the Super Galactic Battle Mounties are the only ones who can stand in their way! That’s why Eclipse has launched an all-out offensive on the city of Kingsmount–home of the Battle Mounties and the source of their power. If the Mounties’ Command Center on Mt. Royal falls, there will be no one left to stop Eclipse. Save Kingsmount; Save the World!

Super Galactic Battle Mounties is a fully co-operative city defense game that features a battle system emphasizing cooperation and combination. As the Zodiac Colossi swarm into the city, aided by their minions, you will work together to protect it. Alone, you are not powerful. It is only when fighting with your teammates that your true power is realized. You win if you survive the onslaught by defeating Eclipse and his Zodiac Colossi. You lose if your Command Center falls, destroying the source of your power.

SGBM consists of 12 episodes (rounds). Each episode, in turn, consist of 4 phases which the players take simultaneously:
Spawn, where you will find out your monster(s) of the week and the episode sub-plot.
Plan, where you will deliberate strategy and move your Mounties to where they need to be.
Battle, where you will all roll your dice to fight monsters and lemmings.
Retaliation, where the Zodiac Colossi fight back and damage the city.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Classix
description:
Classix is a 6-suit deck of 93 cards.
It has:

0 and 1 cards added to each suit
10 card upgraded to the Damsel face card


6 games have been designed for this 6-suit deck, and a standard set of components. These games include:

Rummycross (Rummy)
Gambit (Trick-Taking/Comparing)
Jacob's Ladder (Shedding)
Damsels & Dragons (Dungeon Crawl)
Crowns (Comparing)
Klondike 6 (Solitaire)

name: Robinsons Abenteuer
description: Simple roll-and-move game. The first player to reach space 100 wins the game. On the red spaces, events from the novel hinder or benefit the players.
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Spot a Dotted Puppy
description:
Contents: 4 Puppy Playing Pieces, Spinner, Game Board

Object: To be the first player to return his puppy to his doghouse.

Before Play: Each player selects a spotted puppy playing piece and places it on the matching doghouse. Blue puppy goes first.

Play: First player spins the spinner and moves his puppy that number of spaces, counterclockwise around the board. After each player has spun once, the first player then counts the number of spots on the puppy on which his playing piece is resting. He moves his puppy that number of spaces. Play continues in this way. If a player lands on a bone, he then spins the spinner again and moves that number of spaces. If the arrow points to the puppy's head, he has to return to his doghouse. (The spinner is used only at the start of the game and when a player lands on a bone.) If a player lands on a space occupied by another player, he moves to the next space.

To Win: The winner is the first player to go completely around the path of puppies and land on or pass over his dog house again.

name: Bienen- und Blumenspiel
description: The first player to reach space 51 wins the game. Movement is controlled by a spinner. On some spaces events hinder or benefit the players.
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Subway: Race to the Bronx
description:
Players represent rail transit companies in turn of the century New York City, racing to connect Lower Manhattan to the Bronx. Build subway lines, connect stations and entice riders to use your subway.
Players acquire permits, hire workers and purchase materials to build lines, and then populate those lines with trains to generate revenue. Build the most lines in a neighborhood to claim its victory points. Be the first to connect lines to all the key stations to win the game.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Tile Placement, Worker Placement

name: Arby: The Meter Reader Game
description:
'Arby' is a game created by Neptune Meter Company and appears to be a sales/promotional tool extolling the benefits of one of their products (the ARB) that allows water meter readers to do their job electronically, automatically, and remotely.

From the box:

"The ARBY game can be played by 2, 3, 4, or 5 players. One player is the ARB meter reader who reads the meters without entering the house; the others are conventional meter readers who must enter the house to obtain the reading. The playing board is arranged in four WATER DISTRICTS or routes of six houses each with the WATER OFFICE in the center where the game is started and finished. The goal of each player is to read all his meters and arrive back at the WATER OFFICE before the other reader (or readers). The ARB reader must read the meters in all 24 houses on the board; the conventional reader reads only six houses (or one fourth of the board)."

The players all start in the Water Office where they each roll a die. The highest number is the ARB reader. The others choose their routes in order of the die number rolled.

When the ARB reader player reaches a dot outside a house they draw a card which will either give them the meter reading or present an obstacle. ARB player does not have to enter a house to get the reading. Once read they move on to next house.

When a conventional reader player reaches a dot outside a house they draw a card which will either allow them to enter the house or give them some reason they cannot. If allowed into the house they wait until their next turn and then rolls the die. If an EVEN number is rolled they put their pawn on the inside dot where they 'read' the meter by drawing another card which allows the reading or presents an obstacle. Once the meter is read player must roll an ODD number to exit the house. On the next turn they head to the next house.

This continues until a player reaches their quota (6 for conventional or 24 for ARB) at which point they race back to the WATER OFFICE. First one there by exact roll amount WINS.

Components:

- Playing board
- One die
- Five meter reader characters, One ARB reader and Four conventional readers (pawns)
- 24 Lockout Markers (plastic discs)
- 30 matching colored cards for each conventional meter reader (18 large, 12 small - in 4 colors)
- 24 white cards for the ARB meter reader

There is apparently a follow up game called 'Carby'.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move, Simulation

name: Takeda's succession struggle
description:
Designed by Yumiko Endoh.

The game starts at the moment of the Honnō-ji Incident, forced suicide of Nobunaga Oda.
Three factions, Uesugi, Tokugawa and Hojo battle to take over the former Takeda territory.

Although there are 3 factions, this game is played by only 2 players.
The faction each player controls is decided randomly just after the first turn. And this information can be kept secret as long as a player wants. Until that moment, each faction is played by both players alternatively.

The victory is achieved when the faction that a player controls has conquered a determined numbers of areas. If no player can achieve victory, then both lose the game.

Time scale: ?
Game period: 1582-1583
Counters: 90
Map: half standard



Published in Game Journal #51.(from BGG user)
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: ¿Cuán Bestia Soy?
description:
From the box (Translated):
"To play Cuan Bestia Soy no special skills are needed , only names of trees, of countries, of artists, of things in a library , etc. With some of these issues and an initial letter each round is long... but hurry up! because only the fastest players can upgrade. The others will go down.
Is a game for fun ... so much fun and a good opportunity to demostrate intelligence , wit, memory and speed. "

In each turn, a player throws the dice and moves the pawn on some of the letters. Another player will be in charge of drawing a card which indicates the subject (eg characters of history, capital cities, islands or mountains). Once listed, write a word or phrase that meets these conditions and put his hand on the mark. The first will come to the throne and the last, will go down a step.

The goal is to reach the top of the board: the Throne or make any of the rivals down everything and get crowned Beast.

From the box (Spanish):
"Para jugar 'Cuan Bestia Soy' no hacen falta conocimientos especiales, sólo nombres de árboles, de países, de artistas, de cosas que hay en una librería, etc. Con algunos de estos temas y una letra inicial se larga cada ronda... pero ¡apúrense! ya que solo los más rápidos podrán ascender de categoría.
Los demás se van para abajo.
Es un juego para divertirse... para divertirse mucho y una buena oportunidad de demostrar inteligencia, ingenio, memoria y rapidez."

En cada turno, un jugador arroja el dado y mueve el peón sobre alguna de las letras. Otro se encargará de sacar una carta donde indique el tema (por ejemplo: Personajes de la historia, Capitales de Países, Islas o Montañas). Una vez indicados, se debe escribir una palabra o frase que cumpla estas condiciones y colocar la mano sobre la marca. Los primeros se acercarán al trono y los últimos bajarán un escalón.

El objetivo del juego es llegar a la cima del tablero: el Trono o lograr que alguno de los rivales llegue abajo de todo coronándose Bestia.
publishers: Kipo's, Nupro Games, Plastigal Juegos SRL (Plastigal)

name: After Days: Survival is Everything!
description:
In After Days: Survival is Everything! each player takes the role of a pair of Post-Apocalyptic survivors working cooperatively with other players to provide for the group and deal with the threats arrayed against them. Each turn players send one of their two survivors, each has a specific ability, into harm's way to gather supplies by pulling three random dice and rolling them. Each dice has four possible resource outcomes: food, protection, shelter, and scrap which can be converted and used by certain Survivors.

Survivors must then nullify the threats arrayed against them such as devastating weather breakouts which cause a wound for each resource not met. Roving bands of marauders that continue to come back on subsequent turns if not dealt with swiftly. Finally, the risen dead refuse to go down until all of the dead have their resources met.

To nullify threats Survivors must provide the resources required on each threat card either using rolled dice or Survivor card abilities. Deal with all the threats and take no wounds. Fail to deal with a threat and it injures one of your Survivors, which can cost you the game. Survive six turns with at least one Survivor still alive and you win the game!

Each version of the game supports up to four players so feel free to combine two games to have up to eight players fight for their survival!
categories: Card Game, Dice, Party Game, Zombies
publishers: (Self-Published), Dice Made Me Do It! LLC

name: Pantheon Ascension: Even Mythical Family Trees Need Pruning
description:
In Pantheon Ascension: Even Mythical Family Trees Need Pruning each player takes the role of a minor Norse deity backstabbing their way to the top of the family tree by stealing temples, brainwashing followers, and robbing their kin of prestige.

Players start with three random dice and one Major Deity card. Each turn they choose two of four possible actions in an attempt to get sets of four temples, prestige, or followers, while avoiding three mockery icons. The four possible actions are: Reroll any or all dice, add a random dice to dice pool, play Deity card, and Duel another player. Players cannot perform any action twice!

Getting and rolling dice is self explanatory, while playing a God card involves picking a target for the effect on the card, playing it and resolving the effect, and drawing a replacement card. Some cards have good effects while others have detrimental ones, but the only way to replace a God card is to play it.

Dueling involves both players rolling all of their dice, which is a nice way to ruin someones plans if they're showing three of a kind. The winner is the player with the most non-mockery icons showing and they get 1/2 of all the dice rounded up, keeping all the rolled faces, while the loser gets the remainder. This is a great way to get more dice if you only have a few and Duel someone with many, and if you win you can even grab a set of scoring dice from those rolled.

If at any time your dice show three or more mockery icons, immediately throw away all of your dice, draw three new dice, roll them, and end your turn. This includes Duels: When one or more players shows at least three Mockery icons during a duel, the duel is immediately canceled, each player retains their dice, and the player(s) showing 3+ mockery need to follow the steps at the beginning of this paragraph.

Scoring sets of dice occurs automatically at the end of a players turn and awards a single victory token. Get three victory tokens and your Ascend to Major God status and win!

Each version of the game supports up to four players so feel free to combine two games to have up to eight players fight for supremacy!
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Push Your Luck, Set Collection
publishers: (Self-Published), Dice Made Me Do It! LLC

name: Shadow Wars: The Information Arms Race
description:
Shadow Wars: The Information Arms Race is an adversarial game of backstabbing, assassination, and asset manipulation set in 1980s, the height the Cold War. The overall goal is simple, be the first to gather three pieces of intelligence and dominate the Shadow War. To accomplish this task, players secretly target other players/nations and roll dice, which represent agents in an attempt to gather intelligence.

Players start the game with 1 Asset Die, 1 Ghost Die, and 1 Attack Die. All of these dice are identical except that they have one face that shows 2 x their specific type (i.e. Ghost die has a face with 2 x Ghost icons). They also start with one piece of Intel. The Intel goes on their Home nation card along with all dice.

Each turn players put some or all of their dice on a hidden target card of their choice. They then roll some or all of their Target card dice along with 0-5 World dice, which differ from the other dice by not having a double icon face and and extra blown cover icon...Expendable agents are very risky, but allow players with few dice to continue to play and be competitive. The goal is to get three icons of the same type, Assets, Ghosts, or Attacks, without getting three blown cover which forces players to reveal their target.

When players get three of a kind, they reveal their Target nation card, who then gets to defend. If the defense is unsuccessful, players steal an Intel token from the victim along with inflicting one other insult: 3 Ghost icons = No defense allowed; 3 Asset icons = Steal 1 die; 3 Attack icons = Kill one dice.

The winner is the first player with three Intel tokens. How will you deal with the myriad of threats arrayed against you and win the information war…the choice is yours!
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Push Your Luck, Set Collection
publishers: (Self-Published), Dice Made Me Do It! LLC

name: Kepi & Pickelhaube: A Study in 19th Century Warfare
description:
Kepi and Pickelhaube is the TAC-50 game that brings the era 1835-1880 to life.

No specific battles are provided in the rule book

This fast play rule set contains rules for the 19th Century Warfare. The game uses inches with 15mm, 20mm, and 25mm figures. For 5mm & 10mm you can substitute centimeters for inches. It is designed to have an evening of fun with no paperwork involved. The ratio of figures to actual men is 1:50, a model gun represents a battery, and staff represent individuals.

38 page rulebook with two player aid cards.

Scale is 1" = 25 yards. 2-30 mm.
1 model soldier = 50 men in "reinforced Skirmish order" (infantry) on 5/8" x 1" stand and 2 x 25 man lines (cavalry) on 7/8 x 1 2/4 stand
categories: American Civil War, Book, Miniatures, Post-Napoleonic, Wargame

name: Red Flags: Kickstarter Booster Pack
description: An 36-card booster pack exclusive to Kickstarter backers
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Humor, Party Game

name: Japanese: The Game – Tokyo Edition
description: This deck contains a selection of simple words from the various parts of speech (nouns, verbs, etc.) that will help you learn Tokyo-related and general vocabulary at the same time as Japanese sentence structure. The backgrounds of the cards are photographs of the city and the example sentences on each card be of a Tokyo-specific flavor. This is an excellent complement to the Original Core Deck; using them together will teach you over 50 new words and allow you to add two or three more players to the game!

name: Japanese: The Game – Bushido Expansion
description: The Bushido Expansion will teach historical facts and legends about Samurai, their era and way of life, and the culture surrounding them. The art for the 36-card Bushido Expansion is by Legend of the Five Rings artist Troy Graham.
categories: Card Game, Educational, Expansion for Base-game, Word Game

name: Japanese: The Game – Yōkai Expansion
description: Yōkai are the monsters of Japanese folklore. In America some people look out for Bigfoot. In Scandinavia some look out for trolls. In Japan there are scores and scores of different creatures, and they're becoming more popular in Western storytelling. The art for its 36 cards will be provided by none other than the incredible Matthew Meyer, creator of The Hour of Meeting Evil Spirits.
categories: Card Game, Educational, Expansion for Base-game, Word Game

name: Japanese: The Game – Weapons and Warfare Expansion
description: This expansion adds 36 cards about traditional Japanese weaponry and battle. You'll have cards for nouns like Katana and verbs like Ambush. The art is by acclaimed illustrator Héctor Herrera from the card game Legend of the Five Rings.
categories: Card Game, Educational, Expansion for Base-game, Word Game

name: Ticker Tape
description:
Ticker Tape is a stock hand management/bidding card game. You will vye for the most popular stocks while also dreading the stock market crash.

Components:

1 deck of stocks and action cards on which to bid. This deck consists of stocks in five different colors and various action cards that will give dividends or make the market crash.
5 Stock base value tiles that inform how much a stock is currently worth as well as how much you can buy or sell stocks of certain colors.
234 coins in various denominations


Game Play:
Every round three cards are drawn from the stock deck. Every player uses closed bidding for the three cards. After resolution of the auction the player pays the companies for the stock he just purchased. Play proceeds through the stock deck until all cards have been depleted. During the game players may buy, sell, or trade with one another at any time, but may only buy or sell with the stock companies when it is their turn. When the stock deck is depleted, players are awarded bonus money from the stock companies depending on who had the most, second most, and third most of each stock. The winner at the end of the game is determined by who has the most money.
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Commodity Speculation, Hand Management, Set Collection, Stock Holding, Trading

name: Also
description:
A game that trains logical thinking. The game can be played as a betting game on the truth of implications or just to be the first to find if an implication is correct or not.

Example:
A statement and an implication is selected:
When Betty is reading a book she does not want to be disturbed.
Betty does not read a book. Therefore she can be disturbed.

With the game material (logical matrix) you can prove that this implication is not correct: ((p --> -q) and -p) --> q

If the implication is revised in the following way, the implication is true ((p --> -q) and q) --> -p:
When Betty is reading a book she does not want to be disturbed.
Betty can be disturbed. Therefore she is not reading a book.

This is a game for true mathematical nerds!

From the box:

ALSO makes you

fit in controlled thinking
precise in phrasing
invulnerable in discussing
excellent in solving brainteasers


ALSO-players know the rules of precise thinking.

name: Cariso
description:
Psychological game or training for self-discovery and group dynamics.
Up to 8 players can participate. On a players turn he draws a card of a selected difficulty level (beginners, advanced, professional) and decides to fulfill one of the tasks of that card (red = creativity, yellow = interaction/confrontation, blue = self-discovery, green = articulation). The other players decide how good the task was performed and the active player received rewards in coloured tiles that he can place on the board in the pattern he likes.
Over the time the board is filled with the patterns of the individual players. You can play either until the board is filled or for a certain time. All players are winners as they know more about themselves than before.

name: Rogue Moon
description:
By 2213, the religions and governments of Earth have separated into various factions competing for resources and technology. The most powerful of these empires, The Genesis, employ strict laws and draconian influence. More than half their population has been imprisoned aboard hulking generation ships. Treated as separate colonies, these ships vie for their rightful access to dwindling basic needs. Among the rising tensions is a small group of outlaws guided by a mysterious puppet master. Could they be the key to saving the galaxy? Or are they part of its endless entropy?

Rogue Moon is a branching path co-operative game set in a dark science fiction universe.

Players take on the role of one of several criminals that have been jettisoned in an escape pod when their transport ship was mysteriously attacked. As a team, the players will complete objectives guided by a mysterious figure calling himself the "Broker".

Players explore derelict space stations made of quantum matter - making every station different from the last.

Rogue Moon leverages a scenario book full of campaign missions with branching paths based on individual decisions and completed or failed objectives. Throughout the course of the game, players will discover the hidden secrets of each character and their roles in a galactic-wide conflict.

Form a team

There are heroes among the bad as well as the good. Play as criminals including a smuggler, bounty hunter, and war profiteerer
Different characters unlock different paths in the storyline


Fight for survival

Each character has unique abilities powered by a shared pool of limited energy
Depleted energy entropies into the fuel of enemies
Resolve combat and defense in a single dice roll


Discover the mystery behind your choices

Through decisions and actions, some, all, or none of you can earn your freedom
Unravel the identity of the Broker and his plans for you and your crew
There's more than one way to serve a life sentence


Featuring miniatures and vibrant sci-fi artwork, Rogue Moon is another tale ready to be lost to the infinite of space.
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Storytelling, Variable Player Powers

name: Oh Bleep!
description:
Race against the clock to form as many words as possible by adding vowels and consonants to letter cards. Earn points for only those words that have not been written down by any other player AND include, in any order, ALL three consonants in play on the Letter Pot Board. The longer the word, the more points won. At the first sighting of an Oh Bleep! Card, be the first to shout, “Oh Bleep!” and gain advantages over other players.

Oh Bleep! is not your grandpappy's word game. Select one of three game-play options: (1) Zany, (2) Brainy, or (3) Bleepin' Crazy (combining both types of challenges). Depending upon the game selected, be prepared to perform comical, daring physical feats and/ or overcome brain-busting challenges. But watch out! Don't let yourself be distracted from your word-creating, opponent crushing goal. After all, only the player with the most points wins.

name: Reo
description:
Reo is a dice game for 2+ players based on the classic dice game Liar's Dice and the goal remains the same--be the last player standing! Reo introduces a set of community dice used by all players to change the dynamic and allow customization of luck versus skill.

In all variants, players begin with five 8-sided dice each and a cup to keep their roll hidden from the other players. Players then take turns bidding according to the rules, until one player's bid is challenged. The key to the game is using the results of your roll, probability, and your ability to read others to figure out what the best possible bid for that round is (the most number of dice with the highest number on them), and bid it first. Challenges are resolved by revealing all the dice, as well as the community roll of 3 additional 8-sided dice that Reo adds.

The most popular version rolls the community dice after a bid is challenged. This version emphasizes luck a little more, as a player can roll themselves out of a bid gone wrong jam. The other popular variant rolls the community dice before the bidding, where all players can see the community dice for the "Texas Hold' Em" version. Your bidding must be more precise when played this way, emphasizing skill versus luck. Any way you play, Reo is a fast-paced, fun game that is quick to pick up, and hard to put down!
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Betting and Bluffing, Dice Rolling

name: The Black Knights Adventure
description:
The Black Knight's will introduce 4 new characters to the world of the Red Dragon's Lair plus three new game enhancements.

Gold will be added and the party member with the most Gold at the end of the game is declared the true victor!

Pets will accompany all characters into battle and will fight at their sides!

Dungeon Master Deck will introduce players to a whole new way to play. The Dungeon master will take on the role of the dungeon and a boss. Then with the assistance of a Dungeon Master deck the player will work to permanently kill all adventures and win the game.

name: Take the High Ground
description:
A two-player abstract combat simulation.

In the setup phase of the game, two sets of dominoes are used as "map tiles" to build the playing area (map/terrain), an 8x8 grid of spaces.

In the next phase, sets of dice are used as pieces (armies of varying strength) that move and battle on the board. A second set of dominoes (one complete set per player) are used as "action tiles" to manipulate the dice, performing movement, combat, building of fortifications and artillery, and bringing reinforcements onto the board.

The game ends when the players' stacks of action tiles are depleted.

Victory goes to whoever scores the most points. The most points are earned for dice (armies) that occupy the higher levels (hills) on the 3D board. Hence the name "Take the High Ground".
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Grid Movement, Hand Management, Modular Board, Simulation

name: B Sharp
description:
From the publisher:

B Sharp is a new, unique board game to help all, beginner to advanced, young and old, improve their music reading skills and knowledge, while spending quality time together with friends and family.

Goal - With B Sharp, your goal is to be the first player to get rid of all your cards. You roll the die and move your piece to the left or to the right, allowing you the best play according to the cards you have in hand.

Playing - When you have one or more cards in hand that match the key you land on, you can discard it/them. If not, you pick a card (or roll again if you landed on the Play Again symbol), which you discard in turn if possible.

Attack - When you land on a key where another player is, you can Attack them by giving them one of your cards. But they can defend themselves with a special card: the Natural! And they give back two cards in return. And so on if the Attacker also has a Natural Card...

Natural - The Natural Card can also be used to make another player pick up two cards if they discarded a Sharp or a Flat Card.

Questions - You can choose to play with or without the question cards. The future B Sharp Question/Challenge App will allow you to choose the level and type of question and challenges and learn more and more as you go!
mechanics: Hand Management, Roll / Spin and Move

name: THE UNION ABLAZE: A Solitaire Game of the American Civil War (1861-1865).
description:
BACKGROUND: THE UNION ABLAZE is semi-historical game of the American Civil War (1861-1865) in the East, also, referred to as the Peninsula. The Game begins shortly after the Confederate States of America (CSA) fired on the Union Fort Sumter. The Confederates are now building up their forces and gathering their Naval Squadrons to kick the Union out of the Southern States. The Union must build their Army and Naval Forces and capture Richmond and Petersburg along with enough key Confederate Settlements before the Confederates capture a number of key Union Settlements to force the Confederates to capitulate.

OBJECTIVE: As the Commander of the Union Naval and Land Forces, you must gather your forces and naval squadrons to capture the Key Victory Point (VP) Confederate Settlements of Richmond and Petersburg (total of 9 VP), along with a number of other Key Confederate Settlements who’s VP Values total 26 or more (for a grand total of 35 VP or more) before the Treaty of Appomattox Event Card is Drawn. If the Confederates control a number of Union Settlements worth 20VP or more, the Confederates win. Also, if the “Treaty of Appomattox” Card has been played and the Union does not control Richmond, Petersburg and an additional 26VP worth of Confederate Settlements, the Confederates win.

FEATURES: THE UNION ABLAZE features many colorful game counters, player aids and campaign cards. Units include Infantry, Cavalry, Artillery, Gatling Guns, Zouave Infantry, and Sharpshooters. There are, also, many Naval Vessels of the period including Ironclads, Screw-Sloops, Steam Cruisers and Torpedo Boats (including the Hunley). Game includes rules for Army and Naval Heroes that can help turn the tide of Battle with their leadership and fighting abilities.

Battles are resolved in a fast and fun manner resolved on colorful Battle Mats for both land and naval combat, providing the Player with a flavor of the period.

The UNION ABLAZE can be found at the following URL:
http://www.berserkergames.net
categories: American Civil War, Civil War, Print & Play, Wargame
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Trivial Pursuit: Master Game – Telegraph Sunday Magazine Edition
description:
The winner is the first person to return to the hexagonal hub and correctly answers a question in a category chosen by the other players. Before answering the game winning question, a player must land in a category headquarters for each of the six categories and correctly answer a question

Features 3000 questions in six new categories:
Getaways
Cribsheet
Front Page
Lead Features
Questions of Taste
Back Page
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Eventide
description:
The burgeoning coastal city of Rime's Reach is in need of adventuring Guilds to undertake the tasks that the locals can't (or won't) deal with themselves. Recruit guild members to aid you in undertaking quests and conduct shady dealings to undermine the competition. Who will still have a reputation by the end of the week?

Eventide is a game for 2 to 4 players where you play the role of guild masters vying for the best Reputation after 7 days and 7 nights. You have three main objectives:
1. Recruit guild members, some of whom can only be recruited at night or during the day, from a shared applicant pool by drafting them with gold.
2. Quest by sending away recruited guild members to conduct the task, or do the job yourself by sending away the guild master.
3. Mess with other guild masters by playing dealing cards to assert yourself in an evolving landscape.
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Open Drafting, Variable Player Powers

name: Gods of Tortuga
description: An epic multiplayer strategy game of war set in a fantasy world of Gods & Kings. Conquer lands, build cities and use the power of gods.

name: Melee
description: A two to four player word-building game. Each player uses tiles from their own pool and/or a common pool of tiles, and creates words of three to five letters on a five by five board. Colored tiles and letter frequency determine scoring. Play proceeds until all 25 spaces on each player's board are occupied by tiles. Allowed words follow conventional rules such as no proper names or foreign words.

name: CHECK 2 3 4!
description: This game is based on checkers, but uses a board with extra 3X8 regions along all four sides of the "Western" 8X8 board. Two to four players can play, with different starting placement of twelve pieces for each option. Board has numbered spaces to guide starting placement. Jumping to capture an opponent's pieces must be performed whenever possible. Additional variations are outlined in the rules.

name: Boatload of Fun
description:
Join Julius and friends in a seek'n'find game on the high sea! Julius and his friends come to life in the first board game by Paul Frank for kids. Players race to find various images of their favorite characters from outer space, schoolyards, the shopping mall and the high seas. The winner is the first and fastest to find the hidden characters

Players pull a card out of a pouch and then race to be the fastest to find the same picture on the board and place a token on it. The player who finds the most pictures wins in this fast-moving, quick-thinking game.

Parents watch children have fun exploring their creativity while developing fine motor and sequencing skills.

name: Pento
description:
Pento is a light-weight casual card game for 3 to 6 players. A game can be played in under 30 minutes and offers a lot of replayability. Between the special card actions and ever-changing teams, there's always many ways for you to score points.

Pento is a all about scoring points with your team, but those teams are always changing! Play cards to your collection for points, or swap teams during your turn. At the end of the round, teams only score the points of the highest scoring player, so plan carefully! Low-scoring players are often seeking to get on a better team, while high-scoring players are looking to go it alone. We call this Team Chasing.

On your turn you have the opportunity to change which team you are on by playing cards from your hand. Choose your team wisely: some cards only let you swap cards with opponents, but you also score together with your team at the end of the round. Balance these needs and you'll come out on top!
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Hand Management, Take That, Team-Based Game

name: Généalogik
description:
Généalogik is a teaching boardgame with humour, discovery and adventure. Using the 4 eccentric families suggested by the game, will you be able to go back to the source of your line, before your adversaries? Généalogik is funny family boardgame, but also an educational tool to learn (while having fun) all the tricks and tips necessary to the realization of your family tree. The winner will be the player who will have collected all the information or will have obtained the most acts (during a part with time limits).

Contents of the box…
- 1 Game board
- 4 Mini game board representing the genealogic trees of each player
- 4 Player tokens
- 2 six-sided dice
- 11 Chance Cards
- 11 Bad Luck Cards
- 84 “Acts” Cards (birth, marriage and death)
- 4 reversible Identity player cards (boy/girl)
- 64 Tiles “Characters”

About the game:
The players have to leave in search of the members of the same family and to establish the family tree on 4 generations. The winner will be the player who will have collected all the information or obtained most acts (during a party with a limit time).

There are 3 ways to play Généalogik:
1 - Without time limit, the winner will be the player who will have got back all the information necessary for the Family tree. The game stops immediately.
2 - Without time limit, the winner will be the player who will have got back all the information necessary for the Family tree, but with only the parents and the grandparents. The game stops immediately.
3 - With limit in time, the players decide in the beginning of party on the time of game. Once this reached limit, the players end the begun tour. The winner will be the player who will have got back most information necessary for the Family tree. In case of equality, there will be 2 (or more) winners.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Open Drafting, Set Collection

name: Spione: Nest of Spies
description: Spione is a hidden role game for 5 to 12 players. Each player will receive a secret identity that is either a red spy, a green spy, or a blue bystander. On each players turn they may play an action token that will either take a vote of allegiance, assassinate another player, Defect or secretly change which side you are are on, declare you have diplomatic immunity and are immune to all actions until it is your turn again, inform on another player and cause a vote of accusation, or be used to look at another players allegiance card. The game ends when either a set number of actions have been played, or an allegiance vote shows all spies to be on one color.
mechanics: Hand Management, Player Elimination, Take That, Variable Player Powers, Voting

name: Supermarket Shuffle
description:
When you go shopping you must make sure to get everything you need while being attentive to the Daily Specials.

In Supermarket Shuffle, players will draft cards to gain points over three rounds. Every round there are Daily Specials which will make the cards less expensive, but you must make sure that you can buy everything at the end of every round because you only start with $10 at the beginning of each round. After bonuses are handed out at the end of the third round, the player with the most points at the end wins.
mechanics: Hand Management, Open Drafting, Set Collection

name: The oobulous Island Arena
description:
It’s time to struggle! Roll the dices, create strategic combinations and challenge your destiny. Luck and persistence will allow to fight for your survival. But cleverness and intelligence will be essential to defeat enemies and achieve the final victory in the Arena of oobulous Island.

oobulous is a world without a space-time dimension inhabited by beings with amazing supernatural skills, huge powers and intelligence, called oobuliani. oobuliani have opened a dimensional portal that has put in communication worlds belonging to different age, far apart, causing quite a stir among their Heroes keepers.

The opening of portal has triggered an endless battle to the death for conquering the final victory. Four factions of heroes will come down to fight in the oobulous Island Arena and compete in quick and breath-taking duels to get the title of Supreme Hero.

SETUP.


Players choose their Hero Card.
Determine who goes first by rolling one of the twenty-sided dice. The player with the most high roll goes first and attacks trying to damage immediately his opponent player.
Each Hero has 20 life points and 0 oobu.
Try to create attack/defense dices combinations and pay attention to the red number in the upper position on the dice faces. It specifies how many damages you can inflict to the enemy or the quantity of life points you may recover during own turn.


ON YOUR TURN (Order of Attack Operations).


Unleash the power of your Hero! Roll all 4 oobulous dices and make a maximum of 3 launches. Try to create attack combinations and risk to evoke the Hero Power with strategy and fortune.
Inflict damages to the life points of your enemy. If you’re unable to create attack combinations, pass the turn and your opponent may try to counter attack. If your enemy is not able to attack, you’re again in attack.
Roll your dices and choose the most powerful attack combinations, hit your enemy and get the chance to roll a bonus dice, the power dice.
Resolve the roll of power dice. If you’re lucky, you will cause additional damages and obtain the opportunity to gain from 0 to 4 oobu by rolling the oobu dice.
oobu dice will earn you the chance to collect oobu and activate special actions of your Hero during the battle.


ON YOUR TURN (Order of Defense Operations).


Fight for life of your Hero! Roll all 4 oobulous dices and make a maximum of 3 launches. Try to put together defense combinations and risk to evoke the Hero Power to your defense.
Protect the life points of your Hero from the enemy attacks. If you don’t succeed to defend yourself, the turn will pass automatically to the opposing player, who he may try to attack and hurt your Hero again.
Roll your dices and join the most strategic defense combinations with intelligence, challenge your enemy and get the chance to roll a bonus dice, the power dice.
Resolve the roll of power dice. If you’re lucky, you will recover additional life points and obtain the opportunity to gain from 0 to 4 oobu by rolling the oobu dice.
oobu dice will earn you the chance to collect oobu and activate special actions of your Hero during the battle.


WHAT ARE OOBU?

oobu are a form of currency which players can spend in “The oobulous Island Arena” dice game to activate special actions of their Hero during the battle. Each player can reach a maximum number of N.20 oobu. Once players used its own oobu, they will have to start the collection again.

Depending on the number of oobu collected the players can:


earn life points or inflict damages buying additional rolls of the power dice ** With 2 oobu: 1 additional roll ** With 4 oobu ? 2 additional rolls;
trigger a special “oobu attack”. The player can evoke an “oobu attack” of equal value of oobu collected until that moment in the game;
evoke a “deadly attack” of the Hero. Collected 20 oobu the player can evoke the deadly attack and kill the opponent.


WINNING THE GAME.

In The oobulous Island Arena dice game there is only a way to win the game: fight, defeat the enemy Hero and reduce his life points to zero.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Dice, Fighting

name: Moba Wars
description:
Moba Wars is a board game where you can carry out epic battles between two sides. Based on the current successful online games, known as MOBA (Multiplayer Online Battle Arena). With the help of your minions, towers and powerful heroes, you must achieve victory by destroying the enemy's power core.

Moba Wars comes from the idea to build a “bridge” between two gaming worlds, computer/console games and board games. Joining both fun and rivalry in one same game.

Nowadays, the digital era is not a myth, it's a fact. But as famous clothing fashions or good music come back and adapts to modern times, board games and wargames can also do so, in the same way, as mentioned before, bell-bottomed trousers or good rock resurface and set a trend. MOBA WARS is born for this purpose, and one of our goals being to achieve competitive events in many countries, creating a new gaming commuity.

This is why we have chosen the new branch of videogames, already recognized as sport and with an exponential growth of participants and followers all over the world, E-SPORTS, where we will focus on the main branch, MOBAs. Over 100 million players in 2015.

name: Travel through Time
description:
From the description of the publisher:

Ταξιδεύοντας στο Χρόνο (Travel through Time) is an unusual travel through history. Sliding in the hourglass of the game board, children relive the long path of the human history. Strategy keeps players in alert up to the last minute.
Players buy symbols of history, with the money of each epoch, learn the most important events, connect the facts with famous men, learn customs and monitor the evolution of man and his reflection.

User summary:
The game is played through a series of rounds which the players roll the die and move one or two spaces with the old car, two or three spaces with the modern car and five or six spaces with the rocket. Then according to the space they are in, they answer a question. If they answer correctly, they get two bank notes, if they don't, they don't earn something. The winner is the player that has the most money the moment that the first player reaches the last space of the board.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Shadowrun: Schattenland
description:
Shadowrun: Schattenland is a board game based on the Shadowrun RPG.

Translated from Pegasus Spieles homepage:

The year is 2076. The world has moved on. Orcs, trolls, elves and dwarves inhabit a world govern in the mega-corporations and modern technology mixes with mystical magic. In these times called Shadowrunner are sought after asset, because they do it for the powers of the dirty work in the dark alleys of the huge cities. With futuristic equipment, spells and drones they pull into battle.

Shadowrun Schattenland is a thrilling, tactical board game with an emphasis on story and free play decisions. Guided by a game master, players go through various scenarios in a stunning, dystopian future. With their characters they explore different places and compete against dangerous enemies that block their way to fame, money and new equipment for the next job. The independent board game Schattenland based on the popular role-playing game world of Shadowrun and draws from their fascinating topics. This makes it an extremely atmospheric experience which, however, does not require prior knowledge of the game world.

name: Arena Bizarre
description:
The Devious Darkos Blackovian has gathered the most bizarre, dangerous and funny teams of creatures in his Arena in order to entertain and also surprise his audience which came from almost anywhere to bear witness to this weird spectacle.

Each player controls a team of creatures and the main goal is to get the creatures into the Arena and manage to get them out safe before any other player does.
Players alternate turns rolling dice,playing creatures into the Arena and, if able, remove their creatures and/or pile them on other player's creatures in order to slow them down. Creatures have unique abilities that might come in handy during the game.

A player's turn has 4 simple steps:

1)Roll the dice.
2)Play one or more creatures and/or remove or grab, if able.
3)Use creature abilities, if able.
4)Draw a card.

Remove: means removing creatures from the Arena, if able.

Grab: grab another player's creature if it is not guarded.

Guarded: a creature with at least one creature from the same team, on the same Arena space.

The first player who plays all of its team's creatures and removes them safely from the Arena wins the game.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Variable Player Powers

name: Thieving Jerks
description: A card game of thieving from others for your gain or just their loss, the goal is to gain gold, have more cards in hand and in play, and wipe out at least one opponent to end the game and seal your victory. Play To Use cards let you take from others, Play When Taken cards get revenge on those who have taken from you, and DNP cards change victory conditions for better or (more often) worse.

name: Earth Aid
description:
A hungarian student projekt to a robotic competition, FLL. The boardgame is for children, teaching to live environmentally responsible.

"You are one of the six superheroes and you have to defeat Trash with cleaning the Earth! You are collecting ReCoins and completing missions. If all the missions are completed, the superhero who collected the most of ReCoins, is defeating Trash."

You need to go around with the superheroes and develop landfields and environment friendly power plants. If you do this, then you can get recoins. There are missions, which you can complete during the game. When all the missions are completed the game is over and the player, who the most recoins has is the winner
categories: Children's Game, Educational, Environmental, Print & Play

name: Write On, Wipe Off Alphabet Cards
description:
From the back of the box:

This alphabet card game originated at a dinner table in Stavanger. From one concerned father to another; they will truly capitivate your child's interest and help make writing less frustrating and more fun for all!

Each of our write on, wipe off alphabet cards focus on a letter and have playful images that guide and encourage children to form the letter correctly. [There are 29 cards that support the English, Danish, and Norwegian alphabet.]

Make practicing letters fun by turning the cards into a competitive game. Give away one point for every letter your kid writes correctly. If incorrect, you earn the point.

name: Horda Zombi
description:
Horda Zombi is a two-player card game, where players are both defending against a horde of zombies, trying to avoid to get eaten. Each player has a customized deck of 40 cards. As zombies attack a player, they discard cards from his deck. When a player can no longer draw more cards, he is eaten by the zombies, and another player wins.

Each turn has three phases:

Defense phase: In the defense phase, the player can use their weapons. Each weapon comes with a limited ammunition supply; each time you shoot, the player has to remove a bullet. If a weapon is out of ammunition it can not be used.


In this period you you can play cards from your hand, activate items and host zombies in your locations.

Regroup phase: The player gets new energy and readies his items and locations, making them available to use once again. The players also have to draw one card from their deck - and they lose the game if they cannot draw.
Deployment phase: The player can play cards and use their items.

name: Optimatics: The Card Game
description:
Optimatics flagship optimisation software, Optimizer, is a powerful tool to help engineers optimally design their water systems.

In Optimatics: The Card Game players compete to put together the most interesting Optimizer project by collecting hydraulic models, decisions, criteria, objectives and cloud computing subscriptions. Try to be quick to collate a project first or push your luck to get a project worth more points.

Players are dealt 7 cards each. On a player's turn they draw a card from the deck or discard pile and discard a card. Players must form a complete hand to win (1 model card, 1 subscription card, 1+ decision cards, 1+ criteria cards, 1+ objective cards). But it's not just who finishes first wins. When one player reveals a complete hand. Everyone else with a complete hand adds up their score. Scoring varies depending on the specific cards of each type a player has. Most points wins.

name: ChineseChek
description: ChineseChek is described by the publisher as “a cross-country trek to capture cities and territories.” The object of the game is to capture more of the triangular areas than your opponent. On your turn, you connect two dots and form a “wall.” If you are the player who completes the third wall of a triangle, you capture the area and win a free turn. A player who captures one of the cities printed on the playsheet wins extras points.

name: Vegas 13
description: In Vegas 13, each player attempts to score the most points by rolling certain high-scoring combination on the dice. There are 13 different scoring combinations possible, and each combination becomes more valuable as the game progresses.

name: The Olive Tree
description:
The Olive Tree is a co-operative game that focuses on learning and growing the Bible timeline by placing God's "Spiritual Family Tree"/people within the correct spot of history. Players will build-up the tree while there are elements of the game that will try to destroy it. The game is centered around the "People of Faith" written about in (Hebrews 11).

There are many ways to promote the growth of an Olive Tree so it may endure through the centuries. Cutting branches and grafting them onto the strong rootstock is one way to ensure longevity. Another benefit is pruning back some branches in order to propagate the growth of others. Water is also very essential because the tree will require the former and latter rainfall. Even though this all has a physical application of how to maintain a healthy tree, the Bible uses this concept to express spiritual lessons.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Roll / Spin and Move, Variable Phase Order

name: The Olive Tree Reformation
description:
For those that want a little more of a challenge, this version of The Olive Tree is for you! This game focuses on learning timelines of the Biblical characters and Protestant Reformers that brought the church back into the truth of scripture. Have you ever wondered in what century was Job? Where in the Bible does it show what Martin Luther believed? Why was Jan Hus burned at the stake? All will be answered!

The Olive Tree Reformation is a co-operative Bible timeline game that reveals God's "Spiritual Family Tree". Points are accumulated in the game by naming the correct character from the Branch card and connecting it to the correct level of Root or Vine cards. The game has 13 Timeline Rounds. Will you bear enough "Fruit Points" by the end of the 13th round?

REFORMERS
In the 4th century most Christians began to lose sight of the original church's truths by means of creeping pagan compromise within their midst. In the Dark Ages the Bible and its truth was finally silenced and were instead replaced by the traditions of men. Only a select few were allowed to read from its pages and the common people were told it would be too much for their understanding.

Then stood up reformers in the church that read the Bible and uncovered its truth. These reformers showed that the Bible was meant for one and all, thus the gospel was spread once again. However by doing these acts some of the reformers were exiled, persecuted, or even executed by the hands of the church.

name: SAVAGE FRONTIER: Game of Adventure and Survival in Colonial America.
description:
INTRODUCTION
The year is 1754 and tensions are increasing between France and Britain. In far off America, citizens of both sides are concerned only with their basic survival and prosperity. Commerce and trading are bountiful, even, with the Indians. In the Frontier regions, hunters and trappers are gathering a variety of furs and pelts to sell and trade with the many Indian tribes, as well as, Europeans. As the clouds of war are brewing, brave heroes of the frontier will find themselves caught between making a living and serving their Countries; some will even become legends.

OBJECTIVE
SAVAGE FRONTIER is a game for 1-4 Players. Each Player creates a Player Hero starting out in what will, hopefully be, a long and prosperous life in North American Colonies. During play, Player Heroes (Heroes) will conduct a variety of tasks such as hunting, trapping and trading. In the meantime, however, a war between France and Britain is going on and Heroes may find themselves pressed into Military service as Scouts or Militia for their Sovereign Countries. The surviving Hero with the most Legend Points at the end of the last turn is the Winner.

PLAY MECHANICS
Players move their Hero Counters on a hex map representing a fictitious area along the New York and Canadian Border in order to complete a variety of assignments. Some special assignments are determined by drawing Assignment Cards. Assignment Challenges and Combat are resolved using Dice. Battles involving larger forces take place on a Battle Mat.
categories: Adventure, American Revolutionary War, Print & Play
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid

name: Rebuke: My People
description:
Do you enjoy the original REBUKE? How about a deck filled to the brim with discussion cards!? REBUKE: My People expansion is exactly what you need!

You have 2 options. Do you replace the Revival cards in the original REBUKE with these Revival cards or do you treat this expansion as its own casual styled discussion game? Enjoy REBUKE: My People either way you choose.

name: Eldritch
description:
Eldritch is a game set in H.P. Lovecraft’s gothic world of unfathomable creatures and ancient powers. From 3 to 5 players, you play cultists vying for the favour of the Great Old Ones who slumber away the ages in their mythical prisons across the cosmos.

Travel to strange locations in search of fragments of spells and glyphs of power; uncover ancient mysteries, defeat challenges, and risk your very sanity to be the first player to conjure the manifestation of your favoured deity.

Cast spells, send twisted beasts to assault your foes, and build your own power base – using your own sanity to fuel your efforts. Risk too much and you will go irrevocably insane…

With art by the amazing Will Liu, Eldritch features a slew of cards, dice, madness counters, and… four giant and gorgeous models of the Great Old Ones: Hastur, Nodens, Cthulhu, and Ithaqua which are your ultimate goal and the means by which you will crush your enemies!

Coming in 2016

name: Sailor Moon
description:
The players race along the board rolling their dices, stumbling occasionally in special "character squares" with positive or negative effects to their advance. The first to reach the last square (Queen Peryl) wins the game.

Little more than a thematic game of the goose, capitalizing cheaply on the popular franchise rights.
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Have you ever Paint with...Cards!
description:
Game for children where creativity and memory are mixed.

The children will have to use the cards to build a collage. They will receive them to "paint" their artwork as prize if they find the couple of the card .

A rainbow is built with the cards face down .
Then the adult will ask to find some specific couple of suit . Example : Find a Red Rock and a Green Rock . If they are found the cards are taken as prize to be placed to form a picture(collage) previously seen.

The goal is to have fun finding the couples and "painting" the collage of cards.

A very simple game to stimulate memory and creativity

name: Huuuuu
description:
From the game box:

Huuuuu, they jump, they stack, they run... Who will be the first with his team of ghosts in the center of the castle and win the game.

User description:

In this roll-and-move game, players control 4 ghosts which need to get to the centre of the board by exact count.

Players start with 1 ghost. Once a ghost crosses the “2”, “3” or “4” space, the player may enter in play his second, third and fourth ghost.

If a player’s ghost reaches a space occupied by another one of his ghosts, he stacks the ghosts and can then move them together as one.

If a ghost reaches a space of his color that is occupied by an opponent’s ghost, he sends the opponent’s ghost back to the beginning. If a ghost occupies a space of its color, it blocks the opponents’ ghosts, who then need to roll a 6 to get by.

Colored spaces are numbered 1 through 5 in ascending order. If a ghost reaches a space of his color, the player can choose to roll a die and move forward or back to the matching space (on a 6, the ghost goes back to the beginning).

Every time a ghost reaches the centre, it is placed on a scoring track (first place gets 16 points, second place gets 15 points and so on). When all of the ghosts have reached the centre, the points for each color are added up and the highest total wins.

name: Strata
description:
Strata is an educational game that is actually entertaining! It draws on facts and statistics from any discipline and challenges players to place new values within a "Strata" of existing facts.

How many children's books did Dr. Seuss write? Is it more or less than the number of people killed by Rambo in "Rambo: First Blood"?

Which has more, the number of tiles in a Scrabble set or the number of keys on a Keyboard?

These are the kinds of determinations you must make to excel at Strata.

The wonderful thing about the game is that anyone can play, and guessing well is as good as knowing. Also, because of its adaptability to any subject, and infinite number of expansions can be mixed in at later dates to cater to any player. Science, Sports, Music, Movies, Astronomy, History - there is nothing off limits.

name: Marago
description:
A "marago" is a space on the gameboard or a card.

Every time it is your turn, choose a marago.

At the END of the game:
YOU WIN THE GAME=you have 25-250 points more than everyone else.
YOU BUST THE GAME=you got the lowest score and you're behind the highest scorer by more than 250.
YOU ALL SENSEI=if no one wins and no one busts the game, you all tie.

OTHER BASICS:
POINTS: every time you take a marago, it scores you points. the amount of points depends on several criteria, especially in relation to the maragos you've already taken.
DIBS & BIDS: every marago is part of a "group" of maragos. if you're the first player to take a marago in that group, for the rest of the game you have "Dibs" on all remaining maragos of that group. this means that when another payer wants to take a marago from the group you have Dibs on, you can Bid for that marago.

ADVANCED-VARIANT:
"wild cards" variant enables various additional dynamics.

name: Sandwich Mix-Up
description:
Chef Dog is proud of his fabulous sandwiches that will have everyone drooling with hunger, but before he can deliver them, the monkeys have torn them apart and scattered them across the table. Who can reassemble and deliver more sandwiches?

Sandwich Mix-Up consists of forty "bread slices", with twenty of these slices having raised areas that represent the sandwich fillings: cars, rubber ducks, butterflies — you know, the types of things that dogs would use in sandwiches. The other twenty slices have indentations that match the shape of the fillings.

To set up, lay out all the bread slices with the filling sides face up and the indentations face down. At the same time, players start taking the face down slices and feeling the indentations to try to identify which fillings belong to this slice. If they think they know, they can grab that filling slice to try to complete the sandwich. If correct, they keep it; if not, they return the filling to the table.

Whoever finishes the most sandwiches wins!

name: Super Math Spy
description: Super Math Spy involves secret missions, decoder glasses, and lots of calculations.

name: Laughing Kookaburra
description:
Laughing Kookaburra tests your memory with two games in one box.

In "Eggspressions", players divide the cards equally among themselves. One player turns over an Eggspression card, then points to the face on the game board that matches this image. The next player covers this card with a card of their own, then points to the first face, then the second face. Players continue this way until someone can't remember the sequence and is penalized by placing all of the cards at the bottom of their stack. Whoever runs out of cards first wins.

In "Laugh Out Loud", players use the same cards, but flip them to the other side, with each card showing something silly like "Hee", "Hoohoo", "Woah", and so on. Gameplay works the same as above, but now players must repeat the chain of sounds.

In both games, sometimes a card presents the active player with a challenge, and the player must first complete this challenge prior to doing the memory test — and splitting your focus this way is tough!

name: Telepathy
description:
Each team has a Transmitter and Mind Reader.
Transmitters draw a card with six words. Mind Readers try to guess the words by asking questions but transmitters may only shake or nod their heads until the word is guessed. The team who guess all six words first get scores. The team that gets 20 points first is the winning team.

name: Wacky Wizards
description:
Two players square off to reign supreme in the wizard world. High point total wins a point. You must win 3 points to win the round. Win 5 rounds to win the game. Each player squares off with 45 Wizard cards and 18 Wacky Wizard cards. Each round consists of 5 Wizard cards placed face down in front on the player. Each player sets the order before they lay them down. You can never look at them again. You draw two Wacky Wizard cards that you hold in your hand. The Wacky Wizard cards modify your main Wizard cards. Such as changing the cards color, adding or subtracting from your card or your opponents card. You each reveal your top Wizard card and let the battle of wits begin. How will you use your two Wacky Wizard cards to ensure that you win 3 points? Did you create a order of your Wizard cards that best uses the abilities of your Wacky Wizard cards?

Wacky Wizards may also be played in teams of Red verses Blue when more Wacky Wizard Decks are added. You may add two people per Deck added.
categories: Card Game, Humor, Math, Memory, Number
mechanics: Hand Management, Secret Unit Deployment, Variable Player Powers

name: Right to The White House
description:
Right to The White House is a comedic party game. Its cards are themed after the Republican 2016 primary debate. Each card includes a debate topic, a picture of a candidate, and a quote from a televised debate.

The game's starting tableau consists of a draw deck, a discard pile, and a hand of seven cards for each player. Players compete to be the first to discard all their cards, similar to Uno or Skip-Bo. Play proceeds in turns around a circle. Each player must discard or draw one card on his or her turn. Players can only discard a card if the debate topic marked on it matches the topic of the card on the top of the discard pile. When one player discards all their cards, each remaining player accrues points based on the number of cards left in their hand. The game is then reset and continues for three more rounds (or until one player's score exceeds an agreed maximum score).

Two special card types introduce a mechanic that requires all players to speak and act ultra-right wing at all times when playing. The Conservative Challenge cards allows one player to challenge another if they detect any behavior that is not sufficiently conservative (as judged by a vote of all other players). The loser of a Conservative Challenge must draw extra cards. A second special card, the Trump Card, allows players to automatically win any conservative challenge.

name: Don't Bug Me!
description:
The big ol' hungry Bug is out to ruin your picnic! The player who defends his/her food the longest, by blocking him from their corner of the picnic blanket, is the WINNER!

The game uses a large, fast, battery powered bug that moves around the game board erratically, while players use a plastic hand piece to block the bug from hitting their pie. The hand piece re-directs the bug towards their fellow picnickers and away from their own food. The bug moves back and forth around the board until a player fails to block it. When all 4 food pieces are knocked out of position for a player, they are out of the game. Play proceeds until there is only one player left with any food untouched.

name: Hi-Ho! Gator Race
description:
From the back of the box:

Hi-Ho and away we go! It's learning fun the GOLDEN way as children race two alligators around a plastic game tray, taking turns matching colors on the Gators' backs. Designed to help children learn to recognize and match basic colors, Hi-Ho! Gator Race combines fun and learning, offering a snapping good time for all.

name: Stanford The Game
description:
User summary:

You are a new student at Stanford. The object of the game is to graduate (by accumulating 180 or more units) and become the most successful. Success is measured by three different criteria: Final GPA, Social Stature, and Resume Stars.

Players make a few decisions on paths to follow, but the game is largely dice rolling luck. Strategically little more advanced than Candyland or Chutes & Ladders. You do get to travel around a campus map. Probably ONLY of any interest to Stanford grads and fans.

Flimsy and shoddy components and construction.

name: Empire
description:
The wargame with miniatures. The box contains map of ancient world, miniatures, a two six-sided dices, markers of flags and money, bookrule.

You can conquer the ancient world using simple rules and pretty miniatures.

Players may conquer neutral or opponnent's provinces, get taxes from them, build forces (infantry, cavalry, chariots, elephants), fleets, fortresses.

Armies can fight under overlord command only.

Quality of overlords are restricted and players should care about them.

Simple combat system uses a two 6-sided dices to determinate "licky" bonus
