The player who conquers the all provinces is winner.

name: Find the Link
description: Party game based on UK BBC television game show that aired from 1954 to 1956. Two players are secretly given details of an imaginary link between them and other players have to deduce it. A chairperson is required to moderate. The game contains cards with six links, including backgrounds, and cards for the chairperson and panelists.

name: Fireside Tales
description:
From the publisher:
Fireside Tales is a collaborative storytelling game for 4 to 8 players. The goal of the game is to tell an enjoyable story together by suggesting appropriate story elements represented by the cards you play. If you wish to win, in addition to hearing an awesome story, suggest the cards that fit the story best - so that the other players choose to incorporate them in the story. Whoever gets the most elements into the story is the victor.

Imagine Once Upon a Time meets Cards Against Humanity, then add deeper storytelling and wacky rules - and you'll get Fireside Tales.

name: Enid Blyton's Little Noddy Party Game
description: Players race to find hidden images in three pictures of Noddy's world.

name: Medieval Battle: The Commander
description: The expansion of the board game Medieval Battle. The token of the Commander appears on a battlefield and can fight like the other units but the attendance of the Commander allows also to surprise the opponent by the special command or maneuver.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Expansion for Base-game, Medieval, Wargame
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Hexagon Grid, Modular Board

name: Jola: Wer lacht zuletzt?
description:
Each player starts with three pigs in his pigpen. The goal of the game is to get rid of the pigs. Movement is determined by two dice and comences on the track of each players color around the game bord ant into the meadow in the center. If at least one of the dice shows an 1 and one of the player's pigs is in a segment of his color, he discards the pig to the meadow, or if a pig is in the color section of another player, it may be put in this players pigpen.

The game ends when the last player gets his last pig onto the meadow. So even if one player is the first to get rid of his pigs, he may still get new ones until the last player ends the game and may himself lose the game.
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Pass auf!: Die Gefahren der Straße
description:
Each player starts on one of 6 starting points, has to visit all the other starting points in numerical order and end the game on his own starting point. Movement is determined by a die. On some spaces traffic situations hinder or benefit the players, dependent if they are motorists, motor cyclists or pedestrians.
The first player to return to his own starting point wins the game.

This game was likely published between 1912 and 1927.
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Weltkrieg Main Rulebook
description:
Weltkrieg allows you to re-create well-known (and not so well-known) battles from the wars of the 20th Century on your tabletop, and change the course of history! Scaled for Grand Tactical representation (one miniatures base = 1 company of troops), this first book of the Weltkrieg series includes:

The game series rules, divided into Basic, Advanced, and Optional sections for ease of learning;
Rules that cover basic combat mechanics, command attributes and troop quality, the use of specialized troops (artillery, scouts, aircraft and anti-air, etc.), night actions, airborne operations, engineering functions, and more;
Roughly 180 Data Cards containing the game stats for German and Soviet forces on the Eastern Front, 1941-45, plus a dozen pages of unit organizations for both armies, and a special insert containing the game-equivalent TO&E of Panzergrenadier Division Grossdeutschland at the beginning of the 1942 Fall Blau offensive; Five battle scenarios covering actions throughout the war; Seven 'generic' scenarios that can be used for pick-up games, or as the starting scenario for one of two different types of campaign games; Comprehensive game charts, play aids and markers.

Weltkrieg uses a semi-alternating turn sequence that keeps players involved in the game instead of waiting around for their opponent to finish their turn before being permitted to take any actions, and incorporates the use of specific unit orders and Command Points that may be expended to perform certain game functions; formations having better command and control will be able to accomplish more during an average game turn than those with lesser force coordination.

Written primarily for 6mm and smaller figure scales, Weltkrieg can accommodate figure scales up to 15mm with minimal rules modifications.

The Basing seems compatible with Flames of War so this gives an alternative to use with your 15mm miniatures.

Case Blue Free Demo version is available.

name: The Worst Type Of Person
description:
The Worst Type Of Person is an adult party game that lets players amuse each other with their humor and creativity.

In this entertaining game, players use one of the descriptive cards in their hand to create the funniest person they can by matching it to a person on a card.

Players choose from their hand a description on a card to make the funniest and most ridiculous, ludicrous, absurd, inappropriate, preposterous, and and “worst type of person” they can. Then all of the players discuss why their choice, or another players choice is the “worst”.

Players decide which other player they think made the “worst person”, and award them their played card. The player with the most awarded cards at the end of the game wins.

Players will have fun playing their cards and laughing at the cards other players play. But the most fun comes from the hilarious discussions players will have about their choices.

The description on your card may not seem to be the worst at first, but a clever or creative explanation can make your description the worst.

Making funny matches with the cards is entertaining, but the group discussion of everyone’s choices is where the game really becomes fun.

The games are fairly short if played for only 1 or 2 rounds. With short games, players can more easily leave or join the game. Short games also allow other players to join in easier.

The Worst Type of Person is available in 2 volumes at The Game Crafter for $19.99 each.
categories: Card Game, Humor, Mature / Adult, Party Game

name: Dojo Defense
description:
Defend the walls of your Dojo from invading Pirates that want to steal the ancient artifact of great power you protect. Play one of six ninjas all with their own special abilities and work together to prevent the fall of the dojo.

This is a worker placement tower defense co-operative game where the Ninjas take turns fighting off wave after wave of Pirates until they have defeated four of six Pirate Captains. Build and upgrade walls to slow down their advance because if they enter the Dojo they will start damaging the Ninjas instead of just the walls and turrets. You can always use bombs and ballistas but you only have have a limited number to use.

Each end phase the Pirate ships will attack with their cannons and send in reinforcements. The location of that attack and the direction and number of new pirates is randomly selected by three small decks of cards that will be reshuffled every time a captain is found. The difficulty of the game can be changed by adding or subtracting to the Pirate number deck.
mechanics: Action Points, Cooperative Game, Worker Placement

name: Folded
description:
Folded is an abstract origami themed card game for two players. The play area consists of four stacks of cards in the center of play representing squares of origami paper to be "folded" to make creations.

The game comes with many creation cards, each with four steps to complete a creation. These steps must be found in order by flipping cards in place to reveal the steps in sequence and complete chosen creations.

Players move clockwise around four locations using balloon markers to fulfill journey task cards. These journey task cards simply show the symbol that must match the category when chosing the four creations. Players may force their openent to use a differend search method from four fold reference cards to hider their search.

The first player to complete all four creations is declared the winner.

Folded has brightly colored cards in this print and play game that can be played by many ages. It is also compact enough to fit in a mint tin to bring anywhere.

name: Assembly of the Gods
description: Trick tacking and set collection game where collecting the most pairs of gods is the goal before running out of cards. Played with a 72 card deck with 18 different gods from ancient Greece.

name: Tango!
description:
From the publisher (English):
A yahtzee-like game where players represent Tango dancers in a tournament, they try to acomplish the best choreography in order to win.

From the publisher (Spanish):
El juego (inspirado en la generala) trata sobre un concurso de Tango, donde los jugadores representan parejas tratando de hacer diversos pasos de baile, y de ser posible coreografías de diversa complejidad, quien mejor lo haga será el ganador.

name: Pass the Popcorn! Movie Snap!
description:
A fast-paced, movie matching card game. Match the Popcorn Cards in your hand to the famous films on the Movie Cards. First player to play out all of their Popcorn Cards wins.

60 Popcorn Cards and 120 Movies
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game, Trivia

name: Super Market Shuffle
description:
From the publisher:

In the super-fast card game Supermarket Shuffle, you are shopping at the supermarket and trying to grab the best combination of items in your shopping cart. Score points for collecting the most apples. Watch the Daily Specials to help you pay for you groceries using less money And once you're done shopping, you might have won a special prize! But be careful which groceries you allow your friends to take; it might be just what they need to beat you! And make sure you have enough money to purchase your groceries or you have to give them back.

Supermarket Shuffle takes card-drafting mechanisms and distills them into a 20-30 minute game that anyone can play. The dynamics of "draft and pass" are brought to the fore, while keeping the rules to a minimum. As you see the first few hands of cards, you must quickly assess the make-up of the round and decide which type of groceries you'll go for. Then, each turn you'll need to weigh which cards to keep and which to pass on. The different scoring combinations allow for some clever plays and nasty blocks.
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Open Drafting, Push Your Luck, Set Collection

name: Raid Wars
description:
This is a simple print-and-play fantasy Card Game with pre-constructed decks, simulating small scattered battles in the everlasting greater war of good versus evil.

Each player chooses a side (good or evil), and tries to win the battle by discovering and researching powerful resources to eventually use in the greater war, such as spells, relics and enchantments. Players can hire heroes to hinder the opponent’s exploration, but for that they will have to face enemy dungeons and their challenges, such as guardians and traps, built to protect the resources being processed inside.

So, the goal of each player is basically build dungeons by placing challenges over the table, and then trying to process resources inside. While keeping these resources protected against enemy invasions, the player will also want to disrupt the progress of the opponent, which is acquired by forming a party of heroes to raid the enemy dungeons. During invasions, six-sided dice are rolled to decide success or failure.
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Dice Rolling

name: Windfall
description:
It happens in an instant. The awakening of a world. When events urge that world into a point of sudden chaos, and clarity. In this instance, in this world, it was called Windfall.

Windfall was the sudden manifestation of Aether – raw and unstable magical energy. Unleashed by the whim of the gods, it's presence has changed the world forever.

Windfall is a strategy card game for 2-4 players, where each player takes on the role of a powerful Guardian. These mighty individuals battle for control of the Aether using amazing spells, powerful relics and deadly creatures.

In Windfall, there are two primary ways to play. The first is the more casual Adventure Mode, where players will be playing from a shared group deck, making the best play out of the cards they are dealt. The more advanced mode of play is Drafting, where each game session starts with a unique drafting process before the players battle it out.

Each turn, as your power grows, you will summon creatures, equip weapons, harness ancient relics and cast deadly spells. Each player will battle the other guardians, reducing their life until only one remains standing.

name: All-Star Wrestling Rejects
description:
From the publisher:

All-Star Wrestling Rejects is a fast paced collectible card game that features a roster of six not-so-super stars competing for the coveted ASWR Championship Gold!

If you're on Offense your objective is to create a sequence of moves that inflicts maximum damage to your opponent and that will, eventually, lead to a pin. Each move (card played) deals a certain amount of damage to your opponent. You play a card by matching up the specific color with the appropriate side to the Transition Move (last Offensive card played). Be careful what move you play, as the higher the damage that is dealt, the more sides that are blacked out. With 48 different Offensive moves to unleash, every match is a unique challenge! On Defense? Then prepare to use your Block cards to limit the options on, and hopefully completely block off, your opponents offensive sequence. Or you could always play that Reverse card . . .

Throw Foreign Objects such as Kendo Sticks, Steel Chairs, Rubber Chickens, and Sporks into the mix to take your opponent out, but watch out! If your opponent plays a Referee Block card it could be game over. Each wrestler also has two Custom Finishers (for a total of 12 included in the game)! Can you survive The Hunchback Hillbilly's "Hurrican-Moron-A", Abe Sherman's "Hip Replacement", or The Bulkster's "Leg Plop"?

The Starter Set includes everything you need to begin playing immediately!
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Pattern Building

name: Soldier Set: Shooting Game
description:
This game is an example of a typical boy's "Pop-Gun" game or kit that were released by Gabriel & Sons (as early as 1910), then by Parker Brothers, Milton Bradley, and by Built-Rite. It has has a metal pop-gun, so it was manufactured before the depression.

Games like this remained in print through the 1950's before being supplanted by electronic target games like Wild West Shootout!
categories: Action / Dexterity, Children's Game, World War I

name: Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles: Back to the Sewer
description:
Turtles travel freely (the number rolled on the die, in any direction) around the game board fighting Shredder's henchmen. The goal is to try to win enough battles, collect enough cards, and beat Shredder first. Each board space has one of a handful of actions associated with landing there. Sewers are used as portals to jump across the board and manhole covers can be used to block those portals.

Game rules borrow heavily from Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles: Pizza Power Game (1987).
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Dance Arena 200
description:
The dance arena is ready, and it's time to put on your dancing shoes!

Dance Arena 200 is a hilarious social game. Out of 200 dances from all over the world, it's your job to make your partner guess the correct dance.
Demonstrate! Dance together! Teach! Explain! And best of all - have fun!
Attention: once the sand timer is turned over, your teammate must name as many dances as possible. The fastest players win! With various difficulty levels, this game is suitable for everyone, no matter what your dancing skills are.

name: Emblems
description: Emblems is a trick-taking and set-collecting card game about grouping country flags. Call out attributes of specific flags and collect as many cards as possible. Earn additional points along the way by using special bonus cards that will boost your total score. The player with the highest score wins.

name: Project Baikal
description:
Project Baikal is a collaborative village-building eurogame inspired from tower defence video games.
It is a family-friendly card game for 2 to 4 players, 10+ y.o. and one hour in length.

Project Baikal has an original gameplay where all the players can execute their actions at the same time (no player turn).

Theme
The dark winds of war, famine, plague and catastrophic weather have swept the planet, almost scouring it clean of humanity.
One small enclave still survives though, in a village on the bank of the Lake Baikal in Siberia.
From such humble beginnings the human race can be reborn. And not make the mistakes from the past.

You and your friends are the villagers, keeping out the remnants of the old world and nurturing the hopes of the new.
You will protect the village from wolves, mercenaries and internal pressures like racism and corruption.
You will welcome strangers with needed skills, grow your village and rebuild civilisation anew.

Gameplay
From 4 locations, bad events (Sabotage, Wolf pack, Disease, etc) slowly progress towards your newly-formed village.

To defeat those events before they do damage, you will:
- Collect action cards (Move, Meet, Draw, Swap, Build and Give),
- Move to locations (Forest, Lake, Mountain and Road) and
- Encounter those events.

You can also acquire good events (old couple, family, dog, etc) who will help to build useful buildings (Town Hall, Lab, Hospital, etc) using gathered resources (Wood and Stone).

You have 6 turns to complete 6 buildings and win the game.
But beware: you can lose instantly if your village takes too much damage!!!

Acknowledgment: Theme written by Ian Triffit.
categories: Card Game, City Building, Environmental, Print & Play, Science Fiction
mechanics: Area Movement, Cooperative Game, Hand Management, Simultaneous Action Selection, Slide/Push, Worker Placement

name: Verliebt: Verlobt – Verheiratet
description:
User sumary:
The title is a german nursery rhyme. Something like "in love - engaged to be married - married".
3 to 8 players (on the box it is written incorrectly as 3-12 players) can do this funny boardgame with many hearts and luck.
First you have to select, if you are a man (turn your pawn clockwise) or a woman (turn your pawn anticlockwise). Everyone gets 10 hearts, the money in this game. Roll the dice and move your pawn along the coloured fields. On the yellow fields you get a yellow card with your interests (jazz, football, politics). On the green fields you get characteristics (angry, smart). If two players meet each other, they can fall in love (romantic) and check their performance (economically). Sometimes you have to pay with red hearts or get black hearts (white fields) and you have to pay for optimizing your interests and characteristics.
After a specified time all players sum up their red and black hearts and the winner is the heart with the most.

name: Misfits For Hire
description:
Each player represents a claimant to the Throne of Vintha'las. The King, in his wisdom has decided that the claimants shouldn't have a civil war to figure out who wins. No, they should prove their mettle by besting one of the horrific beasts that wanders the kingdom. One slight problem, the beasts have killed all the legendary heroes, so the claimants will have to make due with...the rest.

The rest are the Misfits, a group of drunken washed up heroes who now haunt the tavern The Drunken Artist, and are your greatest hope for claiming the throne. Here goes nothing!

There are two ways to win. Be the first team to kill the monster, or be the last player standing.

Players draw cards from the community pile as they pursue the big bad monster, sometimes drawing cards that help them, sometimes drawing cards that help the monster. With their hand they discard cards to utilize different types of moves, like attacking the monster or stealing cards from the other groups of misfits questing after the monster as well. Defeat the monster yourself or wait until it devours everyone else, the choice is yours. Whoever lands the last hit gets the kill, so be weary of opportunistic players!
categories: Adventure, Card Game, Video Game Theme
mechanics: Hand Management, Open Drafting, Player Elimination, Push Your Luck

name: Parallax
description:
"Despite all our hopes, Earth got depleted before FTL jumps were possible. However, mankind made one last and desperate effort: five colony fleets were sent in an intergenerational journey to other worlds potentially capable of supporting human life…

...colonists reaching Arcturus found a barren planet, and in order to preserve their very existence they established a symbiotic relationship with the ancient supercomputer they found there…

...those reaching Draco incorporated the genes of an indigenous lizard into their DNA so they could survive the adverse planetary conditions…

...colonists headed for Kerberos found resources were scarce there and chose to change themselves so no one had to be left behind…

...as for the fourth fleet... well, you all know what happened... let's just say that we were the lucky ones, especially considering that no one has heard about the fifth fleet ever since.

One would think the later invention of the FTL drive presented an opportunity to reunite and live in peace with our long lost brothers... unfortunately, regardless of our many differences, we all were descendants of mankind and thus we all were afflicted by the same curse: WAR".


Parallax is a 4X board game, playable in 2 to 3 hours, which focuses on providing a deep political space opera experience.

The political part is achieved through variable player powers and asymmetric factions: since each player exploits the monopoly of a different resource and handles crucial information only available to their faction, chances are that not only they will need to eXplore, eXpand, eXploit and eXterminate to meet their goals, but to also negotiate or even become allies to do so.

This, combined with the fact that every decision affects the unstable balance of power, not only allows for constant player interaction but also eliminates downtime, since everyone has some influence over each other actions —to the point of even affecting the outcome of battles and duels they are not directly involved in—.

As for the space opera part, it is achieved by putting the spotlight on the characters that the players use to carry out their orders, on the personal relationships that arise between them and on how they affect the global conflict: for example, your commodore may be hesitant to attack the fleet commanded by the person she just fell in love with in the previous turn, and she may even deflect if forced to do so.

This not only allows for a rich dramatic narrative that makes each game memorable, but also presents players with a series of events that force them to constantly reassess their alliances, further fostering negotiation and player interaction.

Don’t miss the opportunity to not only participate in galactic diplomacy, empire building and interplanetary battles, but to also become part of the romance and the drama experienced by their protagonists... Join us to spy on your fellow diplomats and sell the information to the highest bidder, to persuade local leaders to support you in the upcoming elections, or to taste the glory of becoming champion of the arena… just make sure that, when the time comes, you’re in the winning alliance…
categories: Adventure, Civilization, Fighting, Negotiation, Political, Science Fiction, Space Exploration
mechanics: Alliances, Area Majority / Influence, Variable Phase Order, Variable Player Powers

name: Melvin + Simon
description: Melvin + Simon is a collage art memory game.

name: Yalla
description:
In Yalla you compete to be the best falafel stand in the Old City! Take and fill orders to garner praise from reviewers and customers to be the first five star falafel stand!

Game play is a furious mix of dice and card drafting. Yalla is a very simple to learn and quick playing strategy game..

name: Jugger TTG: Dogskull Heroes
description:
Jugger TTG: Dogskull Heroes is a tabletop board game simulation of a real-life modern sport which is based on a fictional gladiatorial sport featured in a 1980's cult movie, "The Blood of Heroes" (also known as "The Salute of the Jugger" and "Salute to the Jugger").

The 1989 movie, "The Blood of Heroes", filmed in Australia and starring Rutger Hauer portrays a post-apocalyptic world, similar to the Mad Max movies, in which the central focus of the bedraggled society is a brutal gladiatorial game called "The Game". In this movie a rag-tag team of players, called "Juggers", fight their way through the barren lands to earn the right to play in the big league of The Nine Cities.

The cult following of the movie saw the emergence of Jugger as a sport where the brutal weapons in the movie were replaced with padded foam weapons (also known as spars or pompfen). First emerging in Germany, Sport Jugger quickly spread through out Europe, Australia, and the Americas. So popular has the sport become that in 2014 the German World Masters Tournament, The Deutsche Meisterschaft, attracted 74 Jugger teams from across the world.

In 2015 Jugger fanatic and games designer, Stuart Shaw, took on the challenge of creating a tabletop board game by fusing his game system, Siostam, with modern Sport Jugger rules. The result is an exhilarating, fast paced action tabletop game, Jugger TTG: Dogskull Heroes, where you get to take charge of your own Jugger team and lead them to victory and glory against the best Jugger players in the world.

name: Illiterati
description:
Players draw various cards permitting them to gain points, steal cards from others, block steal attempts, and force others to discard their hands. The objective is to acquire a requisite number of points while blocking the efforts of other players to do the same.

The game moves very quickly, focused on fast-paced action rather than high-level strategy.

name: Everyday Strife
description:
Everyday Strife features 104 unique playable cards, each with its own value and function. Players attempt to win by holding specific categories, combinations, or values of cards. They draw cards and also attempt to steal them from other players. Various mechanisms are provided for countering steal attempts and sabotaging the efforts of others.

The game integrates rock-paper-scissors for some of its competitive events, as well as special requirements for playing certain cards, such as using phrases and accents.

name: SezWho?
description: SezWho? is a trivia game in which players attempt to identify quotations from famous individuals in the fields of Gossip; Politics; Arts, Science & Literature; Sports; Movies, and TV.

name: NASCARD Modular track system
description:
Modular track system 1/64 scale

You can build every NASCAR speedway for a low cost.

Scale: 1 space by second. (Except Bristol 2 spaces by second)

An expansion is planned to build any pitlane, but this is not necessary for the game
since pitstops are resolved by Action cards.

For most of Ovals, there are enough inside sections to build pitlane and a 3rd inside lane.

Can be used by children to play with their NASCAR and INDYCAR diecast 1/64.

name: Racing Simulator Modular Track System
description:
Modular track system 1/87 scale

You can design every F1 tracks, from the actual or future seasons for a low cost.

An expansion is planned to build any pitlane, but this is not necessary for the game
since pitstops are resolved by Action cards.

name: Battle Roller
description:
Battle Roller is a tabletop miniatures game focused on Mecha PvP combat. The idea is to capture the feel of games like Armored Core and Titan Fall on the tabletop while still having a system that is easy to get into but with depth for more immersive and challenging game play.

Players take on the role of Roller Pilots, customizing and preparing their Rollers for combat. Each Roller (similar to a mech or power suit) is customizable allowing players to mix and match parts to suit their play style. The deluxe papercraft miniatures as well as the console/dashboard cards are configurable to match the build choices that the player makes.

During the game players allocate EN (energy) to different systems for offence, defense, movement, and initiative and are locked into those actions for the upcoming round. As they take damage, they lose EN and their systems will go offline until they are no longer able to continue.

The starter set includes PDFs (letter sized) for the rule book, the Forest Map with obstacles, console cards with EN markers and 2D minis for 4 pre-configured Rollers and Pilots, sticker sheet for Action Dice, and parts and assembly instructions for the deluxe miniatures for the 4 pre-configured Rollers and Pilots.

name: Fervour
description:
Fervour is a TCG under the LCG model. It is a simulation of a duel between two people in a world where people's beliefs become reality. Since emotions are the strongest feelings a person can have these are utilised to shape the environment to their favour.

There are three main Unique mechanics in Fervour:

1. Single action turns: Just like in a real fight, initiative goes back and forth and you can guard, respond and counter. With one action per turn games are fast-paced and energetic and have multiple tactics available rather than always a single “best play”.

2. Re-set every round: At the start of each round most of the cards on the field are re-shuffled and your hand is drawn again. This makes the game fast from the first turn of the game while still keeping it consistent.

3. Each card is useful: Each card has an elemental ability. All cards you can’t cast can be added to cards you can to buff them. So it doesn’t matter if you can play all your cards or only one, both hands are good in their own way. Also when casting a card the top card of your deck is flipped and its elemental ability is added and if it’s an emotion (your resources) then you play it and can use it on that turn.

name: Tamaotch!
description:
User summary:
In the solitaire game of 魂落っち! (Tamaotch!), you are a god who collects souls into a new creature. You arrange 12 cards in a 3x4 matrix. Each card has two colored squares, so there are 6x4 colored squares in play.

Each round, you may rotate one card or switch positions of two adjacent cards. You score points if you form a line of three or more squares of the same color. The more lines you form, the more points you score. Cards used to form lines are removed, but you may choose some of them to be reshuffled. Then new cards are placed to fill the cleared space. Repeat this process until no lines are formed.

This game has puzzle and deck building factors. You should watch the play field closely to detect a big-point move. You should also think carefully which cards are to be removed and which to be reshuffled.

Publisher's summary:
プレイヤーは神様となって、魂を集めて、新しい生物を作るゲームです。
2色の色が上下に記されたカードを４列３段で並べ、
それを１ラウンドに１アクション（上下・左右の場所交換と上下の回転）をして、
同じ色を縦横斜めのいずれかで並べるようにして、セットを作るようにします。
セットが同時に沢山出来たら高得点！
なおかつ、使ったカードを山札に戻せるので、長続き出来る事になり、かつ、戻る色を選べるので山札の構築感が味わえます。
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Pattern Building
publishers: Joynt Game Factory (ジョイントゲームファクトリー)

name: Ayasu
description:
User summary:
AYASU is a go-out-to-win style card game.

Each player starts with five cards. In your turn, you may play a card whose number is the same or adjacent to the recently played card (e.g. You may play 1, 2, or 3 on recently played 2). If your card shares the same animal icon with the recently played one, you must cry like that animal, and other players may calm that animal in appropriate manner (patting that player's head, tickling the chin, etc.). The first player who calmed correctly may play a card that shares the same animal icon.

The player who has emptied their hand wins the game.

Publisher's summary:
ゴーアウト型の
カードゲームで、各自5枚の手札でプレイします。
自分の手番では場札に対して、同じ数字、もしくは
つながっている数字（場札が2なら1か3）であれ
ば出すことができ、
場のカードと同じイラストが今自分の出したカード
にあれば、そのイラストの鳴き声を出さねばなりま
せん。また他のプレイヤーはその鳴いたプレイヤー
をいち早くあやすことで、同じイラストの入ってい
るカードを1枚出すことが出来ます。
最初に手札を無くしたプレイヤーが勝ちとなります。
publishers: Joynt Game Factory (ジョイントゲームファクトリー)

name: Battle for Nethervein
description:
Set in a dark fantasy world full of steampunk inventions and Lovecraftian horror, Battle for Nethervein invites player to take the role of one of the world's mighty heroes and fight for one of the factions to achieve total victory.

The game is heavily inspired by the computer MOBA genre, but it tries to take a modern and action-packed approach. Players divide into two teams, each fighting for either The Syndicate or The Swarm. During the game, you control only your hero, which gets stronger and gains new skills as the game goes on. Your actions influence what happens on the battlefield: You can fight on the frontline to push it to opposing towers to raze them down or fulfill quests around the board. The game focuses on fluid action gameplay and utilizes simultaneous movement-choosing and combat-planning so that you can bluff out your opponent. Enjoy an epic fight with up to five friends!

name: Apache Pass
description:
User summary:
In the year 1977, Atlantic produced, inside their 15 games-line called “Il Gioco delle Battaglie” (The Game of Battles), 5 "board-wargames" of the Old West/Indian Wars theme (code numbers from 1456 to 1460 in their catalog).

Each set included 1/72-HO scale toy soldiers, vehicles and accessories from Atlantic production, plus a different playing field game-map, related rules and historical introductory notes for every battle.

The game-maps (large pieces of paper of 68 for 68,5x49 cm) were photographs from above of 3D dioramas of hypothetical battlefields of the battles represented. On the back of the game-map sheets were shown the assembly diagrams for the parts contained in the package and the game rules, in four languages, with numerous illustrations for clarification.

The main fight rules were checkers/chess like: the player pieces must enter the enemy squares to eliminate his soldiers, with some hierarchical precedencies: e.g. no foot soldiers can eliminate horse-mounted ones. Non dice were used anywhere in the games.

From the publisher (Translated):
Apache Pass - July 15, 1862 – n°1460
Following up several encounters that had taken place between the Cavalry and the Chiricahuas led by Cochis, one of the most awful battles of that time broke out in Apache Pass. Five thousand Chiricahuas and Mimbrenjos warriors laid an ambush to a division of volunteers led by General James Henry Carleton. A few Indians let the soldiers pursue them in a gorge. The soldiers had hardly entered the pass when they were received by shots coming from all sides and by huge rocks that the Indians let roll dawn the cliffs of the mountain to crush them to death. The Indians led by Cochis and Jerome followed the instructions of Mangas Coloradas, the old chief who let his people gain the victory thanks to his peculiar strategic moves.

RULES
HOW TO START THE GAME
One of the two players keeps the Americans and the other keeps the Indians. The American player moves first, but initially the soldiers are placed outside the west side of the playing map. The Indians player goes second, but start with his pieces already on the squares on the east border of the map.
HOW TO MOVE
A) On each square the players may place from 1 to a max. of 4 soldier pieces.
B) Each piece may be moved l square at a time.
C) Each piece may move in a straight line only, never diagonally.
D) Each turn each player can move only the pieces that start the turn on the same square: i.e., at each turn can be moved only the pieces of 1 square (one or more of them).
E) Foot soldiers only (i.e.: no vehicles or horses) may enter the squares where there are houses.
HOW TO ELIMINATE THE ENEMY
A) In order to eliminate the enemy pieces it is necessary to enter the square where they stand.
B) Foot soldiers con eliminate only other foot soldiers (e.g.: no horse mounted ones).
C) All the enemy pieces in a square are eliminated even if only a single adversary piece enter the square.
WHO WINS THE BATTLE
The player who succeeds in eliminating all opposing forces is the winner of the battle.
categories: American Indian Wars, American West, Miniatures
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid

name: Little Big Horn
description:
User summary:
In the year 1977, Atlantic produced, inside their games-line called “Il Gioco delle Battaglie” (The Game of Battles), 5 "board-wargames" of the Old West/Indian Wars theme (code number from 1456 to 1460 in their catalog).

Each set included soldiers, vehicles and accessories from their HO-scale toy soldiers production, plus a different playing field game-map, related rules and historical introductory notes for every battle.

The game-maps (large pieces of paper of 68 for 68,5x49 cm) were photographs from above of 3D dioramas of hypothetical battlefields of battles represented. On the back of the game-map sheets were shown the assembly diagrams for the parts contained in the package and the game rules, in four languages, with numerous illustrations for clarification. The main fight rules were checkers/chess like: the pieces must enter the enemy squares to eliminate them, with some hierarchical precedencies: e.g. no foot soldiers could eliminate horse-mounted ones. Non dice were used anywhere in the games.

From the publisher (translated):
Little Big Horn - June 26, 1876 – n°1456
During the operations against the Sioux, General George Crook learned that a lot of Indians were gathering on the shore of the Little Big Horn. It was therefore given the order to enter the field. Divided into three columns, cavalry, infantry and artillery converged in the direction oi the Indian encampment. The 7th Horse was commanded by lieutenant-colonel George Armstrong Custer. Out of personal ambition he disregarded the orders ha had received and divided his regiment into three Columns without waiting for the main body of the army. As a matter of fact he wanted to surround the Indian camp with his regiment only. The Indians, led by Crazy Horse and Seated Bull, hindered the two side columns so that Custer was isolated in the middle. Five thousand Warriors attacked Custer and his 132 men and wiped them out an 26th June 1876.

RULES
HOW TO START THE GAME
One of the two players keeps the American Army and the other keeps the
Indians. The U.S. Army move first, but initially the soldiers are placed outside the west side of the playing map. The Indians player goes second, but start with his pieces already on the squares on the east border of the map.
HOW TO MOVE
A) On each square the players may place from 1 to a max. of 4 soldiers.
B) Each piece may be moved l square at a time.
C) Each piece may move in a straight line only, never diagonally.
D) Each turn each player can move only the pieces that start the turn on the same square: i.e., at each turn can be moved only the pieces of 1 square (one or more of them).
E) Foot soldiers only (i.e.: no vehicles or horses) may enter the squares where there are houses.
HOW TO ELIMINATE THE ENEMY
A) In order to eliminate the enemy pieces it is necessary to enter the square
where they stand.
B) Foot soldiers con eliminate only other foot soldiers (no horse mounted ones).
C) All the enemy pieces in a square are eliminated by entering it.
WHO WINS THE BATTLE
The player who succeeds in eliminating all opposing forces is the winner of the battle.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid

name: Grid Position
description:
From the publisher:

Grid Position: The Ultimate Grid Racer!

A race game for 2-4 players that combines board and classic video arcade into one exciting game. Drivers dodge and bump as they compete for first position while the track thunders along beneath them. As well as opponents, keep a look out for the oncoming drone drivers and oil spills as you select high gear in your bid to win the Championship!

Grid Position uses a unique gameplay mechanic where the cars advance along the track comprised of a 4x5 grid by moving the drone and crashed cars backwards!

Each player moves their car one space either forward, back, left or right in turn order that is decided by a dice roll. Each car has a corresponding coloured dice that are all rolled at once with the highest roll getting the first movement down to the lowest roll moving their car last. Cars also have a Low and a High gear with a forward move only allowed while in High gear and a back move lower your gear to Low.

After each car has moved all drone cars and any oil spills are moved one space backwards to give the illusion of the race cars moving forward along the track. The Black Race die thrown with the coloured dice adds these drone cars and oil spills when it rolls a 1,2,3 or 4(must match with a coloured die) with a 5 or 6 completing a Lap.

Players win the race by being at the front of the pack when Lap 7 is completed with a tie being decided with a Photo Finnish roll off between the tied cars. Winners receive a Trophy card for the race with seven trophies available through a Championship season. Player with the most trophies after seven races is crowned the Champion.

name: Bullets & Dames
description:
The Card Game For Gangsters!

Gun down rival mobs in your bid to rise from small time henchman to the top boss of Crime City. Take the city in true 1930’s style with Machine Guns, Hit Cars, Henchmen and… Bullets & Dames.

Take control of Crime City’s North, South, East & West Sides and stake your claim for Boss!

2-4 players with a hand of 5 cards each take turns to shoot each other and steal control of Crime City's North, South, East & West Sides. With the use of Machine Gun cards, Hit Cars, and loyal Henchmen players battle for a bid to draw a card from the Boss deck once thet control the 4 sides of the city. Draw the Boss card to win!
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management

name: Miner Assault
description:
Miner Assault is a Space Marine themed, small-scale, medium strategy, hex and counter battle game designed to be played in under 2 hours.

The year is 2525 and the space mining boom is a bloody race for riches.

Corporations send elite teams of armed miners to far off planets where they fight to the death for a chance to strike it rich mining pure Mercurine ore.

Gameplay:
Miner Assault is a 2-4 player race to mine 6 Ore and bring them back to your base before your opponent(s).

Turns consist of 2 rounds; Movement then Combat, and the order of play is decided by team size.

Players take turns moving all (or as many as they wish) of their pieces, making sure not to move them too far. Any piece that moves it's maximum distance becomes Fatigued and cannot attack during the combat round that turn.

Once every player has had a chance to move their pieces/units, the combat round begins, continuing in the same turn order as the movement round. A new turn order is decided at the end of every combat round by adding up the number of HP chips each player has on the board. The player with the most chips moves first and play order moves in descending HP order.

Resources are now doled out designated by the surviving units and the tiles on which they did the surviving. Play continues until only one player is left (not very likely) or a player successfully brings 6 Ore back to their base.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Pick-up and Deliver, Point to Point Movement, Take That

name: Fetterman Massacre
description:
User summary:
In the year 1977, Atlantic produced, as part of their games-line called “Il Gioco delle Battaglie” (The Game of Battles), 5 "board-wargames" of the Old West/Indian Wars theme (code number from 1456 to 1460 in their catalog).

Each set included soldiers, vehicles and accessories from their HO-scale toy soldiers production, plus a different playing field game-map, related rules and historical introductory notes for every battle.

The game-maps (large pieces of paper of 68 for 68,5x49 cm) were photographs from above of 3D dioramas of hypothetical battlefields of battles represented. On the back of the game-map sheets were shown the assembly diagrams for the parts contained in the package and the game rules, in four languages, with numerous illustrations for clarification. The main fight rules were checkers/chess like: the pieces must enter the enemy squares to eliminate them, with some hierarchical precedencies: e.g. no foot soldiers could eliminate horse-mounted ones. No dice were used anywhere in the games.

From the publisher (Translated):
Fetterman Massacre - December 21, 1866 - n°1459
During the construction of fort Phil Kearney, conceived as a protection of the Bozemann's Track followed by the colonizers, Red Cloud, the chief of the Sioux, besieged the fort and often attacked the soldiers going out to chop wood for the building. Captain Fetterman had often boosted of being able to destroy the Sioux with only hundred men. On occasion of the first sally of his cavalry division in defense of the attacked soldiers he disobeyed Colonel Carrington's order, who, as commandant of the fort, had prohibited from pursuing the Indians. He gave assault, but the Indians let the soldiers pursue them into a gorge where Fetterman and his men were received by about a thousand warriors who killed them all.

RULES
HOW TO START THE GAME
One of the two players keeps the American Army and the other keeps the
Indians. The U.S. Army move first, but initially the soldiers are placed outside the west side of the playing map. The Indians player goes second, but start with his pieces already on the squares on the east border of the map.
HOW TO MOVE
A) On each square the players may place from 1 to a max. of 4 soldiers.
B) Each piece may be moved l square at a time.
C) Each piece may move in a straight line only, never diagonally.
D) Each turn each player can move only the pieces that start the turn on the same square: i.e., at each turn can be moved only the pieces of 1 square (one or more of them).
E) Foot soldiers only (i.e.: no vehicles or horses) may enter the squares where there are houses.
HOW TO ELIMINATE THE ENEMY
A) In order to eliminate the enemy pieces it is necessary to enter the square where they stand.
B) Foot soldiers con eliminate only other foot soldiers (no horse mounted ones).
C) All the enemy pieces in a square are eliminated by entering it.
WHO WINS THE BATTLE
The player who succeeds in eliminating all opposing forces is the winner of the battle.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid

name: Washita River
description:
User summary:
In the year 1977, Atlantic produced, inside their 15 games-line called “Il Gioco delle Battaglie” (The Game of Battles), 5 "board-wargames" of the Old West/Indian Wars theme (code numbers from 1456 to 1460 in their catalog).

Each set included 1/72-HO scale toy soldiers, vehicles and accessories from Atlantic production, plus a different playing field game-map, related rules and historical introductory notes for every battle.

The game-maps (large pieces of paper of 68 for 68,5x49 cm) were photographs from above of 3D dioramas of hypothetical battlefields of the battles represented. On the back of the game-map sheets were shown the assembly diagrams for the parts contained in the package and the game rules, in four languages, with numerous illustrations for clarification.

The main fight rules were checkers/chess like: the player pieces must enter the enemy squares to eliminate his soldiers, with some hierarchical precedencies: e.g. no foot soldiers can eliminate horse-mounted ones. Non dice were used anywhere in the games.

From the publisher (Translated):
Washita River - November 27, 1868
General Phil Sheridan, who commanded the troops of Missouri, carried out many attacks against the hostile Indians. Among his officers there was Lieutenant-colonel George Armstrong Custer, who, out of insubordination, had been reintegrated in a lower rank under Sheridan's orders. On 26th November 1868 Custer set off at the
head of his troops. The day after, at dawn, an Indian village on the Washita River was in view of the division. Custer surrounded the Cheyennes village and ordered the attack and spared nobody: the peaceful Indian tribe whose chief Black Kier had always trusted the whites was fully overwhelmed. It was an awlul massacre and no Indian escaped death. The women and children who escaped the slaughter where taken prisoners.

RULES
HOW TO START THE GAME
One of the two players keeps the Americans and the other keeps the Indians. The American player moves first, but initially the soldiers are placed outside the west side of the playing map. The Indians player goes second, but start with his pieces already on the squares on the east border of the map.
HOW TO MOVE
A) On each square the players may place from 1 to a max. of 4 soldier pieces.
B) Each piece may be moved l square at a time.
C) Each piece may move in a straight line only, never diagonally.
D) Each turn each player can move only the pieces that start the turn on the same square: i.e., at each turn can be moved only the pieces of 1 square (one or more of them).
E) Foot soldiers only (i.e.: no vehicles or horses) may enter the squares where there are houses.
HOW TO ELIMINATE THE ENEMY
A) In order to eliminate the enemy pieces it is necessary to enter the square where they stand.
B) Foot soldiers con eliminate only other foot soldiers (e.g.: no horse mounted ones).
C) All the enemy pieces in a square are eliminated even if only a single adversary piece enter the square.
WHO WINS THE BATTLE
The player who succeeds in eliminating all opposing forces is the winner of the battle.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid

name: Trivia On The Go: T.V. Edition
description: A trivia game including a deck of 50 cards. Each card has questions and answers on them, all multiple choice. Players take turns asking questions and answering. Players getting a correct answer are given the card. The player with the most cards at the end of the game wins.

name: Hitman Holiday: Straw Hat Samurai
description:
"The legends of old spoke of a great samurai who donned no armor. He moved faster than the wind, his sword whistling soundlessly. Because no one knew his ream name, they called him by his most prominent feature - a large straw hat covering his features."

TRAITS: Beauty, Great, Happy, Male

POWER: Once per game at the start of his turn, Straw Hat Samurai may immediately move to any location on the game board. If he does this, his turn ends immediately after placing onto the new location.

The Straw Hat Samurai is a limited edition promotional character who will be printed in VERY limited quantity, and available first to Kickstarter backers as an add-on, after which remaining units (if any) will then be sold at rare conventions worldwide. The add-on bundle comes with his own miniature as well as his set of items to become a playable character in Hitman Holiday.
—description from the publisher

name: Danke für das Rauswerfen
description: Each player has 6 meeples, which he must get from his starting spaces to the 6 numbered home spaces of his color. Each meeple has to move once around the board. Movement is determined by a die. Meeples are brought into play by rolling a 1. The blue spaces on the track are neutral and can hold more than one meeple. On the yellow spaces, meeples can be thrown out. But this is actually a good thing, because they are put on the home spaces of their color. Throwing out is mandatory. If a Player forgets to throw another meeple out, one of the meeples in his home is put back to a starting space. If a meeple is thrown out on the space of his own color in front of his home, the meeple is put back on a starting space. The first player to bring his 6 meeples home wins the game.
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Eil dich!
description: The players start with 6 meeples at the bottom of the game board. Movement is determined by a die. Any meeple that has reached space 25 can advance to a winning space by the apt roll of the die. For instance, on the roll of a 2 it can occupy a "100-space" or on the roll of a 6 the "1000-space". Each winning space con only be occupied by one meeple. The game ends when all winning spaces are occupied or all meeples are on winning spaces. The player with the highest point count wins the game.
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Alpha Bet
description:
In Alpha Bet players take turns writing words in a shared grid. Each player has three copies of the alphabet to draw letters from, plus an additional copy of the alphabet and pool of vowels available to all players.

When a player creates a word they first write it down in a separate area and bet points per letter. Their opponents then write down letters they think will appear in this word and also make per-letter bets. The player will gain the points bet for letters no opponent guesses and lose them for guessed letters; their opponents gain points for correct guesses and lose them for incorrect guesses.

name: Cross-Wordsmith
description:
In Cross-Wordsmith players enter words into a grid. Unlike in most such games each grid space does not contain a letter but a section of a word: a prefix, root, or suffix. Many of the grid spaces are color-coded to show which of the three they must contain, while others can have any section.

A list of allowable sections is provided; on their turn a player chooses at least one of these to add to the grid and marks off all they use (each one can only be used a certain number of times). All adjacent word sections must combine into words, but this does not necessarily have to be done linearly; it is possible to turn corners when forming words.

Each word section has a point value and players score for all words they form on each turn.

A set of three games for two players (hence the title). All are public domain games:

Dots & Dashes is Boxes.
Sting is Jotto.
Maneuvres is Battleship.

name: Side-Swap
description:
Side-Swap is an abstract strategy game with similarities to Checkers. The pieces start on squares of the opposite color and have to cross the board to their home area on the other side, at which time they can move onto squares of their own color; after they do this they cannot move again. All pieces can be jumped and jumps can be chained. Opposing pieces can only be captured once they have moved onto their color spaces.

The game can be played by two players, four players in partnerships, or four players individually. When playing with four the pieces are turned over to show numbers; pieces must end up on the spaces with matching numbers. The four-individuals game has a few extra rules about when pieces of the same color may be captured.
mechanics: Grid Movement, Square Grid, Team-Based Game

name: Steal the Cookie
description:
Do you like gnomes? Do you like cookies?? Then prepare yourself for the most EPIC CARD GAME EVER! Steal the Cookie is a fast paced, intense party card game. The object of the game is to be the last player with the Almighty Cookie in your hand, when the final Cookie Jar Card is drawn.

The game consists of three types of cards... Action cards, Stop Cards, and Interrupt Cards. Each player must use the cards in his hand to prevent the other players from obtaining the cookie. The game is easy to learn, but hard to master. Use all of your skills to overcome your opponents and steal the COOKIE! But watch out! Your opponents have an array of spells and tricks up their sleeve! The object of the game is to be the last player to be holding the Almighty Cookie when the final Cookie Jar card is drawn. The game is fast, simple, and incredibly easy to learn. There are over 20 different card types for endless hours of fun! So grab your friends and family and get ready to STEAL THE COOKIE!
categories: Action / Dexterity, Card Game, Party Game
mechanics: Hand Management, Push Your Luck, Set Collection, Take That

name: Asterix der Gallier
description:
von www.ludorium.at (German)

Lauf/Würfelspiel mit Ereigniskärtchen,

Wer dran ist würfelt beide Würfel, sucht einen für Asterix aus und zieht Asterix. Dann stellt er die Drehscheibe auf die Würfelzahl von Asterix, nun kann Obelix ziehen. Für beide gelten die in den Löchern neben den Feldern auftauchenden Ereignisse, wenn die Figuren auf einem zum Loch gehörigen Feld stehen. Am Ende gibt es Punkte für die Reihenfolge des Zieleinlaufs und für gesammelte Gegenstände von Zaubertrank bis Hinkelstein.

Lauf/Würfelspiel * 2-4 Spieler ab 5 Jahren * * 601/2820, Noris, Deutschland * noris SPIELE * Georg Reulein GmbH & Co KG



from page www.ludorium.at (Google translation)Running / dice game with cards Event,
You roll the die both dice, looking for a made for Asterix and pulls Asterix. Then he asks the hub to the dice number of Asterix, Obelix now can pull. For both the emerging in the holes next to the fields Events apply if the figures are on a the hole associated field. At the end, there are points for the order of finish and collected items of potion to menhir.

Running / dice game * 2-4 players, ages 5 * 601/2820, Noris, Germany * noris GAMES * Georg Reulein GmbH & Co KG
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement

name: Aufschwung Ost: Würfelspiel für Investoren
description:
Google translation:
From game rules

Goal of the game:
Purchase as many properties. But winning is not who has acquired the most extensive possessions but who could invest the most.

Components:
1 Schedule
2 cubes (W6)
4 two-piece pawns
250 Game notes
32 Sector Cards
32 Trust Cards
23 property cards
25 "Investit" -washers
6 1-DM-coin (not included, shall be settled before the beginning of game)


Aus der Spielregel (German)

Ziel des Spiels:
Erwerben Sie möglichst viele Liegenschaften. Sieger ist aber nicht, wer den umfangreichsten Besitz erworben hat, sondern wer am meisten investieren konnte.

Spielmaterial:
1 Spielplan
2 Würfel (W6)
4 zweiteilige Spielfiguren
250 Spielgeldscheine
32 Sektorenkarten
32 Treuhandkarten
23 Liegenschaftskarten
25 "Investit"-Scheiben
6 1-DM-Münze (nicht enthalten, sind vor Spielanfang beizulegen)
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement

name: The Road To Berlin! Feb-Apr 1945
description:
From the cover:


Mission: Capture Berlin before the Americans/British!
Method: Massive ground assault from Oder Bridgehead
Ground Conditions: Mud
Enemy Strength: Fanatical Nazis, SS troops and Volksturm. Resistance cannot last beyond a few days. Morale seems to be good despite other reports.
Fuel situation critical. Ammunition limited. We will bury the Nazis.


This is a division-level game of the final Soviet drive on Berlin. The scale is two miles per hex and three or five days per turn (three in April, five earlier).

The game contains an 11"x17" map (on two sheets) and approximately 160 counters.

name: Utopia City
description:
From the designer:

Create your city and be the best mayor in the history over the 4 years (4 rounds in each year)! Set goals, fulfill promises, create your strategy and grow your city while maintaining the best levels of education, health, sustainability (ecology), security, entertainment and economy.

Each player purchases (with cash) Construction Tiles (houses, apartments, hospitals, cinemas, schools, industries etc) which will enhance the different levels of your city (security, health, education etc).

With high levels the player can complete Goal Cards that he acquired during rounds and also complete the requests of the television media (media cards), earning more points mayor and approval of the population. Implement projects (through project cards) can also help gain mayor points, gain approval of the population and increase the city levels.

To buy Construction Tiles, Goal Cards and Projects Cards, each player uses his meeples (city hall employees). Throughout the game, new meeples may be hired.

At the end of each year, players must have high approval of the population to gain even more Mayor Points. At the end of 4 years, which has more points Mayor is the winner!

From the designer (Portuguese):

Construa a sua cidade e seja o melhor prefeito da história ao longo de 4 anos (4 rodadas em cada ano)! Estabeleça metas, cumpra promessas, crie sua estratégia e faça crescer a sua cidade, mantendo os melhores níveis de educação, saúde, sustentabilidade (ecologia), segurança, lazer e economia.

Cada jogador compra com dinheiro Tiles de Construção (casas, apartamentos, hospitais, cinemas, escolas, indústrias etc.) que irão aumentar os diferentes níveis de sua cidade (segurança, saúde, educação etc.).

Com os níveis elevados, o jogador poderá completar Cartas de Objetivo que ele adquiriu durante as rodadas e também concluir as solicitações da mídia de televisão (cartões de mídia), ganhando mais pontos de prefeito e aprovação da população. Implementar projetos (através de cartões de projetos) também pode ajudar a ganhar pontos de prefeito, obter a aprovação da população e aumentar os níveis da cidade.

Para comprar tiles de construção, cartões de objetivos e cartões de projetos, cada jogador usa seus meeples (funcionários da prefeitura). Durante o jogo, novos meeples podem ser contratados.

No final de cada ano, os jogadores devem ter alta de aprovação da população para ganhar ainda mais pontos de prefeito. No final de 4 anos, que tiver mais pontos de prefeito é o vencedor!

name: Imperium Chronicles Combat Card Game
description:
The Imperium Chronicles Combat Card Game is an easy-to-understand, fast-paced game between two players. Players alternate between being the Attacker and the Defender, each using a Unit Card and multiple Modifier Cards each round. The winner of each round earns a point and the first player to reach 10 points wins the game.

Note: You only need to buy ONE deck for BOTH players to play! A single deck includes everything you need for two players!
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Open Drafting, Push Your Luck

name: Mishmash Galaxy
description:
Mishmash Galaxy is a light strategy game of long-term planning, memorization and card management in which you combine made-believe substances to complete and construct the staples of SF technologies! Make clichés and tropes come to life as you struggle to create FTL drives, time machines, portals and laser weaponry!

The goal of the game is to be the player with the most victory points! Players can earn victory points mostly by completing technologies; whenever a technology is completed, all contributors get the minor score of that technology, and if there is a major contributor, that player earns the major score. On a turn, a player can execute two actions, none of which are obligatory. The actions are:

• Play a Research Card: A player can put one of their Substance Card face down in front of them. At the beginning of their next turn, this card is revealed and its research ability is activated. Then the card should be discarded. You can never have more than one active Research Card.

• Contribute to a Technology: Each player can contribute a card from their hand to two different Technologies. Any card can be contributed (Ingredient or Substance) as long as the resource of the card are correct with the resources needed in that Technology stage. Each Technology is being filled in order of their blueprint, from left to right. You play the cards face down and place your ownership token on the card. Resolving the Technology works as below:


All cards on the Technology are revealed.
Cards are then activated from right to left. Owner of the card is the one who resolves the card Technology ability.


The game ends when all Technologies prepared for the game are completed.

name: Control Tower: LAX Airport
description:
From the designer:

Control Tower: LAX Airport is a family boardgame about the management of the planes in an airport.
The players are air controllers who must land and take off the planes and distribute those planes in the diferent areas of the airport like repair/maintenance garage or refuelling to satisfice their requeriments.

The game is based on Control Tower with new mechanism.
The players share the LAX Airport while in Control Tower each player manage his own airport. This change makes different feelings between both games.

Control Tower: LAX Airport is an addictive boargame for 2 to 5 players, with easy rules but complex making decisions.

From the designer (Spanish):

"Torre de Control" es un juego de mesa familiar sobre la gestión de aviones en un aeropuerto.
Los jugadores encarnan a controladores aéreos de la gestión interna de un aeropuerto y entre sus funciones están ordenar los aterrizajes y despegues de los aviones y las distribución de los aviones en los diferentes servicios del aeropuerto tales como repostaje y reparación y mantenimiento.

El juego esta basado en "Torre de Control" pero con nuevas mecánicas. En esta versión los jugadores tienen un único aeropuerto común a diferencia de la anterior versión que cada jugador tenia el suyo propio. Este cambio hace que ambas versiones transmitan unas sensaciones de juego totalmente diferentes.

"Torre de control: Aeropuerto LAX" es un juego adictivo de 2 a 5 jugadores, de reglas muy sencillas pero con mucha toma de decisiones.

name: Mother Truckers
description:
Mother Truckers is a CB jaw-jackin', blacktop fast-trackin', madcap dash across 1970s America for 2-4 players. The goal of the game is for your female trucker to make a name for herself by being the first to gain 12 Fame Points and show the boys you can outhaul, outdrive, and outwit every other gearjammer on the road. Put the hammer down as you pick up Commodities and deliver them to cities that demand them for Fame. Earn Action cards for your accomplishments and use them to dominate the highway as you become a truck driving legend! Just be sure to steer clear of old smokey...

On each turn, a player rolls the Movement Die and optionally the Speeding Die if they wish to attempt speeding. Speeding can allow for an extra Movement point per turn, but can cause wasted fuel trying to avoid the cops if they catch you.

The player may then split their Movement between physically moving road spaces on the map, refueling, and picking up or dropping off loads in cities. Each road space costs 10% fuel and players are towed to the connected city of another player's choice if they run out of fuel.

Contracts offer incentives to deliver certain types of goods or travel to specific regions for bonus Fame. Action cards spice up the game by creating risky scenarios for extra Fame such as Bar Brawls and Street Chicken. Or, play devious deeds against your opponents such as shooting out their gas tanks and stealing their loads. Naturally, all cards are flavored with classic 1970s CB jargon.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Pick-up and Deliver, Take That, Variable Phase Order

name: Értem a pénzem
description: The players are collectors of old money, and their aim is to collect more and more coins, old bank notes, bills, and assemble a valuable collection of them. They can also sell these collections throughout the game, to make an extra profit by the end of the game. The player who knows the most about the acquired art treasure's historical background, can make lavish benefits quickly, but who has less knowledge can also get one copy released for auction, with the help of an expert. Knowledge or tactics may prove better? Whoever collects the most forints by the end of the game, will be the most succesful numismatic and the winner of the game. The game was created with educational purpose, and its aim is to present and teach Hungarian history. Every thesis has five questions, specific fot that era, which must be answered correctly to win the subject of auction. If someone doesn't know the correct answer for the question, he/she can hire the other players as experts, who will get payment for the right answer from the principal. The biggest income can be reached by selling collections during the game.

name: Fuba
description: This game simulates a soccer game. The player who manages to get the ball into the goal of his oppenent wins the game. Movement of the pawns is determined by a die. The moving pawns kick the ball forward and end their movement one space behind the ball. One space can hold more than one pawn and the ball.
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Leprechauns: Disle Dubh
description:
Leprechauns Disle Dubh (Black Dice) Expansion adds a bit of light headedness and passing out to your game of Leprechauns. Just add the single black die to your game bag and have a laugh when your opponent is rudely interrupted.

Disle Dubh adds one 6 sided dice to your game of Leprechauns. Two of the faces on the die have new game rules. One called Pass out which stops the players turn immediately and Light Headed which causes a player to start his turn over.
categories: Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Humor, Party Game

name: Castle Bridge
description:
From the box:

The original Five Suit Game.

Official American Rules for Five Suit Castle Bridge.

Originated 1933 by Ammiel F. Decker

name: Einer freut sich immer
description:
Each player has a set of four pawns that start in his or her side of the board. The goal is to move the pawns around the board to the "Ziel" section. Movement is determined by a die. All players move clockwise around the same board, so they may capture each others pawns. Whenever a pawn arrives on a space as the result of a die-roll, it advances by the number of spaces shown on that space. If a pawn arrives on a red space, it advances into an inner ring. The pawns have to circle the innermost ring, till they manage to enter their "Ziel" section. Captured pawns are returned to their player's "Start" section. The winner is the first player to move all pawns into the "Ziel" section.
This game was published about 1930.
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: WizArt
description:
From the publisher:

WizArt is a strategy card game for 2-3 players where you try to acquire knowledge from 3 different magic schools (the cosmic, the elemental or the temporal) in order to graduate as a mage faster than your opponents. To win the game, you must play cards and invest knowledge crystals. If you played well, you will then be able to level up at the beginning of your turn and acquire more power. Depending on the cards that you play, you will be able to use crystals of your opponents. If you reach mage level 5 or if you have eliminated all other players, you win.

WizArt is an exciting strategy card game with a lot of player interaction which is easy to learn but hard to master. It takes about 30 minutes to play and is suitable for players who are 8 years or older.

name: Ecken-Schreck!
description:
The players have to move their pawn from the starting point to one of the yellow or red spaces in the center of the game board. The red and yellow dice determine movement on the game track, while the green symbol die controls movement on the checkered center section by one or two spaces each turn. The results of the yellow and red dice are translated by each player's dice result card. Possible outcomes are forward movement (V), backward movement (Z) or no movement at all (Symbol).

The Corner spaces have the following meanings:
V - move forward to the next red triangle
Z - move backward to the last yellow triangle
Symbol - miss your next turn
black spot - return to the black starting space

The game was likely published in the 1920s.
mechanics: Grid Movement, Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Hans im Glück
description: Each player has to move his 16 meeples from his starting positions around the game board and over his launching pad (the five spaces of his own color) to the blue "luck" space at the center of the game board. Movement is done one space along the black lines or by jumping over other meeples, regardles if they're own or opponent ones. Each meeple reaching it's own launching pad, immediately goes to the "luck" space and is taken out of the game. The first player to get all his meeples on the "luck" space wins the game.

name: Monster Hunter Academy
description:
A monstrous board game encouraging kids & families to have imaginative fun with game play imaginative interaction!

A classic dungeon setting is the backdrop as players assume the roles of tough hunters bound and determined to do three things: to defeat as many monsters as possible, to collect treasure, and to make it out unscathed.

Players become bona fide monster hunters as they delve into dungeons filled with beasts and obstacles. At the beginning of each session, players choose one of three game modes in which they will compete. Treasure Hunt, Monster Hunt, or Dungeon Escape.

At the beginning of each session, players choose one of three game modes in which they will compete:

Treasure Hunt – Be the first to get to the treasure

Monster Hunt – Defeat all the monsters on the board, player with the most captured wins

Dungeon Escape – Be the first player to get to the finish exit

Up to 4 boards can be arranged in numerous ways based on the number of players. Obstacle tiles including corridors, pits, locked doors, and secret doors are added to the boards. The number depends on the game mode being played. Monsters are then added to the board.

Each player rolls a d10 for movement through squares that make up the dungeon boards. When they get to obstacles they must make an extra roll to get past them. Sometimes loosing a turn, or having to turn around and find another path. When players encounter monsters they must reference the Monster's card to see how to defeat them. Examples are an opposing roll of the the die, rolling an odd number, rolling 7 or higher.

name: Saami
description: Saami is a semi-cooperative game in which players need to eliminate threats while trying to improve their own personal position in the game.

name: Schnell ins Nest
description: The players have to move their four cubes from the diagonaly opposite corner to the nest of their color. Movement to a neighboring space is achieved by tilting the cube by 90 degree, thereby changing the Image on the top of the cube. The movement can be continued in a straight line as Long as thre are unoccupied spaces. If two cubes are sitting next to or pass each other, the stronger image kills the weeker one (hunter - Fox - weasel - chicken - frog - gnat). The strongest Image is the hunter but he can be killed by the weakest, which is the gnat. Killed cubes are removed from the game. Cubes that have entered their own nest must show the correct animal on top to be saved. A saved animal counts 3 points and the cubes on the board of the last player count 2 points at the end of the game.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Animals, Children's Game, Racing

name: Mostly Evil
description:
From their Evil Lairs / Parent's basement players rule Cityopolis by fear, defeating wave after wave of superheroes with their diabolical creations! Who will defeat the most heroes and rein supreme... from jail when they get caught because... well... Superheroes are awesome like that.

Players get a hand of cards from which they will play or discard 2 per turn. For example minions, like Florence 'Hard Nut' McGee, could be placed on the field and players can start to create fiendishly clever weapons like the Poisonous Death Lamp. Alternatively they could play event cards such as the "Publish a photo of your rival stroking a Kitten" to reduce the fear gripping the city. Finally they could get bored and call up a Superhero to help the city... Then later use them for target practise. Superheroes start a set distance from the City and move closer after every round. If they reach the city they start to reduce the fear count which acts as the game timer.

Reducing fear and calling up Superheroes nets players kudos worth VP's at the end but defeating Superheroes earns you Capes which are worth more VP's and after all you are Mostly Evil.

name: BuySellorHold?
description:
BuySellorHold? is an intelligent and fun-filled action-packed game of strategy that helps players to learn about the Stock Market in an enjoyable and stimulating way.

Throughout the game, share prices move after Government announcements, world news and company statements, and you will have to decide what to do. Real-life events such as buying a house, tax refunds and work bonuses also make a difference, as does luck, since the throw of a die changes share prices for all players.

Three types of game:


The Introductory Game – the basic game, simplified with fewer features to help people get more familiar with the game.



The Beginners' Game – the addition of a few more features such as share dealing from outside investors, 'Life' events and portfolio valuations during the game.



The Advanced Game – this option takes the game to the next level, and is ideally suited to people who have got to grips with the game and are looking for the ultimate challenge.
mechanics: Commodity Speculation, Roll / Spin and Move, Stock Holding

name: Travel Olympic Challenge
description:
From the rules:
Two people or a carload take the Olympic Trivia challenge. Test your knowledge by competing head-to-head with family and friends. Learn how the Olympic Movement inspires everyone around the world in friendly competition.

User summary:
In Travel Olympic Challenge, players take turns choosing a category of Olympic trivia (such as countries or events). The player must then choose to try for a bronze, silver or gold medal. The player is then read a question by another player. If trying for gold, the player must answer with no hints. For silver, the player must choose an answer from three choices. For bronze, only two choices are offered. A correct question wins the medal, which is marked on a scorecard. A player's turn ends after a correct or incorrect answer.

On subsequent turns, players may upgrade medals already won by answering another question from the same level already won (e.g. a second silver medal in a category upgrades the player to gold in that category). The first player to win a gold medal in all five categories wins.

To shorten the game, it may be played with a certain number of rounds or a time limit. In this case, gold, silver and bronze medals score 3, 2 and 1 points, respectively. The player with the most points wins.

name: Autumn Ants
description:
The ants scurry through the grass as the summer sun shines down. Suddenly, a leaf comes crashing down amidst the hustle and the bustle. The ants stare in disbelief, for they know what that means.

Winter is coming.
