With a wary glance, the ants retreat to their respective clans. The fast approach of winter means food must be gathered, and as every ant knows, the clan that gathers the most food holds all the power in the Colony. The race is on! Who will come out on top before the chill of winter sets in?

Autumn Ants is a game where 2 to 4 players take control of a clan of ants competing for control of their Colony. Using a system of dice selection, players will explore the unknown meadow, gather seeds, build dirt walls to hold back their competitors, and maybe even build shrines to gain the blessings of their Ant-cestors! Hurry though, since winter comes sooner than any ant would like...

In Autumn Ants, players move their ant pawns around a randomly generated world, growing their ant colony to try to out compete their fellow players. Each round, dice are rolled and each player will select one die. This die will decide both turn order and a special action that can be used that round. The player with the most food tokens brought back to their ant hill at game end will be the winner!

name: Ronde van de Langstraat
description:
A trivia-game in which you throw two dice in your turn. You move your pawn the number op pips on the dice and answer a question from the topcard of the deck in the color of the place your pawn is on. The player on your left asks the question.
There are 5 categories:
orange = general
blue = architecture
red = culture/sports
purple = economics/geography
green = history
yellow = free choice of category

When you answer the question right, you get a marker of the color of the question asked. You now may throw the dice again for another turn. You can only ever have one marker of each color. When your pawn gets to a color you already have a marker for, just answer the question but no further markers are earned.

When you answer the question wrong, your turn is over and the player to your left is the next player to throw the dice.

When you reach the finish (spot 160) you have to have collected a marker of each category. The other players decide in which category your final quaetion is asked. When aswering right you win and when aswering wrong you get another shot next turn.

name: Safari Fun
description: Safari Fun is a children's spin-and-move board game given away at McDonald's restaurants. The game consists of a single sheet of thick paper with various punch-out elements that serve as the spinner, game pieces and 3-dimensional scenery. Play is standard for this type of game, with players moving along a track from start to finish, with some spaces that may move them forward or backward or cause gain or loss of a turn. Some spaces also call for the player to complete an action such as waving arms to chase away flies or pretending to swim across a river. Others feature animal facts. The first player to reach the finish wins.

name: Diamonds In A Neighborhood
description:
User summary:
隣接のダイヤ (Rinsetsu no Daiya) is 'Diamonds In A Neighborhood' in English.

Diamonds in a Neighborhood is a territory-occupation game for two players, which uses traditional playing cards. Players are assigned one of two sides, Spades or Hearts, which is determined by auction results. They try to score points by taking Diamonds, Clubs, and honor cards. This game is handed out as an added bonus when purchasing a Garden Games product at the Tokyo Game Market Spring 2016.

Publisher summary:
トランプで遊ぶ２人対戦陣取りゲームです。プレイヤーはスペード陣営かハート陣営となりますが、どちらの陣営を担当するかはオークションで決定します。取得されるダイヤ、クラブ、絵札が得点になります。このゲームは2016春のゲームマーケットのガーデンゲームズのおまけとして配られる予定です。
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Auction/Bidding, Modular Board
publishers: ガーデンゲームズ (The Garden Games)

name: The Longest Night for Detectives
description:
User summary:
探偵たちの長い夜 (Tantei Tati no Nagai Yoru) in English literally means The Longest Night for Detectives.

In this game, players are detectives staying in a cottage on a snowy mountain, and a murder happens there. Players have to find out the truth of the murder within a limited time. The game is for three players only.

Victory condition
Before the game ends, players must identify the victim, scene, method, and criminal who committed the murder. The first successful player(s) scores one point. Play three games and the highest scorer is the grand champion.

Investigation and deduction
Each turn, you name a person, method, and scene, and see whether other players have those cards or not. Other players place the named cards in front of them face down. You may see the identity of only one of them. Repeat this process until you are sure which cards involved in the murder (not in any player's hand), then record your answer secretly.

Publisher's summary:
◇概要
雪の山荘でおきた殺人事件をゲーム化したものです。
殺された人物と殺した人物が分からないという状況にあります。
プレイヤーは探偵となり、事件の真相を制限時間内に突き止めます。
◇勝利条件
伏せられた4種類、5枚のカードを全て言い当てられたら勝ちです。
3回遊んで1番多くの勝利コインを集めたプレイヤーが優勝します。
（被害者：2枚、殺害場所：1枚、凶器：1枚、犯人：1枚）
◇調査と推理
調査パートで「人物・凶器・場所」を探り、推理パートで披露します。

name: Minifig Melee
description:
Minifig Melee is a miniature-based board game with fun set-up, fast game-play, and awesome miniatures.

In Minifig Melee, players lead teams of minifig heroes in an epic battle, facing off against the other players and the various dangers & monsters controlled by the game.

Players attempt to gain victory points by gathering treasures & items as well as defeating the other player's heroes while navigating obstacles and completing missions.

Players build teams, manage actions, roll dice, and execute on strategies & tactics.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: Glory for France!: A Solitaire Game of the Napoleonic Wars (1803-1815).
description:
BACKGROUND: GLORY FOR FRANCE is semi-historical simulation of the Napoleonic Wars at the dawn of the 19th Century. The Game begins in 1803, shortly after Napoleon Bonaparte seized power from the French Directory. The French are building up their forces and gathering their fleets in order to expand their Empire and spread the glory of France to neighboring Territories. In the meantime, those neighboring Territories are forming various Coalitions to halt the French Invasions.

OBJECTIVE: As the Commander of the French Naval and Land Forces, you must gather your Army and Naval Forces to conquer the surrounding Territories. Territories are conquered by capturing all of their Key Settlements. Each Territory has a Victory Point (VP) Value if Conquered. The Player must attempt to conquer as many Territories as possible before the last Campaign Card is Played.

GAME FEATURES: GLORY FOR FRANCE includes many, many colorful Game Counters for both Army and Naval Forces. All the Key Arms of a Napoleonic Army are featured including Infantry, Artillery, Grenadiers, Dragoons, Hussars and Cuirassiers. Naval Forces feature 1st, 2nd, 3rd and 4th Rate Ships of the Line. Combat includes Land Battles, Attacks on Forts and Naval Battles.

GLORY FOR FRANCE can be found at the following URL:
http://www.berserkergames.net
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid

name: The Joke's End
description: The Joke's End is a card-game where you play cards, tell a piece of a story using whatever is on the card and follow what is written on the card. Everyone draws and plays one card each turn and goes along with the game, making up pieces of the story on the fly. However, whenever someone draws the Joker Card, drawing cards is disabled, even if cards says so and whoever depletes their hand first and then endures one more round afterwards, wins.
categories: Adventure, Card Game, Fantasy, Medieval, Print & Play

name: Farmland
description:
Your farm is in big trouble, predator animals are rooming in the nearby woods. They have you and your neighbors farm animals insight, try to be the last farmer standing.

Each player will start of with four animals, these are the players life. The starting player will draw three cards from the pile of cards in the middle of the game, all the cards have to be played. These cards mostly focuses on killing of the opponents animals or steal their animals. The goal of the game is to get rid of every other player's animals.

name: Epic Explorers
description:
From the publisher:

There's an ancient relic used to be occupied by 3 groups of creature. Today, sons of the great legend have returned. Reclaim the legacy of ancestors and capture the relic, you'll be the legend!
Players are required to place 8 District cards at least on the table to win the game. Each player has to draw cards at the beginning of the turn and there's only one District card can be played each turn. Everyone can either play a Attack card to destroy District of others' or play a Trap/Spell card to protect the District card.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Card Game, Fantasy, Fighting, Print & Play, Territory Building
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Hand Management, Secret Unit Deployment, Take That, Variable Player Powers

name: Cheese Burglers
description:
Who'd want to be a mouse? There's so little cheese around, and mousetraps are everywhere!
Not only that, enemy mice are afoot, armed to the teeth with crossbows, plasma grenades, shotguns, flamethrowers, bazookas, evil space lasers and a host of special powers!
In the fast-paced card game Cheese Or Die, players take on the role of mice competing to horde the most cheese, whilst arming up in a bid to steal cheese from their opponents. Will you take your chances and draw from the Cheese Deck - a deck which becomes increasingly 'dangerous' as the game goes on - or play the long game by collecting weapons and bonuses, and smashing your rivals in combat?

To win, you'll need to be ruthless and pick your fights carefully.
Oh, and avoid proximity mines...

In Cheese Or Die, the first player to collect 6 cheese cards wins... but this can be difficult! To do this, players can attack opponents by choosing a weapon card from their hand, adding any bonuses, and playing any number of special cards on top. Expect brutal fights with lots of surprises! Special cards allow you to alter the normal victory conditions of the game, or mess with your opponents' combat total, for example. Only if attackers win can they draw a card from the defender's cheese cards. Just don't draw a mine!

There's also the Cheese Deck, which has its own dynamics. Players can take a chance and draw directly from this deck, or set traps for their opponents by looking ahead and loading the deck.

All in all this is a fast, fun and tense card game that provides some hilarious moments!
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Take That

name: Retrato Falado
description:
From the publisher:

"Seguindo a descrição da testemunha, a polícia faz um retrato falado. Com base nele, o detetive detém os suspeitos para averiguações e tenta prender o culpado. Não é interessante? Em RETRATO FALADO isto é ainda mais, já que às vezes você é o detetive, outras a testemunha e até o desenhista da polícia. Não é um desafio?"

Or, in a free translation:

"Following the description of the witness, the police makes a police sketch. Based on it, the detective holds the suspects for questioning and attempts to arrest the culprit. Isn't it interesting? In RETRATO FALADO this is even more, since you are sometimes the detective, other times you are the witness and even the police artist. Isn't it a challenge?"

In Retrato Falado, a cooperative game for only three people, one person - the witness - will try to memorize some cards with faces drawings and then make a police sketch of one randomly selected card (without seeing). A second player - the police artist - will "draw" the face described using the tiles representing eyes, nose, mouth, etc. Finally, the third player - the detective - will try to find out what was the card that the witness described. If he chooses correctly, everyone scores.

name: MiniSkull Caverns
description:
In MiniSkull Caverns, 1-3 heroes will compete to explore the caverns beneath the ruins of MiniSkull Castle and return with riches beyond their wildest dreams. You are one of those optimistic explorers. Are you prepared to risk your life for diamonds the size of a wild boar? Along the way you will encounter monsters, battle other heroes, and recover some priceless gems. Be careful though, the more noise you make, the more you will attract the deadly denizens of MiniSkull Caverns. Before you can escape with your spoils you must battle the affectionately, though unsuitably, named Tiny. Dragons don’t like it when you try to burgle their baubles.

Object: The object of MiniSkull Caverns is to guide your hero through the maze of caverns, managing your strength, and battling monsters and other heroes, all while searching for priceless Gems. Once you have acquired two of these Gems you must return to the center space on the map and battle Tiny in order to escape.

2 Player Variant: When playing with two players you must defeat Tiny and escape with three gems instead of two.

Solo Variant: Collect all four gems and escape before time runs out.

Mechanics: The mechanics use a combination of action selection using a rotating action card and player selection control card, similar to what is in Empire Engine, along with straight up dice combat against monsters and PvP dice combat with strategic modifiers the players
choose.
categories: Adventure, Exploration, Fantasy, Fighting, Print & Play
mechanics: Action Queue, Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Modular Board, Pick-up and Deliver

name: Little Storm on Holiday
description: Little Storm on Holiday is a children's game. Each player has a holiday board. One player after the other draws a tile, and the tile goes to the player who has the picture on there board. First player to get four tiles on their board is the winner. The theme in the game is different kinds of bicycles, cars, aircraft, ships and buses.

name: War of the Races
description:
War of the Races is a fast-paced card game that is fun, easy to learn and extremely strategic.

5 armies - Orcs, Humans, Elves, Dwarves and Demons - fight for supremacy in the ancient kingdom of Erathmor. Command your armies, send out troops, utilize heroes, sorcerers and more to eliminate opposing armies and leave your mark in history with the War of the Races.

Each race is sold as a separate deck of cards, each with unique abilities and advantages. Players send out infantry to attack opposing armies or the King, who start with 50 and 5 health, respectively. The infantry consist of soldiers, archers, rogues, guards and fighters. These cards can be enhanced with special spells. In addition, a guard can be used to prevent that card from being easily defended against. Next, players send out their sorcerers, who utilize water, earth and fire spells to attack the opposing armies. Other players must counter with other sorcerers, creating a simple but effective 'rock, paper, scissors' effect! Lastly, heroes are sent the field, each with unique abilities, such as healing the army, reflecting any opposing attack back to the dealer, calling for reinforcements and more. Strategy cards are also used to take opposing soldiers as enemies, revive your King, and more.

The last army to remain wins the War of the Races!

name: Little Storm playes hide'n'seek
description: Little Storm playes hide'n'seek is a children's game. Each player has a board. One player after the other draws a tile, and the tile goes to the player who has the picture on there board. First player to get four tiles on their board is the winner. The theme in the game is Little Storm pictures in houses or behind trees etc, with focus on the child's understanding of prepositions: over, under, next to, in front of and behind.

name: Gæt & Form med Storm
description: Gæt & Form med Storm is a children's cooperation game. The players must jump, sing, stand on one leg, and more, while the players gamepartner shapes figures in plasticine. The longer the player can keep on the longer the mate can shape. Then the player must guess what this figure is, and if the player do not guess correctly the other team may try. 2 cunning jokers and a memory game like concept gives the game a strategic dimension and also tests memory.

name: Storm på Ordet
description: Storm på Ordet is children's word game. By moving on the board and draw cards, the played can get the mission to say sausage while you blow, make the sound of a helicopter, put together words in a fun way, or even make foot gymnastics. One point for each mission completed. The player with most points at the end of the game is the winner.

name: The Game of Divorce
description:
Attention golddiggers! As you move your piece from start to finish on the board, you accumulate and discard husbands, always keeping track of your growing liquid cash assets (a tiny calculator and note paper is included in the box). Sometimes, you get to roll to steal other players' husbands. When possible, sink your liquid assets into real estate and businesses, in case a divorce goes wrong and you are the one who loses your shirt. Along the way, you land on "Up" or "Down" spaces which provide windfalls or disasters that affect your net worth. Once everyone has reached the finish space, everyone tallies up their total net worth and the one with the most money wins.

From game description: Up to 6 players. Each player begins with a zero balance in their bank accounts. Using the custom dice included in this game, each player takes turns moving their number of spaces around the board. The object is to become the richest by collecting Men, Homes & Businesses. Battle it out with your friends to see who will become the wealthiest. Travel around the game board trying your luck at earning great riches while dealing with the rewards and pitfalls of real life. Marry men, buy homes and collect businesses to end up the wealthiest player. The Game of Divorce is an absolute must to add to your board game collection. For entertainment purposes only.
categories: Economic, Humor, Mature / Adult, Party Game

name: Silantra: the game
description:
Silantra: the game, is a 1-4 player cooperative trick taking card game inspired by the restaurant Silantra. In Silantra, you play as chefs in a kitchen serving customers their favorite entrees. As customers are fed, they reveal their special powers scoring you more points and abilities!
To feed customers, you and the other chefs take turns playing ingredient cards from your hand to match what your customers want to eat, which is displayed on the front of the card. After feeding the customers, you flip the card over and activate their special power and continue drawing more cards and feeding more customers! Good luck on your first wave of customers.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Hand Management, Open Drafting, Set Collection

name: Bux!
description:
Each player has 16 playing pieces: 7 hunters, 4 catchers, 2 scouts, 2 squires and 1 bux-master. The goal of the game is to capture the opponent bux-master. The hunters move up to 2 spaces, the catchers up to 3 spaces, the scout up to 4 spaces, the bux-master and his squires 1 space (no jumping over other pieces allowed). If pieces of both payers are on three connected spaces in a straight line, the minority piece is eliminated from play unless it is able to escape in the next turn.

There are rules for 2 variants included:

Buxelkuh: One cow has to break through a line of 9 peasants and 1 mayor. The latter try to trap the cow.

Buxtehu: The players try to get all 16 playing pieces to the opposite end of the game board. Each time a player gets one of his pieces to a space at the other end of the board, he may take one or more enemy pieces off the board. The game ends if all 11 spaces at one end of the board are occupied or if there ar no more pieces on the board. The player with the most captured pieces wins the game.

name: Infantry Assault: 1944 the Western Front
description:
First volume of Infantry Assault

Infantry Assault is a skirmish game between 2-4 players on various fields of battle. The objectives are varied and include a campaign which can be separated into several scenarios if you wish.

The major asset of Infantry Assault is to provide a fluid game system with ease of access, to share the fun of miniature games with family and friends, and for people outside of the hobby to discover the pleasure of the game. The simplicity of the game is thanks to a unique and ingenious system, this will keep the tactical advantage of this type of game, implementing a storyline. In campaign mode, the winner will be the player who gains the more points at the end but there is no obligation to play each scenario in an orderly manner.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Variable Phase Order

name: Guardians of Artural
description:
Dungeon crawler with large amounts of Massive Multiplayer Online influences. Characters will have multiple specializations. There will be quests to complete, dungeons to explore, as well as large raids you can complete. All while playing solo or with your friends and family.

You use actions, to move your character around a map, while using dice, and playing cards to kill the enemy's. Receive loot cards to increase your characters abilities and gear to progress through the campaign.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Modular Board, Role Playing, Variable Player Powers

name: Splashdown
description:
In this survival co-op, you and your crewmates find yourselves in the middle of an ocean on an alien world after a mishap during interstellar travel.

In 30 days a planet-wide storm will knock out all communications. You need to find three islands and repair the rescue beacons that were launched when your spacecraft was destroyed.

During your exploration you are as likely to find unwelcoming creatures as helpful items.

Decide how to use your stats, abilities, and dice allocation to face these challenges, and the challenge of propelling your watercraft through this ocean, and activate the distress signal. Otherwise, you will likely suffer the fate of this planet's previous inhabitants.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Modular Board

name: Heretik Chess
description:
Heretik is a chess variant in which cards are used to improve abilities and undermine opponents. Unlike other chess card games, Heretik makes chess more elaborate without sacrificing the strategic elements of regular chess.

Heretik begins like regular chess, but players draw a card after each move. These cards may be played, declared, or discarded to move in new ways, move multiple pieces at once, or even push your enemies off the edge of the board.

There are sixty unique cards available to download from the website. Playing Heretik requires two copies of each card and a regular chess set. You may also need extra pieces and pawns (or tokens to represent them), and a couple of small rocks that can be placed on the squares.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Medieval, Print & Play

name: Emil und die Detektive
description:
The thief starts at the hotel and tries to reach the train station to win the game. The 6 kid detectives start at various spaces on the board and have to try to trap the thief so that he can't move. The kid detective who makes the last move to trap the thief wins the game. Movement is one space per turn.

Another version is called "Achtung! Feind hört mit", where the hunted game piece is a spy.
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Novel-based

name: HexGo
description:
HexGo is played on a hexagon tiled by equilateral triangles.(see picture below) A corner of one of these triangles is called a "house". A side of one of these triangles is called a "street".

During the game, stones are placed on houses. Player-I places black stones, while player-II places white stones. The opening move should be decided by "swapping": one person decides where the opening move will go, and then his opponent chooses whether to make the opening move or not.

Linking Families

A "family" is a group of stones of the same color, such that you can travel along streets between any two stones in the group, without visiting an unoccupied house or an enemy stone.
Label the six sides of the hexagonal board as A, B, C, D, E, and F, in the clockwise order in which they appear, and group them in the following three pairs: A with B, C with D, E with F.

A family "links" one of these pairs, say A and B, if members of that family occupy a house on side A as well as a house on side B. Any houses inside the region surrounded by side A, side B, and a family linking A and B are "dominated" by that family.

Forbidden Moves

You may not place a stone on a house if it would be impossible to add more stones to the board to make the first stone part of a family linking one of the three pairs of sides, without removing some enemy stones. Also, you may not place a stone in any region dominated by an enemy family.

Capturing

If you make a move which blocks some enemy stones from linking any of the three pairs of sides, then those enemy stones are removed from the board. If you make a move which links any of the three pairs of sides, then any enemy stones in houses which are now dominated by some of your families are removed from the board.

End Game

"Territory" is defined this way: Each house occupied by one of your stones is included in your territory. An unoccupied house is included in your territory if it is not possible to travel along streets from that house to some enemy stone without first visiting one of your own stones.
Eventually, each player can only place stones within his own territory. Then the game is over. The winner is the player whose territory includes the most houses.

That's all!

HexGo was inspired by the classic games Hex, Go, Tanbo, and Star.

name: Heroes of Renown
description:
Heroes of Renown is a tile exploration game where each tile has a special action that can be used to gain valuable supplies, money or other special actions.

Along the way you will need to fight off other heroes and neutral minions that are after the same actions.

You will need your supplies to construct powerful weapons and complete quests to become the most powerful hero.

Each combat you enter has the chance to reward you victory points and experience points which will raise your hero to a stronger level.

Every quest and weapon you complete will also gain you victory points and bonus actions.
mechanics: Action Points, Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Set Collection, Tile Placement, Variable Player Powers, Worker Placement

name: Identity Pursuit
description:
From the rules:
"Identity Pursuit is a game that uses the concept of archetypes to challenge you and your fellow players to look more closely at how you see yourselves and each other."

Each player begins by placing a pawn on the starting square and drawing four cards, each of which names and describes and archetype such as "mother" or "adventurer." Three cards are kept and the fourth, which the player least identifies with, is placed face-up in front of the player.

In turn, each player either chooses a card from his/her hand or one of the face-up cards from another player and finds the corresponding question with multiple choice answers in a booklet. The player reads the question without comment and then chooses his or her answer and records it secret with the "players choice wheel." The other players may then discuss the question and then provide their answers to the question. Finally, the current player reads the definition of the archetype and the "correct" answer (i.e. the one that corresponds best to the archetype). The current player then moves his or her pawn on the track a number or spaces depending on how well his/her answer matches the other players' answers.

After playing a card from his/her hand, the current player then draws another card.

The first player to reach the end of the track wins.

name: Fayre of the Forgotten
description:
Fayre of the Forgotten plays on an abandoned funfair around 1900.

The tragedy began when a new mirror arrived for the main attraction of the fayre - the Hall of Mirrors. The mirror was rumored to be a powerful magical artifact. But instead of granting wishes and riches, it shattered souls the instant someone glimpsed his or her reflection in it. No visitors come to the fayre anymore as it is a soulless place - and each of the seven proprietors also wants to leave, but as everyone of them has looked into the mirror, their souls are broken. They need to recover their ...or at least a ... complete soul before they can leave. To collect all 20 soul shards the players visit fayre attractions, play action cards, and take control of the attractions. However, there are more aggressive ways to acquire soul shards, as there are ways to just trade your soul shards with an opponent, whether he likes it or not. But beware: exchanging a soul is likely to drive you insane.

The Fayre is designed for two players, where it has a nice tactical level. But it is also fun for up to 5 players, where gambling and the ability to react to the present situation become more important. A soul exchange at the right moment can win or lose the game.

Nebil Abdulgadir, known from big computer game successes like Crysis as well as for his oil paintings in the art scene, is responsible for the great artwork in this game.

name: Torii: Sohei Starter Box
description:
Torii is a skirmish wargame set on Feudal Japan, created by Miniatures and Wargames to use Zenit Miniatures’ range of miniatures (specifically Kensei’s)
In Torii you’ll have to lead a group of about 8-12 warriors that will have work together to accomplish their clan objectives.

Every game is different. Scenery, main and secondary missions will change, so you’ll never get bored of playing Torii.

Torii is quick to learn, with great tactical and strategic depth, with a duration of about 45-60 minutes.
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Cercas
description:
CERCAS (fences in Spanish) is a 2 player game

Materials
A sheet with a 8x8 grid made up of dots and 2 pencils

Setup
Draw lines along the outer points of the 8x8 grid, making the edge of the board

Definitions
Open Area - At the start of the game, the entire board is considered the open area

Closed Areas - A Closed Area is made up of a minimum of 1 space and a maximum of 5 spaces

Play
The board starts out empty

One player is “X” the other “O”

Decide who goes first, turns then alternate

On a turn,

Draw an orthogonal line end to end connecting either, two, three or four points, then place one of your marks on an empty space adjacent to one of the lines you've just drawn

The game ends when a player is unable to take his turn

Restrictions

Your mark may be Diagonally adjacent to your opponents mark, but not Orthogonally adjacent and no more than three lines may be drawn extending from a single point

Clarifications
A combination of the edge of the board and lines drawn in by the players make up an enclosed area

Scoring
A player with a majority of friendly marks within an enclosed area, scores the number of spaces within that area.

Tied areas and areas made up of a single empty space are not scored, highest score wins.

name: Lost Planet
description:
From the designer (English):
Lost Planet is a game that simulates the colonization of the first planet found outside the solar system. Initially this planet is called Lost Planet by the mass media for being the only in this foreign solar system. Players represent corporations that send staff and resources from the Earth to carry out the colonization of the Lost Planet.

On each turn the active player chooses the resources of a corporation and distributes the resources in a rondel of actions, then the player chooses an action and the resources that are therein, with which that player can build improvements for terraforming the planet.

The game ends with the construction of the basics, hangars, homes and farms crop, which will enable the arrival of the Earth' mother ship with thousands of humans. But ... what if the planet is not completely uninhabited? Will the Big corporations face the dangers of the Lost Planet?

From the designer (Spanish):
Lost Planet es un juego que simula la colonización del primer planeta encontrado fuera del sistema solar. Inicialmente a este planeta los medios de comunicación lo llamaron Lost Planet por ser el único planeta de ese sistema solar. Los jugadores representan a las corporaciones que envían el personal y los recursos necesarios desde el planeta Tierra para llevar a cabo la colonización.

En cada turno el jugador escoge los recursos de una corporación y se reparten en un rondel de acciones, posteriormente el jugador escogerá una acción y se llevará los recursos que haya en ella, con los que podrá construir mejoras para la terraformación del planeta.

El juego finalizará con la construcción de los elementos básicos, hangares, viviendas y granjas de cultivo, que harán posible la llegada de las naves nodriza con miles de humanos des de la Tierra. Pero… ¿y si el planeta no está totalmente deshabitado? ¿Lograrán las corporaciones afrontar los peligros del planeta perdido?
mechanics: Action Queue, Area Majority / Influence, Stock Holding

name: Alienish
description:
The aliens are coming! Are they coming in peace? Have they abducted anyone famous? Who is the best rock band in the galaxy? We need answers and we need them now. This is why we train you as our diplomat for the upcoming galactic council. However, only those who master the exotic alien language will represent us humans, as a minor slip of a tongue can turn a space flight into a space fight.

Alienish is a game of mastering alien languages. You and your rival diplomats are trying to learn an alien language. Be the first to correctly pronounce the alien symbols on the flash cards to gain fluency points. Make a mistake, and you lose fluency points. In the first round, a pronunciation table helps you read the foreign letters the right way. However, in the second round, this table is hidden and you must rely on your memory. The diplomat who has the most fluency points at the end of the second round wins the game.
categories: Card Game, Humor, Memory, Science Fiction

name: Dryden Space Battles
description: Dryden Space Battles is a tabletop wargame played between opposing fleets of starships in the Dryden Scifi universe. Rather than plastic pieces, the ships are printed on card stock. Each is upgradable with specialized equipment and crew.
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Tile Placement

name: Zodiac 111
description:
Zodiac 111 is a Canasta variant using a special 111-card deck; the cards display the Sun, the Moon, the planets excluding Earth, and the signs of the zodiac, with the Aquarius cards (which come in two colors) being the most significant.

Play is much as in Canasta but players are dealt more cards than usual (15), there are wild cards, and there are some other changes in scoring and in requirements for going out.

The most notable feature of the game is its large and unusual packaging; the cards, rules, and score pad were strapped into slots in a large plastic disc molded to look like the surface of the Moon, the disk was covered by a transparent plastic dome imprinted with the game's name and zodiac symbols, with this whole arrangement packaged in a lightweight cardboard box.

It's not clear if this game was actually published or only exists in final prototype or sales sample form; one is tempted to conclude that the packaging ended up not being cost-effective. Stancraft appears to have licensed the game, but from whom is not stated; it may have appeared in other countries as Zodiac International but that is also not clear.

name: Jumping Frog
description:
Can you guide your frog successfully across the big roaring river? Can you stop the other players doing the same? First across the river get the most flies, but the race last three heats.

Each player controls a frog, trying to get the frog safely across the river reaching the big pile of flies, while at the same time trying to prevent the other players reaching the same goal. The game is played over 3 heats, and whoever has done best overall wins the game.

Why don’t the frogs just jump into the river and swim across? Because the river has a strong and unpredictable current, and to this day no frog has ever managed to swim across, and they have all been washed back to the shore furthest from the flies.

The board is build randomly for each game, with 25 out of 32 tiles. 5 of the remaining 7 tiles is placed by the players on the board, and thereby pushes out 5 other tiles, while at the same time the players tries to jump their frog across the river.

The object is therefore to optimize your own way across the river, and at the same time prevent the other players way across the river. Points can be used for extra power, and you have to judge whether to spend points in order to gain more points later in the game.

name: Het Gezelschapsspel van Deinze
description:
Deinze is a small city in the little country called Belgium, it has alway's been small.
But it has a rich History and had important rolles in the history of Brugges, Ghent, Courtrai and Oudenaarde.

The game has been created as part of a project to make people more aware of these historical events and for people to get to know Deinze

The goal of the game is to be the first one to get, with the golden ring, to the Castle of Ooidonck. This by collecting the ring from 1 of the treasurechests or stealing it from an other player. Before you can enter the castle, you must also collect a key to open the gate. Moving is done by rolling 2 dice in combination with paying cards for the directions you want to go. Cards are collected when you stop your movent on a square with a Jayceelogo, that will grant you a combination of direction cards as a reward, or you can get 2 direction cards by skipping your turn.

The game has been made in a very limited run of 300 pieces.

name: Audatia: Liechtenauer Expansion Pack
description:
Audatia: Liechtenauer Expansion Pack expands an Audatia Duel Deck with fencing techniques from Johannes Liechtenauer's German style of longsword fighting.

The expansion enables you to use guard positions and various special strikes and techniques from the repertoire of Meister Johannes Liechtenauer.
categories: Card Game, Educational, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Medieval

name: Wolfgang Amadeus Mozart Melody Dicer for Piano
description:
Working from a workbook, players roll two dice and look up the results on a table. This corresponds to a measure on sheet music.

Copy these notes to the provided blank sheet music paper.

Each player keeps rolling until their composition is finished and everyone votes on which they like best.

name: The Throne
description:
The Throne is a fun and easy card game where players strive to be the new King of the Seven Kingdoms.
Each turn players draw and play cards that represent the places and the characters in the saga. Each has a value, and some have an effect that brings an advantage to the player who plays it. The game ends when the court of a player reaches a certain number of cards. Who accumulates the most points wins and becomes King until it dies in a hunt for wild boar or poisoned by a cup of wine during her marriage.

ENJOY!
categories: Card Game, Fantasy, Medieval, Novel-based, Print & Play

name: Conversion Go
description:
Introduction1. Conversion Go is a territory game for two players, Black and White, who alternately put stones of their color on the board.

2. The board is a 16x16 grid (counting the points rather than the squares). At the beginning the board is empty, with play taking place on the points.



Play3. A corner point is considered to belong to both edges that meet there.

4. It is permissible to pass. If both players pass consecutively, the game concludes.

5. It is not permissible to "mirror" the opponent's moves ten or more turns in succession.

6. The beginning of the game is governed by a "refined" pie rule. Player 1 plays two moves for Black and one move for White. One or more of those moves can be passes. Player 2 then decides which side to take, with White to move.

7. A group is a set of one or more like-colored, orthogonally adjacent stones. A liberty of a group is an empty point orthogonally adjacent to it. A dead group is a group that has no liberties and touches less than two sides of the board. To convert a group means to remove it from the board and replace it with stones of the opposite color. After a player's move, first all dead groups of the opponent's color are converted, then all dead groups of the player's color in the resulting position are converted.

8. The game concludes when both players pass consecutively. Any stones that cannot escape conversion are now automatically converted. Each player then figures his score, which is the number of his stones on the board plus the territory (vacant points) they surround. The player with the higher score wins.



NotesDespite the fact that stones are converted and re-converted, the game can be played neatly with pen-and-paper. The reason is that the color of any "X"ed stones is always clear: it is the color of the living formation which ultimately encloses them.

If played on an odd-sized board by players trying to win, the game will never end in a tie. Oddly enough, this is possible thanks to the fact that suicide moves are allowed, as this prevents local impasses ("seki") with an odd number of points in them.

name: The Zombie Rises
description:
The cemetery is dark, barely lit by the moonless sky. The graves are still in the blustering, howling winds. You awake in this desolate place. But you are not alone. There are others, fellow captives, near you. And the dead, beneath you. At least, you hope they are dead.

You glance around to find the main gate, closed, and locked with a combination. Stumbling towards it, you notice a figure reaching through the gate. A dead man with a bloody note in his hand. You grab the note and see the clues. The clues to your survival and freedom.

A muffled scream breaks the silence.

You and your fellow captives dreadfully turn, hoping the source is not near. You grab the hanging lantern, and light it, revealing some headstones. The appear to be dirty and must be cleared to find the numbers to the combination.

Summoning courage, you step forward, but hear the bloodthirsty, muffled scream again. And again. It's getting closer.

Can you figure out the combination to the gate, before The Zombie Rises?

The Zombie Rises is a cooperative game, pitting you and your fellow captives against the Zombie. Working together, you must keep the Lantern lit and uncover graves to find the numbers to unlock the gate. Move quickly, collect tools, clear obstacles, and break into mausoleums, all with the goal of gaining your freedom.

But the deck is stacked against you. Pull The Zombie Rises card six times, and you’re all dead. Guess the combination before then, and your lives are spared.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Grid Movement, Modular Board

name: Jogo do Timão
description: Jogo do Timão is a trivia game about the Brazilian soccer team Corinthians Football Club. Each player tries to score goals by moving on the board, reaching the opposing goal and answering questions, while avoiding faults and penalties.
mechanics: Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Memory, Roll / Spin and Move, Take That

name: Dragon Ball Z: O Desafio do Dragão
description: Dragon Ball Z - O Desafio do Dragão is a trivia game about the Japanese anime Dragon Ball Z. Each player controls a character and moves along the board answering questions concerning the Dragon Ball saga. The question cards has 3 distinct levels of difficulties: easy (blue), average (yellow) and hard (red). Each turn the player rolls and move and has to answer a question by the level shown on the space he is currently in. If he is correct, he moves further, if he do not, he moves backward. The first player to reach the end of the board wins the game.
categories: Comic Book / Strip, Party Game, Trivia
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Eco Planeta
description: Eco Planeta is a light, educational game that simulates the work of a Environmental NGO trying to avoid the extinction and ill-treatment of animals on the planet. The board is made up of tracks on the world map. Players ramdomly pick an objective card and try to save several animals (lion, dolphin, panda, polar bear, golden lion tamarin, Penguin) from extinction by visiting their locations. Fulfilled the goal, the player draws a new objective, and keep going until all the animals have been saved from extinction.
mechanics: Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Recicla Mundo
description: Recicla Mundo is a light trivia board game about recycling waste. Players receive cards with colors related to a type of waste and replace them with plastic sheets, putting them in their production and consumption areas,while putting the opponents' chips in their collection and recycling area. During the game, players answer questions about recycling and if he is correct, he exchanges an opponent's chips in the collecting area for chips of their color and puts them in their own consumption area. After completely filling his consumption area with your chips, a player must fill his own collection area. The player who fills is the first to fill their two areas wins the game.
categories: Children's Game, Environmental, Industry / Manufacturing, Trivia
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move, Tile Placement

name: Meu Mundo Melhor
description: Meu Mundo Melhor is a children's game about saving the environment. The board has a set of 15 chips showing several damaged natural environment with different shapes and colors. Each player receives an equal number of chips and each round the players spins the wheel and check the shape and color showed, and if he has the corresponding chip he places the image on the board on the corresponding chip area. If a player don't have the corresponding chip, he lose his turn. The player wins by being the first player to put all his pieces on the board.

name: Imagination
description:
Children's game from Avalon Hill.

"Avalon Hill launched a pre-school children's line in 1963 with four games, Imagination, What Time Is It?, Doll House and Trucks, Trains, Boats & Planes, which flopped. Roberts gave up and planned to file bankruptcy on December 13, 1963." From the "The General Magazine Index and Company History", 1980.

name: What Time Is It?
description:
Children's game from Avalon Hill.

"Avalon Hill launched a pre-school children's line in 1963 with four games, Imagination, What Time Is It?, Doll House and Trucks, Trains, Boats & Planes, which flopped. Roberts gave up and planned to file bankruptcy on December 13, 1963." From the "The General Magazine Index and Company History", 1980.

name: Project Vanquish
description:
Inspired by the classic EGA Trek computer game, Project Vanquish puts you in the captain's chair as you explore space on behalf of the Grand Alliance and protect the galaxy from the hostile Harzaq Empire.

Encounter enemy ships, space anomalies, mysterious ancient artifacts and more. Setup is minimal so you can get playing right away.

Your ship is your baby, and you can customize it with powerful abilities and variable weapons, systems, shields and maneuver ratings.

Project Vanquish supports both solitaire and competitive play, so you can enjoy it anytime you like.
mechanics: Action Queue, Grid Movement, Hand Management, Variable Player Powers

name: Das Berlin-Spiel
description: A Monopoly-like boardgame, with typical Companies or Landmarks of Berlin.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Stock Holding, Trading

name: Treasure of the Cruel Captain
description:
A coin as a game board? Why not explore numismatics in a playful way! Roll the dice now and find the "cruel" captain’s treasure.

Two players of all ages can now both try their luck on this unique board game on a coin.

The determined treasure hunter starts in a pirate ship and rolls the dice in order to reach the "cruel" captain’s treasure on the bottom of the ocean as quickly as possible. In doing so, it is necessary to overcome obstacles and above all, have fun!

name: Ballistic Reign
description:
Description from the publisher:

War has come to the World of Indines. As the Mercenary King Gerard Matranga makes his bid to become the absolute ruler of Relecour, the fearful barons lock themselves away in fortresses of ancient stone. Mercenaries from across the world take to the field of battle, waging a proxy war on behalf of their opulent masters.

Take control of one of the Mercenary Companies of Indines in Ballistic Reign and put your mastery of battlefield strategy to the test! Build great siege engines, cast powerful war magic, and erect impenetrable fortresses on the field of battle. Use your workers carefully to balance between maintaining your forces and manning the units and structures you build. Invest your time in spell research, economic development, defense, and offense by working together and against other mercenary companies and capturing neutral locations in your campaign. Only the shrewdest tactician will be able to conquer their foe and bring peace to Indines once more!

Play as ten different Mercenary companies from the World of Indines universe, each with their own weapons, spells, and leader! Recruit from over seventy different units and strongholds to build your forces!
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Open Drafting, Variable Player Powers

name: RICO: 6th player expansion for GAMBONI
description:
With this expansion of GAMBONI, you can play with a 6th player. The goal of the 6th player is to STOP all other players or to GET RICH while "helping" them (taking bribes).

There are three characters in RICO:


The Police Chief, special ability: Reclaim territory for the city (max 5 spots)
The FBI agent, special ability: Play an FBI card of choice.
The Federal judge, special ability: Raise or lower any player's bail (max 5 pts).


The expansion contains 3 new character cards and a set of simple instructions.

The 6th player wins the game if he manages to get all other players down to the "Street Thug" level on the score ladder, or when collecting a certain sum of cash.

name: Mercado Sustentável
description: Mercado Sustentável is a roll and move, buy/sell stock game. At each space on the board the players can buy companies, pay fees, receive dividends or pay debts to creditors (other players). In some areas, however, the players can purchase 4 types of certificate cards ("market", "Technology", "social" and "environmental") so that each time other players lands on one of your companies, you can exchange a certificate card for a certificate chip, upgrading your company. Whenever another player lands there the company owner must pay dividends for the company certificates of others players. During the game, players can also adquire charges or dividends cards, which provide information on sustainable business growth. When only one player remains in play, exhausting all resources of other players, he or she is the winner of the game.
mechanics: Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Stock Holding

name: Caça ao Mosquito da Dengue
description: In Caça ao Mosquito da Dengue players are trying to prevent Dengue fever from spreading by finding nests of mosquitos on opponent's headquarter. Each round, on the player's turn, he guesses where the nest could be at the other's grid by saying a combination of color and number, if you miss, the opponent marks the area with "X", and pass his turn. If guess is correct he marks the combination on his grid to complete the object (rail, vessel, tire, water tank or bottle) receiving the correspondent card. Victory goes to the player who collect 5 different kind of cards first, and the others continue to set the 2nd and 3rd places.

name: Flash Assassins
description:
Flash Assassins is a easy-to-setup, moderator-free update of the classic game Assassins. To play, just deal the assassin cards out, shift the target tokens, draw your character, and start hunting your friends.

Flash Assassins has a number of improvements on the classic game:


Three minute setup.
It can be played with 3-30 players.
Games can last anywhere from 5 minutes to 5 years.
There are a variety of weapons to choose from - one for every setting, level of physical activity, and desired duration of game.
It can be played almost anywhere: at home, in a park, in a pub, in the car, and in the office.


GAMEPLAY
After characters and targets are assigned using the Flash Assassins character cards and target tokens, the game begins and players try to assassinate each other following the rules for each weapon while avoiding being killed themselves.

Players can only assassinate their target. Once they kill their target, they acquire the target of the killed player. The killed player should tell their killer the name of their target and hand over their Target token.

The game is not played in rounds or turns but continuously within whatever time and place boundaries the group agrees on.

The last player left in the game is the winner.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Party Game, Print & Play

name: Be A Bard
description: A party game for people who like to tell stories that make no sense. For two players or more, but best with at least three, players tell the story according to the image on the card they play. Players can sabotage other players by killing cards in their hands, reversing the order of play, making them miss a go altogether, etc. There's no text, leaving the images totally open to interpretation, and the winner is the first person to lose all their cards.

name: Rhym-A-Gram
description:
This is a party game with potentially unlimited numbers of players (in teams if necessary). It involves solving crossword puzzles as clues are read aloud. There are 15 sets of ten cards, each of which has a riddle clue to one of the 10 5-letter solutions needed to complete a 5x5 grid. Each set also has a key card with the answers.

One player becomes the Regent, donning a Mortarboard and choosing which set of cards to use. Next to him sits the Bard, who wears a badge and reads the clues aloud. When a player thinks he has solved the full puzzle, he calls Rhym-A-Gram, and all players' answers are checked.

One point is given for each correct answer (10 max), and the high-scorer becomes Regent, the second-highest the next Bard, and the lowest scorer must put on a cheezy dunce cap until some other player manages to do even worse.

In the event of a tie, players draw blind from a Poet deck. Each Poet card has a five-letter word and players must spontaneously come up with a rhyme using the word. Non-tied players judge the result.
categories: Card Game, Party Game, Word Game

name: The Three Pillars: Batteries Not Required Expansion Set
description:
From the publisher:

UNLOCK YOUR POTENTIAL!

Not everything can be measured via technology. The paranormal by nature is intangible and thus can be discovered by means which also seem to be intangible. It’s time to get metaphysical! With new Cases, Pillars, Events and the all-new Psychic Deck, players can now take their investigations to the next level....and beyond.

THE THREE PILLARS™: BATTERIES NOT REQUIRED expansion requires the Premiere Set to play. With 34 all new cards, you can add to your existing decks or freshen them up completely!

name: Steampunked Time Machine: Expansion #1
description:
This Expansion Pack adds 64 new cards to your Steampunked game including: new mad scientists, new quackery, new components, and new actions.

New Actions are: Destroy Quackery, Steal Quackery, Thwart Assembly.

Special is the Edison Inventor card.

name: Trail
description:
Trail, copyright 1903 and 1904, is a card game where two to eight players represent hunters chasing a fox. There are 53 cards: four suits of 13 hounds (numbered 1 to 13 with a corresponding number of dog heads in circles) plus a single card with a red fox.

The red hounds are the trump suit. The fox is a red suit card, and beats any other red except the 10, 11, 12 or 13.

Players cut for deal, and the dealer passes out a number of cards based on the number of players, from 20 for two players to 6 when there are eight. After the deal, the rest of the deck is placed face down on the table and is known as the reserve pile.

The player to the left of the dealer plays a first card, which becomes the Trail card. Each other player must play a card of the same suit if possible, or any other card if he has none. The trick is taken by the highest card in the Trail suit unless overtaken by any red card, in which case the highest value red takes the trick.

The winner of the trick must discard one card from his hand and replace it with the one on top of the reserve pile. Once the reserve pile runs out, play continues until all cards in the hands have been exhausted.

All cards of 10 or higher in the trick, as well as all red cards, are placed in the "kennel" in front of the player and count for points.

The player holding the fox may play it at any time except as a Trail card. If the fox (which beats anything but 10-13 of red) wins the trick, that player gets five bonus points. If another player takes the trick with the fox by playing a high red, that players gets five points. If the Trail card is a red 10+, the fox must be played if held.

The fox is "caught" in the final count. Whichever player has the largest number of red hounds in his kennel (each card counting its number, i.e. the red 10 counts as 10 hounds, the red three as three) gets 10 points for catching the fox.

Each player then gets 4 points for each #13 card held, 3 for each #12, 2 for each #11 and 1 for each #10. This provides a maximum number of points available in a round as 55. This also is the number of points required to win the game, so a game usually consists of two or more rounds.
The box also includes rules for six other games using the same cards: Chase, Dogon, Red Heads, Numbers, Word Building, and Finding a Sweetheart.

name: The Witch-Hunt
description:
Dark clouds linger over the City, a storm is looming...

Meanwhile, a dark Witch hides deep within the City, hellbent on bringing it to its knees. But, all hope is not lost. A holy Inquisitor, attracted by the growing corruption, has secretly come to the City and decided to uproot the insidious evil. The storm will shortly break on the City and it will either wash away the swelling corruption or those standing in its way.

The fate of the City lays in your hands.


The Witch-Hunt is an asymmetric strategy card game for 2 players, where they command their minions on a randomly generated board to fulfill their victory conditions:


The Goal of the Witch is to corrupt the City. Every Building has a numeric resistance marker, and the Witch uses her Cultists to spread the corruption. If the corruption reaches this threshold, a building becomes corrupted. The Witch wins when all buildings are corrupted.



The Goal of the Inquisitor is to find and kill the Witch. Hunters interrogate Cultists and Investigate Buildings. The Inquisitor wins when he finds out the location of the Witch and moves a Hunter there to kill her.
categories: Card Game, Deduction, Fantasy, Fighting, Medieval, Territory Building
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Grid Movement, Modular Board, Secret Unit Deployment, Variable Player Powers, Worker Placement

name: Sanning eller konka: Nellie
description: The old "truth or dare" game as a card game. The players does not need to make the dares or the questions up, instead they draw cards with secrets and missions. The game is in Swedish and very simple. The players plays truth or dare until everyone but the last person (the winner) has chickened out. The secrets and missions in the game are written by the blogger Nellie Berntsson.

name: Master of Kung Fu
description:
The Master of the Jade Temple School of Kung Fu has called out the students of the Demon Head School of Kung Fu for the lowlife, degenerate thugs that they are. Enraged, the warriors of the Demon Head School attack the Jade Temple, killing its Master and beating its students mercilessly. Some of the students, including the players, manage to escape into the Chinese countryside.

Players will need to heal themselves, train both physically and mentally, earn gold to acquire the weapons of Kung Fu, and raise their prestige in order to train with other masters and learn the secrets of Kung Fu styles. But the warriors of the Demon Head School are trailing the students and will attack from time to time. After nine years of training, a final showdown will occur. One student will succumb to his wounds and die after the fight. Of the survivors, only the student who has gained the most honor will emerge triumphant over the Demon Heads and re-establish the Jade Temple school as its new Master of Kung Fu.

The game begins with a draft of the supply and style cards. The main element of the rest of the game is worker placement. But there's a twist - there's only one "worker", themselves, to place each round. And instead of placing workers on action spaces, players place them BETWEEN action spaces to activate adjacent actions. Plus, the action spaces themselves are modular and change order and frequency each round, creating an ever-changing environment that challenges players to use adaptive strategy to be successful. Every three rounds, there is a Kingsburg-esque Attack Phase, in which players will use their acquired supplies and learned styles to defeat the enemies of their school.

name: Energy Superstar: Bid, Save, Win!
description: Welcome to Energy Superstar, the electrifying game show where good appliances mean big money! Be one of up to five contestants in this fast-paced, real-time bidding war. With only 20 seconds on the clock, scramble to outbid your opponents for shiny appliances and do your habits to earn Energy Stars. After seven rounds of auctions, the one with the most stars will be crowned winner, master bidder, and Energy Superstar!

name: The Game (1985)
description:
A drug dealing Monopoly variant from Holland, packaged as a plastic rolled board plus cards, dice and pieces in a tube.
The object is to buy and sell a certain amount of four different drugs.
When the sufficient quantity for a given drug is reached the player becomes 'superfly' for that drug.
The first player to become superfly in all 4 drugs is the winner.
Each player has 4 'Heavies' in the form of plastic pawns which are positioned on one side of the board and can intercept opponents.
One side of the board has buying ports and the opposite selling ports.
There are 4 decks of cards: Buy Port Cards, Sell Port Cards, Deal Cards and Karma Cards.

name: Tricky3
description:
Tricky3 is a simple dice game in which players try to get three in a row on the 7x3 board.

The spaces on the board show three or four circles in one of three colors (blue, red or yellow). The four dice are regular six-sided dice with colors on them.

On a turn a player gets to roll the dice twice and they try to roll the same colors as one of the spaces on the board. If they do, they get to place one of their pawns there.
If all four dice show one color you also have the option of removing a pawn of an opposing player. If you get three in a row, you win.

name: Court
description:
Court is played by two people with a deck of 24 cards: four suits (Gold, Blue, Black and Red) each with six different cards. These Cards are ranked by value: Crown (10), Royal (8), Knight (3), Esquire (2), Standard (1) and Jester (no value).

There are two other cards of no value in each suit (Retainers and Serfs) available for a four player game. There also are rules for a three-player game.

Each player starts with a hand of six, and a card is then turned to determine the Court color (trump) for that round. Players try to accumulate pairs that together will add up to a value of 60 or more. The winner of a round then gets one or more points, with the first to seven points declaring victory.

The rules are somewhat complex, including ones covering use of a Jester to obtain another card, scoring for same color Crown and Royal, closing each round, and multiple victory points in a single round.

name: Medical Trivia
description:
This is a set of expansion cards published in 1985 by Eli Lilly, a pharmaceutical manufacturer. They are designed to be used with classic Trivial Pursuit.

There are six categories:

Great Names In Medicine
Pharmacology
Specialty Medicine
Diagnosis
Great Discoveries In Medicine
Medical Curiosities

The difficulty level is quite high; these cards were obviously designed for a target audience of medical professionals.

name: Election Day 2016
description:
Simulate the historic election of 2016 with Election Day 2016.

Play as Donald Trump or Hillary Clinton as the two candidates fight it out for the majority of Electoral Votes. Or, if you prefer, try Ted Cruz, Bernie Sanders, Marco Rubio, or even Joe Biden in this game of electoral politics.

Players customize a deck of cards unique to their party. By fighting over fifteen swing states--or more!--players try and gain support by mastering issues such as Health Care or Income Inequality, appealing to demographics like Single Women or Libertarians, and mold the political landscape by changing a Region's focus from, say Economic concerns to Foreign Affairs.

Spin random events so they come out in your favor. Manipulate the media so your issues come out on top. Build Grassroots Support to surprise your opponent on election day. Pick from four different Vice Presidential candidates to give your campaign a boost.

Do whatever it takes to win the White House in November!

NOTE: Print and play instructions are located in the forum.
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Political, Print & Play
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Hand Management, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Player Powers

name: Card Fusion Chaos
description:
For centuries, the heroes of the world have used the power of Millennium Blades trading cards to protect the world from evil. The most powerful weapons in their arsenal were Fusion Cards – cards that combined the incredible powers hidden away within the game, bringing out their true potential. With the world in chaos once more, a new champion must master Card Fusion in order to defend earth!

Using your collection of trading cards and mystical Fusion Gems in Card Fusion Chaos, you combine cards together to create the most unbalanced, overpowered cards you can imagine. Clash with your rival to uncover shards of the Master Fusion Gem. The first player who can acquire enough shards to assemble the Master Gem will be declared the new champion of earth!

Card Fusion Chaos includes more than eighty already-overpowered trading cards that you can combine into more than 350,000 unique fusion combinations!

name: Highland Games
description:
From the box:
"Explore & Discover Scottish Heritage & History. You don't have to be Scottish to enjoy the game."

User description:
The game contains 48 cards in each of five categories:

Myths & Legends;
Tartans & Clans;
Rhymes & Pastimes;
Regiments & Castles; and
People, Places & Events.


There is also a six-sided die with a different color on each face, plus a smaller set of cards called "The Sporran" and another called "The Laird's Castle", both of which have special instructions on them.

On his/her turn each player rolls the die and attempts to answer the question on a card in the category with the matching color. If successful, the player then draws a Sporran card and follows the directions there. This could be to roll the die again and answer another question, or proceed directly to the Laird's Castle. Cards in the Castle set have further instructions, or the game could end if the player turns up the "Chief's Badge" card.

When four or more players are involved, the instructions suggest forming teams.

name: Qal
description:
From the instruction sheet:
"Qal" -- pronounced "Cal" -- is a Bible-times word that means "to remember." Qal is an interesting and challenging game of memory -- one where even younger non-readers can compete effectively with adults and teens. ...
The object of the game is to find and match as many of the 18 different Bible symbols as possible. When played for advanced learning, the secondary object is to find the Bible verse which is referenced by the matched symbol. ...
After all symbols have been matched, players count the number of markers they have collected to determine the winner.

name: Brave 4 in 1 Game Box
description:
From the box:
"Enjoy hours of fun! Use these playing cards to play the exciting action game, or a number of other card games! Use the cards to build images as fast as you can in the Mega Memo Game or make a fun puzzle!"

User description:

The box contains two sizes of cards: one 16-card set that is 90mm x 125mm (approximately 3-3/8 x 4-3/4), and one 52-card "bridge-size" deck (63mm x 88mm) split into two packets. The large cards are two-sided -- one side has a portion of a larger picture, while the other side has portraits of the various characters from the Pixar movie "Brave", along with assorted numbers and symbols.

In addition to the standard suit and number markings on the smaller deck, some of the cards have other symbols on them, such as a bow, a sword, a kettle, etc. These symbols are used in the "Action Game", which is a mix of Fluxx and Uno.

The "Mega Memo Game" uses both the large and small cards. The large cards are placed in the middle of the table with the main picture side up. The smaller cards are all dealt out to the players. The top large card is turned over revealing the character portrait and perhaps a number and/or symbol. The players race to see who can match these revealed items with pictures and/or symbols and/or numbers using the smaller cards in their hands. The first to do so claims the large card. The player with the most large cards wins.

The large cards can also be turned over and put together puzzle-fashion to make a group shot of the main characters from the movie.

And finally, the smaller cards can be used to play any regular card game.
categories: Card Game, Fantasy, Medieval, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Puzzle

name: What Do You Buy?
description:
The game What Do You Buy? consists of a series of cards representing tradesmen, each of which has an associated number of items for sale. The trades cards and items are distributed to the players. A narrator reads aloud a story contained in the rules booklet, and at each blank in the story looks at one of the players, who then turns over the top item in their stack and reads it aloud. It is a party game intended to provoke merriment.

The original version was published c. 1850 in London by J. Passmore as The Laughable Game of What D'Ye Buy? by Professor Punch, and featured 12 finely hand-colored engraved trades cards, 72 letterpress cards, and a 20-page booklet, all contained in a wooden box with an illustrated sliding lid.

Later versions were published by McLoughlin Brothers c. 1870 and in an "improved" version in the early 1900s. McLoughlin also published a simpler variant, What Do You Buy? with only eight trades — butcher, druggist, music store, furniture, fish market, bakery, dry goods and toy store — each with five items available. For example:

16: "Wishing to have something new to wear at a dinner party Susette was to give, I tried on AN ACCORDIOON.
17. Susette laughed, and said it fitted like A LUMP OF DOUGH.
18. So instead I bought FIVE POUNDS OF TRIPE.

name: Word-O-Rama
description:
Word-O-Rama is a quiz or knowledge game for 3 or more players. Each player receives a pencil and a large pad printed with a 5x5 square. Like a bingo card, it has a "free" square in the middle, but there are spaces to the left for a vertical five-letter keyword, on top for 5 categories, and on the right for scoring.

The game box contains a spinner that goes from 1 to 75. To begin a game, the players make five spins to determine categories for the game. They spin one more time to determine the key word for the game. The rules include a table of 75 categories and 75 keywords.

The players then start a 10-minute hourglass-style timer. Within that time limit, they try to write down for each category an answer that begins with the corresponding letter of the keyword. The rules show as an example a game with the category "animals" in the first column and the keyword CARDS: correct answers could include "camel" on the first (C) line and "dog" on the fourth (D) line.

Players get 10 points for each valid answer, but only if it is unique. If two players pick the same word, they get 5 points each, and if three or more think alike, no one gets any points. Players get a bonus of 10 points for each fully completed vertical, horizontal or diagonal line on the card.

name: Vampire Cul-de-sac
description:
A tabletop game for up to 4 players ages 8 and up. It is Halloween night and you have to get as many of your trick-or-treaters back home to safety while avoiding getting killed by the very real vampires who are out hunting in your neighborhood.

Each player has a set of pawns representing your trick-or-treaters and 3 dice that match color.

On your turn, take your dice and one die from an opponent of your choice. Roll them.

Rolling 1, 2, 3 means you can move your trick-or-treaters that number of spaces.

Rolling V1 or V2 allows you to move the vampires that number of spaces.

If the + side of the die is rolled, take a die from another player and roll it.

The opponent’s die is treated differently than the player’s own dice. 1, 2, 3 you move your opponent’s trick-or-treater that number of spaces. You cannot move the opponent’s t-o-t to the same space as a vampire.

If the V1 or V2 is rolled, your opponent gets to move a vampire. Vampires can only be moved once on your turn.

If the + is rolled it is treated the same as above.

WINNING

When all trick-or-treaters have been saved (made it to the center space) or killed by vampires, the game is over. The player with the most safe trick-or-treaters wins. Ties are possible.

It is also possible (though rare) that the vampires can win if no trick-or-traters make it to the center.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Steampunked Time Machine: Expansion #2
description:
This Expansion Pack adds 64 new cards to your Steampunked game including: new mad scientists, new quackery, new components, and new actions.

New Actions: Inside Information, Monopolize, Purloin

Inventor card: Tesla

name: Monster Pageant
description:
Create monsters to enter into a monster pageant. The pageant judges are all looking for different things so make sure you prepare for judging as best you can!

The game is played using a school-yard pick where you create monsters by selecting cards that combine the different parts of a monster. Choose the legs & tails / torsos & arms / head combination that you think will "wow" the judges.

But just like every pageant, you can try to play foul to get ahead. Players have chances to "cheat" and gain an advantage over their competition. Strategy and tactics come into play as you choose the right time and place for your devious deeds.

Players choose from a shared supply where 5 of each type of monster body part is available. As cards are selected they are removed from the supply. Once removed cards form a gap of 2 or more, these gaps are refilled from the respective decks of body parts. Players select enough cards to each put forward 3 contestants into the pageant, one for each of the three judging rounds. Each monster will have an overall value made up from the traits represented on each body part, for example: hairy legs (value 2) + spikey torso (value 3), and a head that’s a little slimy (value 1) and a little hairy (value 1). Judges will give merit points to each monster based on their bias, and each judge is only interested in one trait. The first judging round is scored by one judge, two judges score the second round, and three judges score the third and final round.

The best monster in each judging round earns a player 3 points, with runners-up taking 2 points, good-looking losers earning 1 point, and everyone else 0 points!

Each player starts the game with 3 cheat tokens. These tokens can be spent during the pick phase to either: A) choose three cards on your turn instead of one, B) clear an entire row of cards, draw five more and then pick one, C) or take a peek at one of the judging cards to get information about what criteria will earns points during judging.

Any cheat tokens not spent during the picking phase are kept to the end of the game and earn the player an additional point towards their final score.

The player with the highest score at the end of the three judging rounds is the winner!

name: Morf
description: Morf is a type of charades but with drawing on paper instead of acting. The players draws, in turns, two cards, and must paint the two words on the cards, for example a camel and an umbrella. The other players must then come up with a name for what's pictured, for example "cambrella". The player that comes up with a word connected with the two "items" on the cards, get one point and move his/her pawn on the scoreboard. The player first to the center of the scoreboard (=19 points) in the winner.

name: DemocraSea
description:
A game of parrrlimentary procedure on the high seas!

After a mutiny, pirates aboard the good ship Due Process have struck on a more egalitarian way to divvy up treasure. Without a captain, players rely on their wits, political savvy, and a talking parrot to collect the most loot before the end of the voyage.

Each turn, players traverse the board performing sailing actions, which add loot to the game's treasure chest. When they reckon there's sufficient booty, one of the players calls for a parley to divide the loot. Players take turns secretly reaching into the chest to take a hidden share of loot. Once all the treasure is divided, pirates vote on whether to keep their hidden shares, or return the loot to the chest.

To gain the support of the crew, it's important to be fair. Just...not too fair. Will you take what you deserve? Or maybe a little extra? Can you trust the pirates who reached in before you?

DemocraSea is a great way to try your hand at politics, just be sure you know a reliable hook merchant.
mechanics: Modular Board, Push Your Luck, Team-Based Game, Voting

name: Jogo das Sombras
description:
In these card game for children, the players have usually 22 transparent cards with showing several animation characters, and the same amount of cardboard cards picturing only the contour of the same animation characters shown on the transparent cards.
The goal of the game is to make the combination of the transparent cards with the corespondent "shadow" cards, stimulating logical thinking, form and pattern recognition.
All shadow cards are shuffled and placed open in the table, and the transparent cards are also shuffled and placed in the table. All players try to make at the same time the maximal amount of matches combining one transparent and one shadow card.
The player with most matches at the end is the winner.
